Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoseLuisContreras
Reviews.Content: Beautiful settings, comfortable rooms and great and dedicated staff. Room service was very good but overpriced when you add delivery fees, automatic 20% gratuity etc. Same with laundry--and extra $2 to get your shirts folded etc make a perfect setting and hotel look like its penny pinching. Gym was somewhat small, but well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: pevast
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice surroundings, quiet area, close to town, perfect for business and vacation. A great hotel with a strong level of service. Staff helpful and observant. Rooms large, even the standrad ones. Balcony on the backside with morning sunrise. Nice pool area with a great view. It was just close to a perfect hotel experience. Brekfast was good, but not really up to what it could have been. Staff really tops but food selection not what you should expect. Buffe brekfast was my choice, overpriced in view of what you got. Pool cafe service needs in some parts more attention, not really up to full standard in terms of speed, price and service level. Otherwise, try to stay here, you will definately have a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the sun”
Reviews.Author: Marion C
Reviews.Content: My 22-year old son decided to take a year off after undergrad before he heads off to grad school so we decided to travel to a new place every month until school starts. Miami was an obvious choice to escape the Chicago winter weather. This hotel was great. The staff were attentive and the property is top-notch. The room was large with nice finishing touches. Miami's beaches were not what I remembered them to be, but the weather was certainly a welcomed change from the Chicago wind.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Oriental, Miami”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: Consistently excellent is the trend among Mandarin Oriental hotels and the Miami property is no exception. We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Miami last year for three nights but managed only one night this year: Some of the staff actually remembered us and were extremely gracious and accomodating. The room was fantastic, with a balcony and facing both the harbor and the downtown area with wonderful sunset views. The facilities are excellent and the hotel is highly recommended both for business and pleasure as it is in a very convenient location but yet has the feel of distance but not isolation.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent”
Reviews.Author: PsprtStampCollector
Reviews.Content: This is simply an excellent hotel for business or pleasure. I've stayed here four times, three times for business and once for a good friend's wedding. The construction/design, amenities, and most impressively, service, are all top notch. Pros: * Fantastic service. Gracious and low-key, but clearly willing to help with whatever you can dream up. My personal experience was excellent -- my friend who was married here had over-the-top service. The entire staff knew him (they most have taken a picture of him and distributed it) and he was addressed by name everywhere he went. * Fantastic design aesthetic. It is the typical MO Asian theme, but sleekly done and contemporary. The hotel is very new, and the design feels like it (although the service has the polish of an older venue). * Very nice sized rooms, and it appears that most (all?) have private outdoor space. * The restaurant and pool are both fantastic. Service, again, was very good, and I found the sushi to be top notch. Drinks were also very good. * The food on their events floor was very good, both for business conferences and the wedding. * As a wedding venue, it was superb. The staff was excellent, the setting was great, and the large outdoor terrace was put to good use for a superb scotch and cigar bar. * I was also impressed with their use of the beach area for a welcome dinner. Cons * Location, sort of. It is a prime business location on Brickell Key. However, it is a long way from South Beach, so if that is your scene, choose elsewhere. * While they do their "beach" area well, the reality is that you can't get into the water from the beach. It is really just a sandy area on top of a concrete sea wall. Excellent execution of the concept, but the concept has the inherent limitation of not providing access to the water. Not sure you'd want to get in the water right there anyways, as it is right at the mouth of the river and in the middle of a relatively busy boating thoroughfare.

Reviews.Title: “When you want the best service, quiet location away from busy South Beach this is the ultimate place to hang around.”
Reviews.Author: loverofdogs
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this MO several times and love the location. I usually spend more time using the facilities (spa,pool, restaurants) when I stay here. This area is growing...we were able to walk to some great restaurants right over the bridge...the nightlife is getting popular as well. It's a nice change from South Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: WanderingScotty
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on the way back from the gulf coast. Hotel is in a great location, on a man made island to the south of Miami, and a short walk over the bridge takes you to some groovy and lively restaurants. Welcoming friendly front desk staff and porters, but had possibly the rudest man ever on the phone trying to sort out the wifi, and had to hang up on him and take ipads etc down to the front desk to get connected. But the nasty guy aside, all staff who we actually met were very good indeed. Which brings me to the cost.Mad $15 charge for wifi connection in the room. And the rooms are mega expensive for the rather ordinary standard. Every room boasts a view but we were on the Miami side of the hotel and the view over the entrance was slightly forlorn, and from a rather Spartan little balcony. Room was fine, but little details let it down, like a glass vase above the bath clearly meant for flowers, but not containing any.Slightly tatty furnishings, but clean enough, and exceptionally nice bath robes. The location also makes it really convenient for the airport, which is only about twenty minutes away, but that sadly means it's also on the flight path, so expect a lot of aircraft noise from very early in the morning. Breakfast is taken on rather a lovely terrace overlooking the bay and was fine, but again very expensive. To sum up, it's obviously catering to one night pre-cruise clients who don't care very much about this leg of their journey, and so standards are perhaps not as high as other hotels in the chain. But if cost is no problem then for location and convenience, for one or two nights, it does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, shame about the noise and the extra costs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Firefly51
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe veranda room, which had a large balcony with 2 sun loungers overlooking the bay towards downtown Miami. It was a stunning view. The bed was large and comfortable, spotlessly clean room. The bathroom was missing a wall next to the bath so you could watch tv but had a blind that could be pulled down for privacy and the toilet was in its own room. The room felt expensive and it was worth the money. We booked through ebookers who hadn't stated that there would be an extra $70 per night tax charge. Internet was $35 for 3 days. I was charged an additional $10 for having a package delivered. The a la carte breakfast menu worked out at $90 for 2 people as every little thing was charged as extra. Dinner in Azul was nothing special but came with a very special price tag of $220 for 2, we only had 1 cocktail each and a starter and a main!!!! We had breakfast and other meals outside the hotel for the rest of our stay. The hotel makes as much money as possible from you. The only problem I had with this hotel other then the additional costs was the noise. The 2nd night we were woken at 6am by hammering, by 6.30am I couldn't take it any longer and called reception. They said they would get it stopped, it did for 10 mins and then started up again. Another call, another stop for 10mins then restart again. We went down to reception and found the front door covered in a big black cloth with no work men. We assumed the front door was damaged and they were fixing it and that was what all the noise was about. 3rd night 6.30am the hammering starts again. A very angry call to reception it stops and then restarts again just quieter. No work was done when guests were actually around in the lobby only when they were trying to sleep and the lobby was empty. A major complaint to the manager and all we got was $90 off our bill of $2630 as compensation, big deal!!! What about my lack of sleep when I was on holiday??? When we left we asked the bell boy what had actually been going on and he said the door wasn't broken they were replacing the carpet for tiles in the hallway. So the manager decided that rather then make noise when guests were in the lobby they would make noise when guests were sleeping. I am so angry that I was paying that much money per night to have my sleep broken for something that did not need to be done and could have been done during normal working hours. Mandarin Oriental you have your priorities seriously wrong!!! Guests stay in rooms to sleep not to admire your lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Tschony
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely property. Travelling solo, I stayed on the 16th floor with a super view of Miami, Key Biscayne and the ocean. The service was good, and the staff friendly. I love the decor. The linens are superbe, as is the bed. I wish the pillows were a little more featherlike. (I think they were polyfill). The hotel is in a great location for walking or running. There's a little shopping/restaurant neighbourhood nearby called the "grove". Nice restaurants, starbucks, what more could I ask. My only complaint is, with the cost of these rooms, why do we have to pay extra for internet and local calls?

Reviews.Title: “Holy Otoro, Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1_10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel numerous times and always enjoy my stay but this time was really special. The weather wasnt the best so we spent time in the Spa and the Gym, not a bad thing... As usual, the room was great with a magnificent view. You expect that from this level of Hotel and you get it. Really wasnt into the SOBE scene this trip as it was Super Bowl weekend so stayed either in the Hotel or local for meals. On Saturday night, we ate at the Sushi Bar at Cafe Sambal, we ate outside on Thursday and it was really nice. On Saturday, definately a stay-in night we went back, the sushi Chef, Mr. Wing and his assistant provided great service and a walk through the best fish south of Tokyo. Mr. Wing, when he noticed we were deliberating our order asked us to let him help and the magic began. It ended with the best Otoro I have ever had, 2 ways, first flamed lightly and second with a special sauce that was simply insane. Really, the best ever. Morimoto has nothing on Mr. Wing. We really enjoyed the service and the Staff made the night special. The Martini Bar in the Lobby was the next stop and enjoying one of them outside with the city before us was wonderful. Go to this Hotel, check in and don't leave.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Oriental Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ted_Fez
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the MO for a company meeting during the last week of January 2012. The whole experience was excellent. Check-in was swift and a positive experience. The hotel is decorated very nicely, so one immediately gets a feeling of being pampered and looked after. My room was large, nicely decorated, comfortable and quiet. It also had a terrific view looking back towards downtown across the bridge. The bed, ventilation system, enormous flat-panel TV and bathroom were all very nice. The location of the hotel is very good, and one can easily walk to other areas of downtown. Our meeting was held in several rooms on the fifth and sixth floors. The meeting rooms were very nice, quiet, and had good climate control. The food served at lunch and during breaks was excellent. I didn't get a chance to use the athletic facilities while I was there because of my busy schedule. Upon leaving, check out was quick and efficient. A big thumbs up for the Mandarin Oriental in my view.

Reviews.Title: “Iguanas included”
Reviews.Author: michaelcham1
Reviews.Content: Arriving jet-lagged from London in Miami you need a decent hotel and the Mandarin Oriental is just that - an oasis of calm amid the skyscrapers and a man-made beach to boot. Complete with iguanas. Yes, really. All four feet of them - sunning themselves as you burn in a lounger or prop up the bar. Rooms are spacious, cafe and poolside restaurant both offer sushi and fusion cooking. Service is efficient, even attentive. You honestly feel the hotel appreciates your custom. Now that's something that's been missing around the world for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but limited view...that's it!!!”
Reviews.Author: MRMTL
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel it was all about the view. I stayed for 1 night and was upgraded to the Deluxe Veranda room. While I appreciated the upgrade at the time I probably should have kept my standard city view room. First, the veranda is not very private, only a plant separates you from your neighbors. Second, the veranda has a lounge chair which is nice to relax on but the way the hotel is designed the veranda extends outward one floor lower than the lowest floor of hotel guest rooms. Therefore, everyone on the balconies above (25-30 floors of them) look down on you and after I glanced up twice finding people staring down on me I wondered why I paid over 300 dollars to feel like I was on display. Thirdly, when I called and asked for a thirty minute late checkout, I was told no because the "room type I was in was limited and sold out". I understand checkout time is checkout time but come on, I spent less than 24 hours in the hotel and hundreds of dollars for a five star experience, and I wound up rushing myself to checkout after a phone call ran 20 minutes long and again thinking, for the money, this was not worth it. Now if you want a view of the downtown Miami from your balcony this is the best you'll get. The view is limited since the hotel is built kind of u shaped so depending on where your room is the view is still stunning but not grand. My advice is for these prices to stay in south beach, and if you want a great view of Miami take a 4 mile walk (one-way) across the Venetian Causeway. It's free and just as private!!! In addition there is huge opening between the bedroom and bathroom which was weird (and I was alone). Even though the toilet is behind a separate door, I donâ€™t need to see into the sink and shower area and really wonder: who would?

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with topnotch service”
Reviews.Author: steelpanwoman
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the MO in Miami, and it did not disappoint! We love the staff, the food, and the great service. The prices are high, but then again you're paying for the great view and the great service. We were impressed that when I drove up to the hotel after an event, the valet recognized me and called me by name. He had not seen me drive our car before. That's pretty amazing. Loved our breakfast at Cafe Sambal and the 250 plus martinis at the M bar. Dining at Azul could have had a few more additions to their main courses.The only downer was that our room was across from the housekeeping closet, and that the shower door leaked, creating a puddle on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top service”
Reviews.Author: Insignia54
Reviews.Content: The service here was outstanding. All staff bent over backwards to anticipate and fulfill our needs. The location is gorgeous and handy to center city Miami locations. The price was reasonable for the quality. The only negative is the facility is a little "tired" in some areas and does not sparkle like newer Mandarins we have visited. The Rooms are great and the service attitude so positive it makes up for the slight refreshing neededn

Reviews.Title: “Great Splurge!”
Reviews.Author: NYCFishGirl
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable, the staff goes out of their way to be friendly (not typical in Miami) and their spa was great. The little pool/hot tub area was also nice, as was the lounge beach (not actual beach as you're on the bay). Walking distance to downtown Miami was awesome -getting through traffic to get to South Beach was not. Food was great -they make an awesome caffe latte with soy milk if you ask! Now if they'd add some tofu and gluten free soy sauce to their menu it would be even better.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to every detail, supurb customer service, and well appointed guest rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ranishi
Reviews.Content: Top of the line hotel. Views are excellent. The spa excels in every way. Luxuriously appointed rooms, especially the bathrooms. The hotel staff represent the hotel well and customer service is placed at a very high priority. Everyone is treated very well at the Mandarin just as any other Mandarin I have ever had the opportunity of staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: maya-boston
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with nice amenities including a private beach. Far from attractions like places to eat and south beach. Have to wait for a while for taxis depending on the time of day. We had a room facing the water which was beautiful Only downside to our room was there was no wall between the bathroom and bedroom...just a blind which made it hard for one person to use the bathroom while the other tried to sleep

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds; water and city views!”
Reviews.Author: DeTraveler05
Reviews.Content: A great location if you love water viewsâ€”but also want to walk to the city. Weâ€™d never been to Miami and wanted to see the cityâ€”but loved having the serenity of being surrounded by water. We stayed in a Jr. Suite (#1716) and had views of both from our room. The skyline lit up at night was great. The hotel is on a little island just off the coast so you have waterfront views and a 5 minute walk to the city. We visited the spa each day, took a taxi to see the Biltmore in Coral Gables &to see South beach, walked from the hotel across a short bridge to the Mary Brickell shops and restaurants (and Starbucks!) which was only 5-10 mins away. We walked the path that goes all the way around the (mostly residential) little island the hotel is on, and walked about 3 miles over to the nearest bridge we could see south of the hotel. That path is partially waterfront. There is no access to the water, but there is a waterfront beach area to sit near the water. Also a pool that you can see the water from. We dined at Azul for dinner one night and the food and service was great. For men, there is a closed toe shoe dress code which my husband wasnâ€™t prepared for, so we bought a pair of shoes at the shops we walked to. (They remind you when making the reservation of the dress code so it didnâ€™t seem we could slide by.) Breakfast was room service and was good. However, lunches were a letdown as they are primarily sushi which is fine for one or two meals but I was really ready for another option. We dined by the pool and in the cafÃ© for lunches and dinners . We found our male cafÃ© server to be brash and preferred the pool dining, which had a better staff--even though it had fewer menu options. We had some outstanding service hereâ€”and some not so good experiences too. Thatâ€™s to be expected as good people really do make a difference in any industry. Iâ€™d recommend NOT booking your massage with your room reservation on the Mandarin website. (They offer you a 10% discount if you do.) But then thereâ€™s no mechanism for actually scheduling your massage after you select to â€œadd itâ€� to your stayâ€”and we must have spoken with 5-6 people to actually get the 10% discount that booking the 80 minute massages with your room reservation is supposed to get you! So frustrating. We asked for a coffee maker in our room after reading in other reviews that itâ€™s not standardâ€”and they supplied us with one. We were also treated with an anniversary bottle of champagne in our room and a desert at Azul one night for our anniversayâ€”nice touches. One night we were woken by someone knocking on our room door despite the hour and despite the fact that our do not disturb light was on. With hearts beating out of our chests thinking there must be some kind of emergency, we went to the door to find an employee telling us he was there to remove some table. We think he had the wrong room. We also requested a copy of our bill a day in advance, were told it would be slid under our door at 3pm and it never arrived. So the service had its highs and lows but we were happy overall. We liked the hotelâ€™s location better than we did the actual comfort of the room itself but our view made up for it. The bathroom had that weird open wall between the bathtub and bed, very limited counter space in the bath, and a small shower wedged behind the bathroom door so that it had to be closed to open the shower door. This was in a jr. suite too. I wouldn't rate it great value for the money by any means. (We've had plunge pools in our rooms for the price we paid for the jr. suite!) We would certainly stay here again if we were in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Asian best brought to Miami.”
Reviews.Author: LeftGoose
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference at the Mandarin and it again lived up to the chain's reputation for excellence on all fronts.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you expect when you stay at a Mandarin!”
Reviews.Author: mikeyz2281
Reviews.Content: I travel quite frequently for work and try to stay at a Mandarin whenever I can. Service is excellent, the hotels are immaculate, the rooms are beautiful and the restaurants/bar/lounges are always great. The Mandarin Miami has a beautiful pool area, nice gym and on an island which allows you to take a nice jog/walk along the water. The views of south beach are breathtaking. The staff is courteous and helpful and the rooms are beautiful. Since the hotel is on a little island you will need to travel about 5/10 minutes to get to Mary brickell village/downtown Miami so it is a bit secluded. In my opinion its still definitely worth stating here. The Epic Hotel down the block is trying to be a swanky Mandarin but not worth it. The service/experience at the Mandarin is 10x better.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Mandarin Standards”
Reviews.Author: Efsane N
Reviews.Content: For sure, it is a great hotel. However, we have stayed in Bangkok over the New Year two years ago and it was a great treat. We have found out what makes it to one of the best hotels in the world. We did not have the same great expectations in Miami, but we were truly disappointed by the missing details.. Check-In : In Thailand we were made to believe that we are all VIP's because the moment you set foot on the propery some magical way everyone knew your name. In Miami, the check in was very very standard.. The receptionist asked us to show us the way and then he forgot, then he came and then he forgot to click the elevator buttons etc.. Cafe : No host to seat you, people wait up and noone ever welcomes them, there is supposedly a host but she/he was never there during our three days. Waiters just run around with no aim while people wait for their orders. One morning, someone welcomed us which was suprising but then the table she took us to was already taken :) Room : Toilet clogged during our stay. Our butler was not creative at all.. Rest of the hotel : We have not encountered one smiling face.. We seriously believe that all staff shall be taken one week to Bangkok to be taught what hospitality really means.. In short, these are all pretty stupid details, but again I am comparing Mandarin to Mandarin..

Reviews.Title: “Seems like they are in the event management, and not in the lodging business!”
Reviews.Author: ranger22miami
Reviews.Content: We are in the middle of a much-needed staycation at the Mandarin and we haven't had a minute's rest since last weekend. I agree with most other reviews regarding that the rooms are OK and that the service is indifferent. But really what has bothered me this time is the incessant noise coming from the lawn, where they are building a tent for what seems to be a big event... Same thing was happening when I attended a luncheon in December. It seems like the management at this hotel values their event guests more than their hotel guests. To make matters worse, there is some MAJOR CONSTRUCTION going on at the building next door to the Mandarin and there is heavy drilling non-stop from 8AM to 5PM. Both of these construction projects make it impossible to enjoy the peace & quiet that $400/night should get you! I am very disppointed in this hotel for not being able to secure a quiet and peaceful environment in the middle of such a great location. WILL NOT STAY HERE IN THE FUTURE, or recommend it to Miami visitors. If you are thinking about booking this hotel, ask them about the construction going on... It is deafening. We are looking forward to the loud party at the tent this weekend... Oy vey

Reviews.Title: “Great room, good view, poor service”
Reviews.Author: AlineGF
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to stay in Mandarin because I heard some great stuff about it. I really don't know what the fuzz is all about. The hotel has a good location, near downtown but sadly always from South Beach, the hottest place in Greater Miami. As our trip was not all vacation (we came to do some serious shopping!), this was not an issue for us. The hotel is very luxurious and our room (an executive room) was quiet, spacious and with a great view. But the shower is poor (I like strong water shower), the amenities are 3-star quality, the TV had some channels that simply had bad tune (and the hotel is unable to solve it), the air conditioner was impossible to set the perfect temperature, room service takes forever and, the worst, the service at breakfast was unaceptable (the waiter forgot to bring us spoons we asked 3 times!) and with lesser option than the 3-star hotel also stayed in this trip, in Boca Raton. Besides all that, parking and internet are very, very expensive. In this category of hotel, wi-fi should be free!

Reviews.Title: “good view but far from south beach”
Reviews.Author: sisal08
Reviews.Content: this hotel is not like other 5 star American hotel, there is no coffee machine,in the room the beds are not comfortable and too firm, I set the thermostat to 68 F to sleep better then thermostat automatically (after few hours ) changes to 72 F because has a motion detector which I had to wake up and reset the thermostat , the pool is very small and too busy I could not find a seat unless I go at 8 am to find a seat, I WILL NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL IN THE FUTURE

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful from Start to Finish”
Reviews.Author: Amy J
Reviews.Content: Beautiful ambiance. Situated on Brickell Key, most rooms overlook the bay. The pool is also right on the water and I saw pods of dolphins swimming every evening at dusk. Cafe Sambal is the perfect breakfast spot- sit outside. I loved getting in the elevator and smelling incense.

Reviews.Title: “Dramatic view, poor service”
Reviews.Author: CritikVoyages
Reviews.Content: - - - BEDROOM - - - Pros : Spacious and soundproofed bedroom (Deluxe Bay View bedroom), Dramatic view of Bicayne Key and downtown buildings. Very nice terrace, like a boat cabin. Cons : Nineties old-fashioned decoration, impersonal and cold. The manual curtain separating bedroom and bathroom, is not very practical. Too small dressing room, no free electric adapter, no coffee machine and satisfaction survey already filled out by the previous guest ! - - - COMMUNAL AREAS - - - Pros : Awesome beach and beautiful swimming-pool with a dramatic view of skyscrapers. It seems like a ponton boat. Cons : Cold Lobby with a lack of flowers and trees. Ubiquitous and disturbing smell of camphor Bad spatial organization : concierge is in front of the entrance but the front desk is hidden in the left corner. The gift shop and front desk locations should be inverted. - - - SERVICES - - => Room Service Confused menu and nothing special food. Club Sandwich is served cold. => Internet No free Internet access, even in the lobby (15 $ per day). => Parking Valet Horribly expensive : 34 $ per day Valet urge you to drop off your car, you must hurry up ! ==> Front desk Boorish service. Our flight should take off at 7 p.m. So, we informed front desk that we'll leave the room at 3 p.m. But after noon, an additional 50% of the daily room rate is charged for extended check-out time up until 4 pm. That's to say 150 $ extra charge, even though the hotel wasn't full. Why don't they have pro rata billing ? There wasn't any goodwill gesture and yet, we arrived at 10 p.m the first day. Mandarin Oriental Miami is narrow-minded and strict. Rude check-out : what the hell are they doing ? Where are sentences like "Have you enjoyed your stay ?" or "Have a good day" ? - - - RESTAURATION - - - => O-Pool Correct service, reasonable waiting time. But, drinks are served in a plastic glass and coffee is served in a cardboard cup. Are we in camping ? => Lobby Coffee Like a Starbucks, but it's too expensive : 18$ for 2 drinks and 3 mini pastries. Service charge included, even though it was a self service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway in the middle of Miami”
Reviews.Author: AmanJunkieBoston
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin does a very good job of delivering excellent service, very nicely appointed rooms, good quality of food in the middle of Miami while delivering the feel of a resort. I would recommend this for both a business and leisure trip. With a nice pool and beach area, this is a more quiet, relaxed, and cheaper alternative to South Beach. Strongly recommended within Miami.

Reviews.Title: “attention to detail and making your stay great”
Reviews.Author: badbaruch57
Reviews.Content: me + wife spent 4 + days. the attention to detail is amazing. staff actually tries to make you happy. great stay . we will be back with the kids in january. highly recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: ceabee115
Reviews.Content: Clean, elegant hotel on Biscayne Bay. Courteous and friendly staff. Only snafu was that we specifically asked at check in for a rollaway bed to be ready by 6pm and when we returned from dinner after 8pm, it was not set up. When we called, the staff brought the bed, but did not bother to set it up. Soooooo, other than that, a nice hotel overall. We had a fabulous breakfast overlooking the bay the next morning. The area is mainly a work zone, so there is a fair amount of congestion. Would be a good hotel for business travelers more than tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Posh and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: sebaillet
Reviews.Content: Very good experience, amazing food and great attention to details. The staff is very nice and make you feel special. Rooms are nice and large with great views of downtown. Pool area is nice . Spa is superb a must do. Only downside is that the hotel is not on the beach so a rental is necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: alwaysonthemove001
Reviews.Content: We loved the excepcional service at this hotel. We are very picky about it but everything went very smooth. The concierge arranged for our rental car to be delivered at this hotel and dropped off at another place, none of the other hotels could do it. The restaurant and bar are very good and so is the Spa.The room was great although I still do not see the purpose of having an open space between the bath and bedroom. At least the toilet had a separate door.

Reviews.Title: “First choice away from the beach”
Reviews.Author: thefoureyedpanda
Reviews.Content: Understated elegance. Mandarin service standards with a local flavour. Very comfortable rooms. Good channel selection. Excellent bed. Good to very good restaurants. Nice gym. Prompt, reliable, effcient and friendly service. I am not going to write anymore. A must if you don't want/don't need to stay on the beach. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: NYkykla
Reviews.Content: I came to Miami for a couple of days during March to have a break from Manhattan Island. Luxury bed made me sleep half of the day plus entire night up until morning. Breakfast was mouth-watering, and an awesome view made my morning truly inspiring. Reception desk gave a special attention to my interests and arranged all the trips and local reservations for me. Solicitous personnel at the pool knew their job very well. At night a restaurant downstairs gets packed, and no surprises here! Food is really delicious! The room was clean, and service was very considerate, as always. Definitely, the best place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for a week in the Sun..”
Reviews.Author: Toolbag
Reviews.Content: Great place to crash for a luxury week, located on an linked island just offshore from downtown, the location kind of works, despite being in this small odd location. The hotel is new and very cool, bedrooms and bathrooms are very well fitted, no complaints ... Strengths New 5* Hotel, great pool area, and man made beach/sandy area ( note you can't swim in the sea here , no access) Great hotel staff, always super helpful Very good spa and top Gym ( free newspapers, headphones ), the island is also good for running, so good place to get fit. 2 decent (expensive ) restaurants inside the hotel Top Bedrooms/Bathrooms Weakness Main hotel bar M-Bar is rubbish, feels more like an extension of the lobby. An hotel of this standing needs something way better than this ( think Mandarin Bar London as a good example) Tips Miami beach $26 away, Nikki Beach a good place to hit the real Beach if needed Little Cuba pretty close, good for a Cuban food.. Lincoln Road Mall Miami Beach, great place to shop, hang out, and dine

Reviews.Title: “love it :)”
Reviews.Author: chilelindo_11
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place, the best care. Come to this beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Lubor
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this excellent hotel at the beginning of November, stayed four nights. I can only recommend this hotel as it is managed on a very professional level, starting the front desk, housekeeping and food. The location is downtown Miami, located on the small Brickell key, which is a very good position. We had a very nice room on 19th floor, the view was amazing. The only thing we did not like was a slow service at the pool bar (serving food). Otherwise it was excellent. Wifi is extra paid. Cab to South Beach or Airport is $30.

Reviews.Title: “A shining star in Miami”
Reviews.Author: MysticKid
Reviews.Content: I was there on a biz trip which included the spouse and the Mandarin Oriental was just a terrific hotel. The check in was great, speedy, efficient, an offer of iced tea and great service to welcome us in. The Miami Basel show as in town ( a Will Smith spotting in the lobby) and there was continuous live music in the lobbby and bar areas and it was great. Room was very large and appointed w/ a great flat screen TV and stereo system, a high end power plug system for computers, an extra wide porch/veranda (6th floor), two double beds as I had a bad cold, a beautiful bathroom w/ marble tile everywhere, a beautiful view across the bay hot, very nice shower and comfortable beds. What made this place special was the service. Turndown every night w/ chocolates, water and a wooden tray that included a lint remover, laundry bags and sundries if you needed to prep for the next day. Music turned on low, they left a bookmark for my wife's book, chocolate cookies that looked luike sushi when we checked in. Never bothered by housekeeping, they did a great job of finding out when we were not in the room, poolside service was great w/ towels, turning on the hot tuib for us, a warm pool in not so warm a weekend and just made us feekl special throughout our trip.We had a spa package which again was just the best. i had a lady named Liz give me an Oriental essence massage and she was simplyy the best masseuse I ever had. Aromatic, essential oils, relaxing, nice advice, great sauna and steam room, a 6 faucet shower, bathroom essentials and great robes. An A+++ spa. A GREAT hotel and will make it my go to hotel when I am in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “The best luxury business Hotel in Miami!”
Reviews.Author: Porsche0606
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Oriental is one of my favorite chains in the World. Well, Miami hotel is 100% matches all 5 star expectations! This hotel is perfect and for business and for pleasure! Rooms are great. The best would be to stay higher floors with the Bay and city view. Itâ€™s fantastic! The SPA is 5 diamonds SPA that won many awards. I loved the interior. I would recommend taking a spa suite, because itâ€™s a piece of work! Meanwhileâ€¦ I had a better therapists working on meâ€¦ But itâ€™s good, just is not a perfect. But I am very spoiled when itâ€™s all about SPA. Another one of the best parts of this hotel is a restaurant. I had a fantastic food! I would travel to Miami just to dine here again! The service is great! I was very much pleased by the stuff. If you want to stay in Miami, I would say itâ€™s a perfect choice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luvorlando1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely and a nice break from the swarming bustle of Miami. The rooms were well appointed and clean. There were a few things that were off-putting though. First, there was a blind that was meant as a privacy screen between the tub and the room. The screen was short about an inch so we had to pile up towels for our length of stay for privacy, we mentioned it to staff who said they would send someone up but either they didn't show or couldn't fix it but either way, it was not addressed so the towels were there the whole time. This wasn't a big deal but it wasn't nothing either since my entire family loves a bubbly tub. Second, the thing that makes it desirable (being cut off) also makes seeing the rest of Miami very pricey as a car is needed everywhere, everywhere charges for parking and nothing is easily within walking distance. Third, and I don't know if this is a Mimi thing or particular to this hotel but they were very grabby about money, almost on the verge of seeming beggarly which was just icky. To get to our room the desk person walked us up = tip, the bellmen (2) then brought us up and gave a tour (2 tips) and every little thing in between felt like a tip was expected which meant we called as little as possible. Also, EVERY luxury in the room seemed to come attached to an exorbitant price-tag, so much so that we didn't dare touch the chocolates which may or may not have been complimentary because I was afraid of getting a $50 bill for them LOL. The vibe was just way too grabby. I suppose one could write this off as a luxury hotel thing but we spend a great deal of time in upscale places everywhere for business and pleasure, NYC being a fav spot, and never before was I so uneasy and I didn't like the choice of feeling of being either cheap or ripped off. I guess this place is fine for people with hundreds dripping out of their pockets unnoticed but for families and normal people, well I'd skip it next time around, the vibe was just 'off'. Beds could have been a little bigger too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ikki B
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife here as part of our honeymoon. I had previously spent 4 nights in The Epic (which was located 5 minutes away). Everything at Epic was outstanding so Mandarin had a lot to live up to. Check in was a breeze very well organised. The porter showed us our room and enquired about our stay at Epic. He stated we would be very happy with our room. Room: We had the Veranda Deluxe. The room was beautiful. Very large a comfortable bed. The view was amazing. We were on the 6th floor and overlooked the bay with the Miami skyline behind it. The furniture was really modern with an oriental twist. The room had a single sink (it would have been brilliant if they had a double sink). The balcony was a reasonable size although not secluded as they were seperated by translucent screens and you could see into part of your next door rooms and vice versa. Hotel: The hotel was very quiet. It is very business orientated. The location is nice on a little island. It has it's own private beach with a variety of furniture which was really nice to relax in. The lobby was great. Staff / Service: The staff service was generally excellent. We had twice a day room freshening. The concierge (Andrew) was brilliant. He made an excellent suggestion where we could eat within walking distance (Truluck's - excellent restaurant). The staff are always willing to help and are professional. The only incident I had was with regards to my suitcase being broken. The situation was aggravated by the fact the bellhop did not get anyone else out to fix it. On checkout we were charged for the minibar we did not used but in fairness the situation was dealt with quickly. Overall the hotel has a unique ambience and are very professional. It's just the one incident that stops me from giving this a 5/5.

Reviews.Title: “average survice for high price”
Reviews.Author: leramd30
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel over the weekend. We arrived near midnight on Friday night. There was NOBODY out there to pick our laguage and we had to wait for a check in. The front desk person took a long time to find our reservation adn initially gave me impression that we do not have it at all. The room service was prompt but the menue after hours is very very limitted especially if you are vegetarian or have any dietery restrictions. Internet in the room not free. The interior of the room is ok but there was dust everywhere. The hotel charged us additional money (>200$) to overstay just 4 extra hours

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: DanD21
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at the Mandarin. I was a bit concerned after reading a few bad reports regarding service, but I was completely blown away at the attentive service I received. I am not a wealthy person, throwing money around everywhere in order to get good service either...they just provided it, over and over. It was a great stay and I would absolutely stay there again...and recommend it to anyone interested in staying somewhere that is away from the craziness of South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, as expected”
Reviews.Author: Ricoeliso
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business in October. Very good hotel as you would expect from the Mandarin group. nice location on Brick Key which has a decent running route round the complex and its own little beach part. Service excellent. Only criticism would be size of hotel bar which is very small and tucked away in the corner of the main lobby, almost as an after thought.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was good until my wife sunglasses dessapeared from room”
Reviews.Author: vivaelmambo
Reviews.Content: Overall experience in our honeymoon was excelent, until on the last day my wife sunglasses dissapeared from the room. Issue escalated to management and basically the just said they were sorry...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: LIKETOTRAVEL125
Reviews.Content: Went to Miami for the weekend and stayed here. Really nice rooms. However, did find a live lizard in the bathroom. I called to front desk and they sent someone up right away to get it. Besides that little hiccup, it was nice. Room Service a little pricey but the food is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, lack of service”
Reviews.Author: roadlqui
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to the Mandarin Oriental, Miami. It is still an exceptionally beautiful hotel in a great location. Brickell Key is adorable & the views from the hotel are beautiful. On the Sat of our stay, we put 4 beach bags on lounge chairs on the beach only to come back at 10:45 am to find no chairs at the pool or beach. We were given towels & had to sit on ground until chairs opened up. We asked to speak to a manager twice & were finally able to on our third request. This property is expensive & there should be more done to accomodate guests on busy weekends. The food we ordered by the pool & at beach was not great. The food in general leaves a lot to be desired. The concierge was very informative & helpful. Pretty property but I will not go back. Its just too expensive to not get great service. Room key stopped worked on three occasions despite the fact that it was nowhere near a cell phone that could have erased the magnetic strip. Others on my floor were having the same issue with keys.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ross1965
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a very busy Saturday at 3 pm and were told that our room wasn't ready yet but we could sit at the pool bar and enjoy a complimentary drink. Only problem was that the pool was packed and there was no place at all to sit. We got lucky when a couple left and we had a table as we had to wait for 1 hour for our room. When we got to our room it was on a lower level (I asked for a high level) and it was really close to the street. We didn't like that room and called the front desk if they had another room as we would not stay there. First they told us they had another than the front desk manager told us he has to check and finally he told us that they had no other room only 2 very nice rooms but they were much more expensive. We told him that we are not willing to pay $ 300 more for a room and that we will leave and go back to west palm beach. He was very sorry and asked us if he could show us the other rooms but we said no we won't pay more, this room was expensive enough. 1 minute later (I was already on the phone with the hotel in West Palm Beach) he called again and said he has a room for us on the 18th floor with a nice view. It took us another 2 hours, but then we had the room we wanted to have! After that our stay was really nice. They had a big wedding on our arrival day, that's why everything was so packed. We still think that the pool area is to small and the service there is a little bit slow, but the beach area is really nice, the spa was wonderful, the bar is ok but it's more a business hotel than a beach hotel so you have to expect things like this. Our room was really spacious and the view finally was very nice. On our last evening we had dinner at the Azul, we sat outside and it was lovely! Food was really good, very pricey but it was worth it. All in all it was a very good hotel, good service, good location if you want to explore the whole area.

Reviews.Title: “Would never return.stay at the nearby Four Seasons for a much finer and comfortable experience .”
Reviews.Author: jmreiff
Reviews.Content: I travel weekly and have stayed in other Mandarin Orientals in Asia,Europe and in the US and my experience at the Mandarin Oriental in Miami was one of the most disappointing hotel experiences ever and can only be traced to management and staff training. I was not given my requested room at check in and was given a shuffle u til I was able to get the correct selection.i thought that perhaps it was an oversight and quickly forgot about the incident and when I went to get my car the following morning I was impressed to see the hotel general manager personally shaking the hand of the bell staff , doormen and parking attendants and wishing them a good morning. I arrived back to my room late in the afternoon and my room had not yet been cleaned despite a notice t" please make up the room and refresh the towels. I called housekeeping and and was assure that this was an oversight and that I should leave my room and it would be serviced within an hour. I decided to go to the lobby bar to have an espresso but was told that the coffee machine had been broken for at least week and they could not get it fizzed quickly and was sent to another hotel cafe in the lower level where the service was incompetent , rude and very overpriced for the lukewarm and poor quality . I returned to my room to shower and dress for an evening reception only to find that the room still had not been serviced in over one hour and there were no clean towels or fresh soaps etc. I again callled housekeeping and could not get a straight response. I then contacted the front desk and was given an apology with a promise to have housekeeping bring fresh towels and service the roomAnother no show. I next attempted to call the hotel manager who I had witnessed in the morning greeting staff and guests. I was told that he could not be found , but was pormised and immediate callback from his secretary or assistant. Needless to say the call never came and my room still remained dirty until the turn down servic3 appeared. The following day I returned to my room in the late afternoon with my wife and had just exited the shower and was lying on my bed with only a small towel covering my " private components" when ther was a knock on my doorway followed by the announcement that it was hote Security. I was told that they had to come into my room to install a new hotel movie and entertainment system and he was accompanied by 2 maintenance men . We wet told that they would be there for just a few minutes as they modified the TV and then due to complications had to remove drawers in which our clothes were placed in order to access the electrical components. Needlesss t o say,the three men remained in my room for a good bit of time after which I told them that this was unacceptable and after all of the other mishaps I told the security man that this was an invasion of our privacy and that this event was another example of how this place does not have their act together.after they left our TV never worked properly and we called them back. It then failed to operate properly and rather than complain again we just said the hell with it and vowed never to return and continued to enjoy ourselveses away from the hotel. I noted my concerns to another hotel employee who had also worked for the Ritz-Carlton and Four Seasons chain ans clearly noted a lessor attitude of service and staff training. I have never had such disappointing service at any other hotel, even the much lesser priced chains . I am sure that this is unlike any other Mandarin Oriental Hotel that I have stayed at and unfortunately I will have second thoughts about ever staying in one of their signature properties again. I hope and trust that my experience here was just a rarity and if not, management should open their eyes and ears and take action.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking experience. Please Read!”
Reviews.Author: AlejandroAlcaraz
Reviews.Content: We checked in at the Mandarin Oriental in Miami on October 21st we were kindly picked up with a limousine service at the Airport and greeted at the hotel lobby, the front desk assistant was extremely kind and gave us a beautiful room on the 8th floor overlooking the wonderful Brickell bay. We had a lovely Junior Suite given that we made all our reservations through the American Express Platinum Travel Services and of course they have certain perks. So far our experience was really lovely, the reason why we were visiting Miami was because my girlfriend and I were celebrating her birthday and it was her present, aside I took the opportunity of meeting up with few business associates. During the early morning of Monday the 24th of October, I got up from the bed and was hoping to start our day, however as the blinds were totally closed the room was dark and I misstepped on some silky pillows that were on the floor, given that they never came to do the turndown of the room, (usually around 18hrs they remove the silky decorative pillows as well as the covers and prepare the room for sleep). As a result I fell head first broke the fall with my arm groping on the desk in front of the bed where the TV was placed. I was startled from the impact and due to the obvious noise I woke up my girlfriend. Once we turned on the lights we saw that my hand was slightly bruised from the impact and of course since I am not a light guy 110kg of weight the result was an impact against the TV screen which ended up broken. We had informed the room service, and security came to inquire and inspect and make pictures. More concretely 2 security staff and the manager on duty. The security staff asked some questions and provided me with some ice for the hand. They told us that it was a clear trip and fall and they accommodated us. The manager Mr. Hendrik Grebe on the other hand did not show any concern nor did he tried to communicate with us. Security came again minutes later to help us fill in a report and we of course did it following their advice. We were told that they will get back to us for the matter of replacing the tv and whatever else we could need for such incident. The evening of the same day we came back to our hotel room and found that the tv was not replaced nor has the room been made up. Moreover there had not been a single attempt to try to clarify the situation or see if we could need any further help. We contacted the front desk about the tv and we were told that they just donÂ´t have a replacement tv, instead I had to request to be moved to a different room. Approximately an hour later they provided us with the same kind of room on a different floor. The day after it was our departure date and I was having breakfast with some business associates at their restaurant and while I was walking my guest out of the Mandarin one of the security staff approached me and said that the manager on duty would like to have a word, which obviously created an awkward moment. Furthermore the manager on duty Mr. Kelvin Jiles came to speak to me and informed me that I was going to be charged 1.300 usd aprox for the tv, given that the manager from the day of the incident reported it as property damage. Of course I did not expect this, nothing was communicated to us, and no one ever made an effort to clarify such a situation. Obviously I had several questions of my own as to why this incident was treated in such a manner with the lack of communicating and unprofessionally of the Mr. Hendrik GrebeÂ´s part. I was told by Mr. Kelvin Jiles that it would be possible to speak to Mr. Grebe later in the day and requested me to come back at 3pm. However Mr. Grebe never came out to us, instead we spoke to the head of security for the hotel. Previously we were able to read the internal written report supposedly written by Mr. Grebe where he defined the situation as I was caught by a housekeeping staff who brought our breakfast and I declined or pretended I never ordered, later in the report they said it was a mistake from room service obviously I never ordered such a breakfast, on top my girlfriend was referred to as a friend who spent the night in my room, also they insinuated that I could have been drunk, and worse was there could have been a case of domestic violence. That has been the most insulting situation I have ever found myself in not to say how ashamed I was when my girlfriend read such a report. I of course was told by every person who approached to us from the staff that they absolutely understand our disagreement, and confusion of such an absurd situation. They repeatedly told us that the charged were done on my card and kept on apologizing. We are usual costumers of the Mandarin Oriental more concretely we had just been 5 days at their hotel in NYC. We feel horrified at the treatment and lack of professional approach and we still havenÂ´t been given a proper or justified answer to the events. I hope this long letter helps for any future similar occurrences.

Reviews.Title: “World Class & the Best in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Lutetia75004
Reviews.Content: This elegant Asian-style hotel is a world-apart from Miami mayhem, an oasis within a short walk or drive to all Miami attractions. We were upgraded upon arrival to a stunning bay-view suite, without even requesting it. I received an immediate appointment at the spa, which is the only 5-star spa in Miami, with service, products & ambiance to match. Staff service is highly personalized and attentive, without being intrusive. Small requests are handled immediately - such as supplying a large vase with pebbles and plant food for 2 dozen roses, and then on departure, supplying packaging for the roses so they could travel home safely with me. Dining at the river-edge Cafe Sambal is a pleasure whether for breakfast, with its excellent buffet and separate menu, or its stellar Asian cuisine. And the impeccable grounds offer ample space to stroll, run or sunbathe. With a quick jump into a waiting cab, Miami is at your feet. This hotel exemplifies the all-round quality for which Mandarin Oriental is reknowned.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: SAM62
Reviews.Content: Was totally satisfied with my stay at this hotel. The Brickell area was really convenient in and around downtown Miami. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and the ambience at the hotel was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay in a luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: LenoLegend
Reviews.Content: We recently started our honeymoon with a 4 night stay in the Miami Mandarin Oriental. This is a top rated hotel marketing itself as a luxurious place. The hotel is very nice, well kept, clean and elegant inside. From the spacious bright lobby to the shops and restaurants and pool area with private beach, all are definately luxurious quality. The location in brickell is definately in a nice safe elegant area of Miami. All the staff from doormen to checkin to concierage were helpful and pleasant. The pool staff were also very helpful and friendly, particularly when a large iguana strolled by our sunbeds frightening the life out of my wife and the pool attendant was very reassuring that we were in no danger. The room was spacious, clean and had a large bathroom (though don't forget to close the blind before hopping in the bath as there is a clear view from the balcony!). The TV worked peferctly and there was an integrated entertainment system that we could connect our iPod to. Now, to the reasons for 'average'. Well, personally, when I stay in a luxurious hotel, I like to feel that I am getting value for money. What didn't deliver this for me in the Mandarin Oriental was the 'extras'. Wifi was not free and was about $35 a day to use. Considering the Starbucks and pubs within walking distance of the hotel all offer free Wifi, it was frustrating the hotel didn't offer this. The price of items in the mini bar were very expensive (as is frequently the case in hotels - it is almost like they don't want want people using the mini bar). There were no tea/coffee making facillities in the room. Again this felt like a rip off as you had to go to the bar to purchase tea / coffee when it is custom to have such facillities in your room. There were also two problems in the bathroom. The shower door leaked quite badly leaving a large puddle in the bathroom after each shower. Secondly, the basin would not stay filled draining away in seconds. This made shaving both awkward and not very environmentally friendly as I had to leave the hot tap running. Finally, not a big deal but I was asked on check in what paper I would like each morning and I never once got a newspaper delivered. I wouldn't have minded this if I hadn't been offered it initially. All in all, a nice hotel but if you want to hit the high standards of luxurious, I think all areas need to be perfect and I did not feel like that here.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - yes, details, hmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: verogal
Reviews.Content: We travel quite a bit and I must say, this hotel certainly has the "IT" factor. It is stunning location on Brickell Key, Miami is unbeatable. Water surrounding this little oasis makes every view beautiful every hour of the day or night. Service was excellent from the first encounter with the valet parking to every clerk, hostess, cleaning person or food server. Staff seemed genuinely caring and attentive. The Oriental decor is so tranquil and stunning in its simplicity. Our room was also decorated minimalist, but perfect. The bed was very comfortable with superior luxurious linens and a large selection of pillows. The bathroom is almost as big as the bedroom. It is huge with a great soaking tub and a large shower for two and a generous supply of huge soft fluffy towels. Matching robes and slippers add to the relaxing options. We ate in two of the hotel restaurants which were delicious and also had great service. So why doesn't the Mandarin Oriental get a perfect score? The following items diminished the overall experience: The bathroom scale is a nice touch, but it was broken. The batteries in the TV remote were dead. The flashlight in a closet is a good idea, but it didn't function. The stereo system didn't work. The refrigerator cabinet was missing one wine glass. The sink in the bathroom is beautiful to look at, but the design of it creates a direct backsplash as soon as you turn the water on that splashes directly out of the sink and all over the place. Finally, my pet peeve is NO in room coffee. I simply must have my coffee before I face the day and it bothers me to either have to call room service or get dressed and wander out to find my first cup of java for the day. Would all the negative keep me from going to this hotel again. Never. This place just FEELS good, so I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DanJamesBath
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Miami is not up to the same standard as other hotels in the group. Was kept awake all night by noise from the room above. Balcony was a joke, hardly enough room to stand on it & the beds were uncomfortable. Asked to change rooms & was rebuffed quite rudely. Left after one night, will never come back.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: guaman
Reviews.Content: Have stayed several times at the Mandarin, all the previous experiences were wonderful. This last one, however, I found the house keeping was not up to standard, one day there were no towels, another day there was no blankets on the bed, another they failed to clean the toilet. Apparently the floor supervisor was absent or was not doing the job. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, the hotel has a beautiful location and wonderful facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Marejse
Reviews.Content: Clean and spacious rooms, very nice bathroom (be aware that the bathroom is connected with the room. It is possible to pull down a curtain/separator). My room was overlooking the channel and Miami. There are some good facilities such as fitness center (no charge) with complementary fruits and water, two nice restaurants, pool area, bar etc. Very helpful and attentive staff. In walking distance to restaurants and shops, you just have to cross the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: CM10583
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved this hotel's large, adjoining rooms; nice pool; good beach; excellent spa and fitness center; morning coffee in the lobby; and good shops. We loved Cafe Sambal, which had a nice balance on the menu between integrity and variety. The hotel's overall design, menus, shops etc. have more coherence than most properties do. I rate the hotel lower than I'd like, however, on account of service quality. First, the door and bell staff seem unusually aggressive about soliciting tips for even the most incidental task. More seriously, a billing issue stunned me. When I checked rates to consider the MO over another hotel, the hotel's sales rep gave me a clear quote for "both" rooms. My corporate travel agent made the booking, accepting the same quote from a different agent for "both" rooms. Even after I grudgingly paid double -- one bill for "each" room -- the front desk agent refused to acknowledge the hotel's role in the mix-up, despite agreeing that no one would have booked my rate given the availability of a lower corporate rate and other lower promotions for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: liz315
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a haven of peace and tranquility. We stayed 2 nights post cruise and enjoyed the rest and relaxtion. Beautiful executive room with fabulous views and very comfortable. Service was all we expected from this standard of hotel, attentive but not intrusive. Nothing to fault.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Luxury”
Reviews.Author: coolrunnings_10
Reviews.Content: Best hotel in Miami for excellent service. Location is perfect so you can escape South Beach. Both restaurants were very good and the spa is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Simply breathtaking!!!”
Reviews.Author: Squidtto
Reviews.Content: The hotel lives up to all its expections and more with gorgeous views of the city and impeccable service thi hotel is hard to resist. The bad is that you have to pay for wifi service which I think should be included

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Faloughi
Reviews.Content: This place is a 5 star hotel for a reason! A magical view of both the city and the water. Room service and food that has no equal. This place is just high class! The whole staff is first class.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, but use the hotel safe.”
Reviews.Author: mellykins153
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing and is definitely one of the best options for business travelers who do not wish to stay on South Beach. Do yourself a favor and upgrade to a room with a great view. The room was well appointed and I felt like I was staying in a honeymoon suite even though I was by myself for business. The amenities were nice and the view from the balcony was perfect. We ate at Azul, which is located in the hotel and is a great option for a business dinner. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. This being said, I feel that I must advise others to lock up their valuables when leaving the room. I experienced a missing ipod, and I've seen at least one other post regarding a missing iphone. I know this can happen in any hotel and it was partly my fault for not being vigilant. Don't let something like this ruin your trip. The hotel seemed concerned, but they can't really do anything after the fact. I would have given a 5 star rating if this incident had not occurred.

Reviews.Title: “a nice mandarin oriental... location depends on what you want to do..”
Reviews.Author: scoi00
Reviews.Content: I like this mandarin but it's not my favorite mandarin. The location is interesting but not if you want to go to south beach. On the other side it's almost impossible to find in south beach a hotel with near such a good service. Frustrating was the fact they just add 18% service to everything without asking, for example in the SPA where they just add it , no questions asked. This it not common in other Mandarins. Food at the unfortunately not very big pool was great , even the sushi. Margaritas where some of the best you can get in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, just one problem....”
Reviews.Author: bonnie w
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a quick overnight get away. The rate for Florida residents was incredible. As it was our anniversary, the room had rose petals on the bed and in the tub, and chocolate covered strawberries were delivered to the room. Staff was accomodating with our request for a late check out. Almost everything about the hotel was impecable, The staff was very professional. The room was gorgeous with a breathtaking view. Room service was great. The infiinity edge pool, was clean and beautiful as it was right on the waterfront. The fitness center was great, with towels and bottled water readily available on each indivitual machine-- each of which had small touchscreen t.v.'s and available individually wrapped headphones.The hotel appeared to be immaculate. We did, however, have one problem, there was a periodic noise, seemingly from our a/c, which woke us up numerous times during the night. This was not only annoying but dissapointing, as the hotel really lived up to its five star rating in all other aspects. We did mention this to the front desk staff when we checked out,and they were apologetic, however, that obviously did not make up for the fact that we both had a miserable night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “My most spectacular 37 th birthday in the outstanding hotel of miami! An assian birthday cake with love!”
Reviews.Author: kikola12
Reviews.Content: During our 3 days of stay we got into the conclusion that mandarin oriental is from now on the best chain ever! From all things including the assian design, the huge very beautifully decorated deluxe rooms, with high guality and hi tech standards that my eyes never saw in other chains like 4 s , one & only & so on, the perfect unigue azul restaurant and its high standards of service, the private beach and its modern decor outside, the amazing entrance and waterfalls in breakfast , all these plus many more different details make our 3 days in miami ever so sprcial that exceeded our expectations !!! Congrats and thank you ever so much for the unbeleivable treatment you gave us and tge top class spa not to forget! You made my special day ever so wonderful and our miami holidays sooooo amazing! We love you and we ll be back for sure to you and miami again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: manny100
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times as a short getaway as we live in Fort Lauderdale. The hotel is beautiful, service is outstanding and location is prime. My wife loves it because it is on a small island so there is no traffic and is very quiet and relaxing. Has a 1.3 mile path around the island that is marvelous to do in the evening when it cools down and there is a breeze. We even brought our dog last year and she loved it. We will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: LUVSHOPPING
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that cannot be beat! Service outstanding, huge rooms with lovely towels & all the amenities. Beds are incredibly comfortable. The pool area is outstanding. The minute you walk in the door, the views take your breath away. You feel special!

Reviews.Title: “Business, romance or family. This is the place to be.”
Reviews.Author: JRGNY
Reviews.Content: Extremely elegant hotel. The staff knows what they are doing, they are friendly and see to your every need. The rooms are a bit small but with great views and a huge bathroom. I've stayed on business with family and with my wife and it is always delightful. With my kids they where great and the man made beach is fantastic. Also the in room dinning is pricey but superb. As their several restaurants ate amongst the best in the city.

Reviews.Title: “a different Mandarin oriental”
Reviews.Author: italgourmet
Reviews.Content: It's a bit difficult to rate this Mandarin Oriental. Let's say .. it's different. It's very pleasant. but... the location is awkward .. you are off.. If you are used to Mandarin Orientals that are in the "center" of action this one is a bit off (like the FS). Also for such a big hotel the pool size is a bit disappointing and when the hotel is full really only usable as a "plunge pool " What also is a very bad habit in the Miami area is to just include 18% tip on everything independently of the service . Well if you can't choose what to give... what is the point ? make it inclusive. That this can be done differently is shown in the Mandarin Las Vegas : you go to the wellness area for a treatment and you choose how much to give... maybe that's a reason the massage in the las Vegas was much better. On the good side the Margaritas are some of the best you can get in town. and if you want great food just go to trulocks just passing the bridge. It's not my favorite Mandarin and it's far from south beach.. .the service is just much better then anything you can find there...

Reviews.Title: “The Mandarin Oriental, Miami is all about excellent service and style”
Reviews.Author: warner50
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had the most wonderful stay recently at the Mandarin Oriental, Miami. From the moment we checked in, until we left, regretfully, 3 days later, we were treated like royalty. The entire staff from the front desk to the valets were so professional and courteous. The concierge staff were outstanding. Extremely helpful and had an excellent base of knowledge about everything in Miami... Our room was impeccable!! We were on the 11th floor, with outstanding views. Our room was beautifully decorated and of course very clean. The bathroom was large and luxurious. We loved the pool area, with an infinity pool, that looked out onto the bay. The whole experience was pure pleasure, we couldn't think of staying anywhere else in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “WoW!!”
Reviews.Author: amylee87
Reviews.Content: unbelievable. This hotel is absolutely gorgeous. The rooms are great, the bathrooms are even better, and the porch is huge!! Great infinity pool and private beach area. My only complaint is the beach opens too late. I'd like to be out at 6am..not 10am. Food is pricey but look where we are..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with top notch service”
Reviews.Author: Bocarob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room here for one night and were very happy with the room, overall service, and views of downtown Miami. The hotel decided to surprise us with a small cake which said Happy Birthday delivered to our room since it was my birthday. This was a very nice touch by the hotel management! Our room had great views of the Biscayne Bay and the city skyline of Brickell Ave. The awesome view can also be appreciated from the cafe Sambal outside lounge, the pool, and the small man-made beach which had a LOT of ambience for such a small beach - very well kept and decorated with the couches and cabanas. We had dinner at Azul and the food was really good with one of the most attentive and best services I've ever had at a restaurant. Overall, we found the hotel to be exquisite with top notch service so you can't go wrong with booking here. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “High Class”
Reviews.Author: avelautham
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Biscayne Bay, the hotel overlooks the Bay. The rooms have a balcony which get a constant cool breeze which is quite a relief from the sweltering temperatures out there. Check in was easy, minor annoyance is when they ask if you want to upgrade for $X which drags the whole experience down a notch. However, given a nice cool drink and cold towel on arrival. The suite was clean with good products and fresh fruit. Be sure to ask for an iron and ironing board prior to arriving. Breakfast buffet was good, we were there during the Sony Ericsson open so there was a high profile tennis star there during breakfast. Spa treatments were high end. I would return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with an even more amazing view”
Reviews.Author: claudiasil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend a getaway weekend at the Mandarin for our anniversary and it was all that we hoped for... From the check in everyone was very kind and helpful, my husband noted on the reservation that we were celebrating our anniversary and all the staff continued to congratulate us on our stay. We were first assigned to room 1010 and as when we got there a maintenance man was changing the lightbulbs, he was so apologetic and quickly left the room. (no big deal) although we still decided to change out of this room because even though it was a bay room category it was facing more of the city and downtown area also there was a really bad smell that came from the water by the bridge going into the key (not the hotel's fault i'm sure but still not nice when you are paying that type of price for a hotel.)My husband spoke to the front desk and they immediately changed our room without any hesitation. They sent the bellman up with the new cards immediately. OUr second room was beautiful and it had an amazing view! The bed was amazing and the pillows were great. The room decor is asian modern which is very relaxing and beautiful. Great stocked mini bar! I think I even saw an outlet converter in there. The soap and other bath products were so amazing!!! Kind of minty and it is sets you in a very relaxed mood. The soaking tub was kind of narrow, cant fit two people but one person was fine. The down service was so beautiful... they made a heart with rose petals and left us a beautiful dessert for our anniversary with even the ice bucket prepared. We also went to the beach area and the pool which the service is was impeccable. They even had complimentary sun screen (which was helpful since I forgot mine) Overall our experience was amazing. The only con for my taste is that pets are allowed. There was a hollowing dog at various points through the night on our floor and you heard scattered doggie yapping. But I have to admit that you would never know the hotel allows pets if you don't see or hear them. The hotel is very meticulously clean and it does not smell like animals. I have allergies to dogs and never did I experience any allergy episodes while on my getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Offers all you think of”
Reviews.Author: PSL3000
Reviews.Content: The size of the room and mainly of the bathroom were striking (Deluxe Bay View room). The hotel is relatively new, with all amenities one can think of: huge fitness area, great spa, nice views (unfortunately, it was foggy and misty during my 2-day stay). I hope to return there sometime accompanied by my loved one to spend some romantic time there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with very good service”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerGER
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the mandarin Oriental for 3 nights in a deluxe Veranda Room. Room is very large, nicewith a huge bathroom and a beautiful Veranda overlooking downtown Miami and biscayne bay. Staff members all very friendly, good service at the Pool, very efficient valet parking. Small minus: the brickell key location. There is not much around there, except some restaurants in walking distance, so if you stay there, you definitely want to bring your car. If you don't want to stay in overcrowded Miami beach, I highly recommend the Mandarin Oriental. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Miami Getaway”
Reviews.Author: S6usanne
Reviews.Content: When the Mandarin Oriental offered a special for Floridians, we traveled up the Keys for two nights and enjoyed the experience thoroughly. This is of course a world class hotel, so the service is superb and the standards high throughout. The summer special came with full breakfast and use of the 5-star spa--which meant access to their steam rooms and showers, though one could also pay for a very wide variety of spa services. The location on Brickell Key is useful for getting around Miami by car or by foot--the downtown (free) people mover is only three blocks away. Their signature restaurant, Azul, was excellent but probably not up to its prices, despite a great wine list. The secondary and less formal restaurant has food half as price and 2/3 as good.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at the Mandarin Oriental in Miami”
