Reviews.Author: FlyingEconomist
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Miami from the 6th to the 10th August. From check-in to check-out the experience was fantastic. The interior of the hotel is stunning with a beautiful decoration. The rooms are very big and very well decorated. My room was a deluxe room with a city skyline view. The view is very beautiful. The bed is so comfortable and the bathroom is big and beautifully appointed with a large shower. The surroundings are very well kept and the jogging track has very nice views of Biscayne Bay. The restaurants have the most delicious food I've ever eaten. The food at the Cafe Sambal restaurant is marvelous with excellent asian inspired dishes. The Azul restaurant is an excellent fine dining experience. The food is excellent and delicious. Both restaurants have excellent wine options. My compliments to the chefs. The pool area is spacious with a good view of the city. The staff throughout the hotel is very friendly and very helpful. I loved my stay, loved the atmosphere and the ambiance. I've stayed at other Mandarin Orientals in Macau and Singapore and the experience was similarly stunning. It is among the best hotels in the world. Next time in Miami, I will definitely stay at the Mandarin Oriental again.

Reviews.Title: “So worth it!”
Reviews.Author: godsfavdiva
Reviews.Content: Well, it's the Mandarin Oriental, so no complaints here! Top-notch service from the concierge, the waitstaff in the restaurant, the bartendersâ€¦.it was a wonderful experience all around. I truly loved being situated on the bay, which afforded me a great venue to walk and feel secure about my surroundings, as so many others were involved in jogging, blading, walking with their children, etc. It was a lovely way to break into Spring; I would love to visit this hotel again. It was a nice break from trendy, noisy South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to the hype.”
Reviews.Author: Laurariv47
Reviews.Content: We checked in the last night that the Barcelona soccer team were staying and were offended and screamed at by security. The hotel is beautiful on the inside but is a bit dated. We stayed in a suite with a bay view which was gorgeous as was the tub and shower. The staff was in a frenzy and distressed by fans trying to sneak in and out of the hotel resulting in a very unpleasant stay. We received help from our manager at the end of our stay but we do have regrets about staying here and question ever returning. If you are there make sure you run into Danny he is a bell hop, behind the reservation counter and everywhere in-between helpful friendly guy. But beware the hotel is no 5 star and for the price you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, enjoyable stopover prior to cruise”
Reviews.Author: DesertCA
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this elegantly beautiful, clean, spacious hotel, located in a quiet section of Miami, near the cruiseport. Most memorable were the sumptuous meals at Azul and Cafe Sambal and late-night drinks at the bar overlooking the bay. It was a "reach" for us, but worth every penny -- 3 days stay had the "rest & relaxation" equivalent of a week at sea! We had stayed at Mandarin Oriental in Singapore before this, but this was the first time we experienced being met at our car and escorted personally not only to the check-in desk, but then escorted by the desk clerk from check-in up to our rooms -- very lovely stay -- no negatives to report.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel -- A Must Stay”
Reviews.Author: Maef74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing. Great services from check in until you leave it. The rooms are quite nice, very clean and with stunning bay view. Staff of quite cordial and I do not have a single thing to complain about. I highly recommend for both work and leisure. A must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay”
Reviews.Author: lmarieg056
Reviews.Content: The view from the room is spectacular. The staff is extremely helpful. We were even given a bottle of water while we waited for our car! The lobby is beautifully decorated and it is very romantic to walk on the side of the hotel by the Intercoastal waterway at night. If you get tired from the stroll you can sit on one of the benches overlooking the lights of Key Biscayne. We will continue to visit this wonderful hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversaries or just a quick vacation from our busy everyday life.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: Vitara-1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a taxi ride from South Beach but if you're looking a great place to unwind its hard to beat. Best Spa i've ever been to. Pool is maybe too small over busy periods.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: nyc72
Reviews.Content: The service Out of this world. Im going back in a few months!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and welcoming staff. I recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MaureenHerts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a 3 night stay. All of the staff were very welcoming and friendly and the concierge was very ready to advise on trips for our family to do and good places to eat. Mary Brickell Centre is very close by and is good fun for all. The hotel is situated on the canal and our room overlooked the water so we could stand on the balcony and look out at the boats which was fun. The beach is a short taxi ride away. The buffet breakfasts were delicious and had lots of choice to suit every taste. We spent 2 afternoons in the pool and it was very clean and well looked after. I was most impressed with the staff over one particular incident. On our last night, when we were checking the room over, I discovered that I had lost over $600. I was convinced that I had put it in the safe on our arrival but it simply was not there. I was very upset to lose so much money. We searched the room and then called the security manager who promised to look into it for me. The following morning, after we had checked out, we received a phone call to say that the envelope containing the money had been found; it was tucked up against the side of the safe and was difficult to see due to the fact that the envelope was the same colour as the safe wall. After we had left, an enterprising chap called Troy, had searched our room again and discovered it on his second search of the safe. How fantastic to find such honest staff! To be honest, after this happened, I don't think I would stay anywhere else in Miami. We do go a lot as we have a house in Orlando and will be staying there on future trips. Well done, Mandarin Oriental!

Reviews.Title: “Luxus and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jpllanos
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve been probably 5 times here and I love this Hotel in Miami. You were really treated with honor and friendly. The rooms are huge, the bathroom is full equipped, both sides of the floor have good viewes from the sea or canal. The restaurant is of very good quality. As it is located in something like a small iland you donÂ´t get as much of the crowd of downtown. A small bridge connects you to the Brickel Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Miami”
Reviews.Author: SBF2
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife to celebrate my birthday. The staff bent over backwards to ensure my stay was perfect. We had a terrific suite with a great view and superb amenities. The staff was always there when you needed them and greeted you as a valued guest. Azul was the perfect place for the dinner. The meal was wonderful and the staff impeccable. We expect a lot from an Mandarin and Miami exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: RHOM
Reviews.Content: The staff do make this hotel work as expected of an M.O. Very expensive valet parking works, concierge is effective, housekeeping and room service are really special - they did attend to our requests promptly and attempting their best, the he gym is ok... The only problems were the mattress and the overnight parking rate (US$ 35/night). Though they might have changed the mattress if we had thought of asking for it, my husband and I did get very sore backs after the 6 nights we spent at this hotel. Very conveniently located for jogging lovers.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me ...wonderful staff but...”
Reviews.Author: Quality First
Reviews.Content: Despite an outstanding staff , the Mandarin misses making my recommended list. It starts with Azul, the signature restaurant at this hotel There is something amiss when the menu in their featured restaurant is so odd and unappealing. the restaurant was unable to accommodate a 8:30 reservation but could squeeze me at 8:00... only to enter a restaurant that was only 1/2 full and remained that way for the duration of my stay. The menu suggested a chef who had lost their way and was trying to offer 'inventive' cuisine to a narrow group of clients. We were hard pressed to find a single item to choose from and that has never happened top me anywhere, in any setting. After searching and considering options , we politely departed without eating. We sought other choices ...ultimately to land in their Cafe a casual dining site where at least the menu offered options; although all with a singular Asian flair. The music noise level was unacceptable and ill suited for conversation and if we had not found such an accommodating manager - we would have landed up in our room using room service. Avoiding the restaurants, we took our breakfasts nearby and traveled 10 minutes to eat lunches and dinners in Coral Gables-a far better choice. Accommodation were upscale but not warm or truly luxurious. Impossibly uncomfortable lounge chair that really offered no option for the second person in the room except the desk chair. Mattress was fine yet the pillows were all of the very soft type which left one of us uncomfortable throughout the night. The singular and most redeeming feature in the hotel is the staff. They are clearly among the best trained and pleasant team I have experienced. But for them, I would have checked out after one night. Recommendation -ask the concierge how to get to nearby Mary Brickell village - not great just good but at least there are multiple dining options. Lastly, when a premier hotel asks a guests opinion.. never answer with a stock form letter. Better to say nothing ...then to treat a comment with a standard reply after a guest takes the time to offer their comments...take the time to reply with a personal note. Unless the number of negative comments is so overwhelming , the honor of a personal reply from a member of senior management would be more suitable to a hotel seeking premier status.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay with a fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: soma90
Reviews.Content: Chose hotel based on a friend's recommendation and backed up by Trip Advisor rating. Have stayed in many 5 star hotels....Mandarin right up there. Liked the Zen ambiance, view from my room which was Bay and Downtown view. We were 4 including 2 daughters 14 and 19. Asked for a rollaway bed, came right away...no extra charge for being in a Double with the rollaway...unlike the Ritz Carlton which seem to nickel and dime customers. Service whether room, concierge, pool, or beach were superb, but particular attention to the valet parking...super guys...didn't like the cost of the daily valet charge, but is actually par for the course in 5 Star Miami hotels. We were there 4th of July and had a wonderful view of the harbor front fireworks from Brickell Island, where the hotel is. I admit though did not try the food..thought pretty pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property!”
Reviews.Author: cpapa84
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. The property was just beautiful and there were so many extra little touches that were appreciated. I was skeptical about the location and lack of beach access, but I actually liked staying in Brickell rather than South Beach. I also didn't mind the "private beach" area at all and loved the pool so I didn't miss the true beach. My only complaint is about the lack of available food options (I didn't feel like there were enough, especially when taking into consideration how far removed we were from Brickell). I think the hotel would really do well to provide some kind of shuttle to Mary Brickell Village. Other than that though, it was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous views”
Reviews.Author: NigelMA
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for business travelers but not close to South Beach. All the rooms have a water view as far as I can tell. The rooms are spacious and bathrooms luxurious. I stayed for two nights on business. Good breakfast buffet. Nice pool but small.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat visitor- I love this place”
Reviews.Author: bccrab
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin is an oasis just outside of downtown Miami. Very nice location and views of wither Downtown or the Bay. The restaurants on the premises are excellent. The Spa is top notch. The public areas are well decorated and small touches like scented candles and music in the lobby create a very nice relaxing atmosphere. There is no beach to speak of so I wouldn't recommend this if you're looking to have a beach hotel. Here, the beach is a small enclosed area that has some nice comfortable lounge chairs and a hammock but no swimming. The rooms are very comfortable and if you get one with a balcony overlooking the bay it is very nice. I will definitely stay again when I'm in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon hotel, we will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: miami2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the second week of our honeymoon and loved it. Good bits Eric in guest services went out of his way to make our stay unreal and deserves a special mention. Arrival to tasty Asian inspired treats and vintage champagne, the room had a breathtaking view. The room had a bay and was view modern, high floored room, with a large tub and large tv and bureau. We ate at cafe sambal a few times , Sia our server was fantastic, and the food here was so good we had to go back. The pool is small but never got too crowded, food and drinks at the pool are delicious especially the Kobe beef salad and the frozen cocktails. The pool boys bring fresh fruit, ice cold cloths, sun lotion and smoothies all complimentary during the day. The staff while I singled out some staff above I wanted to state I found the staff always friendly and cordial, they were so lovely. Bad bits My phone went missing from my room on day three, I left it on the bed went to the pool for 2 hours when I returned to the room the phone was gone. We tried to call it but whoever took it had turned it off. We called security hoping housekeeping had taken it by mistake in the bed linen but it wasn't found. What happened after that was disappointing. we called security 6 times over 4 days just to get any follow up. We were told the manger would call us again this didn't happen I don't think he was made aware. What was most disappointing is an incident report was written but the hotel would not give me a copy. The security supervisor I spoke to did disclose some details from the report and I am disappointed to say they were totally inaccurate. On a positive note Barry mention this to Eric in guest services and he was not aware of what had happened he went out of his way to help us and covered a meal at the hotel that we had, had. Over all great holiday, great hotel, great food, great gym, great staff just one annoying blip!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as Good as a 5-star should be.”
Reviews.Author: TheCriticSays
Reviews.Content: The Good: -Clean rooms. -Room service twice daily. -Room size is adequate. -Valet parking gets your car fast and parks it fast as well. -Hotel looks clean and nice in general. The Bad: -There is no "private beach" as advertized, it is a small, man-made beach, with no access to water. -The pool is very small compared to the size of the hotel. -Valet parking is mandatory and costs $34 per day, other (and better) hotels charge only $30 per day. -The fan in the bathroom in our room did not work and was not fixed despite complainig. -The toilette flush in our bathroom takes FOREVER to refill and was not fixed despite complaining (I have used the so-called "ECO" flushed in many older and modern hotels, so I know how it is supposed to work, ours was not functionning normally, nor as intended. -The batrhoom sink did not drain, they fixed it after we complained. -The hotel rooms show unusual signs of aging, despite the hotel being only around 10yrs. old. -The staff is arrogant and border-line rude (except for the valet parking guys, who are great). -The food at the hotel is marginal, the fruits in our $60 breakfast for 2 were NOT fresh, and we could not eat them. - As staff was so arrogant and our previous complaints were ignored (regarding the bathroom issues) we did not even bother complaining about stale fruits posing as fresh ones...we were happy it was our last day. -In general I recommend Trump and Sofitel hotels over Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “5 star all the way”
Reviews.Author: Horatiolh
Reviews.Content: Great design, warm welcome at front desk, large well designed room (except... be careful going bare foot by the end of the bed corner; badly hurt my toe...in the end my toe survived and hotel management and staff were very concerned). Food is excellent as are the views. Location is good for downtown business but not so convenient for South Beach dining....but who cares as best hotel in Miami and have stayed here several times now over better located establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: julesnync
Reviews.Content: Extremely relaxing, clean and comfortable. Wonderful staff! Rooms are spacious and very clean. We enjoyed our stay so much we wanted to stay longer. Will recommend to anyone! We plan to go back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Miami's got the heat @ Mandarin Oriental Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmartos
Reviews.Content: We had traveled to Spain for about a week before deciding to spend a few days (5/26-5/28) in Miami before returning home to Dallas. We chose to stay at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel located downtown Miami which is not too far from Miami's International Airport. The city was celebrating the victory of Miami Heat's win into the finals. Immediately upon our arrival at the hotel, we were made to feel welcomed and were offered a glass of tea by the cheerful reception clerk. After checking-in, we decided to walk around and explore. The hotel has a small private sandy beach. Very lovely and private for couples but there's an area which is ideal for families too. The surrounding area is perfect for a picnic and you watch the ships sail by. Lots of trees and very pretty landscaping. The spa was amazing. The food was delicious. The view of the city/harbor from our view was spectacular. We had dinner on our balcony overlooking the harbor. The rooms are very spacious and the marble bathrooms are a nice luxury all around. Loved soaking in the tub. We requested extra pillows which took more than several calls and attempts to get them delivered to our room. The hotel is not within walking distance of shopping, restaurants and other must see spots. We took a car and visited South Beach and Coral Gables. This was my first time in Miami and hope to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: thibaut a
Reviews.Content: I have always stayed at my friends place in Brickell and was always dying to go visit the Mandarin Oriental. This time i have decided to spend a night over there and it was simply exceptional. I really like the room product, the level of service (the staff make you feel welcome and are always looking at ways to assist you). the pool is little small compare to the size of the hotel, but such a great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmainelli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here about 5 years ago when it had opened fairly recently. Thought the rooms were awesome - they had a sliding door that either opened up to the bathroom and tub or closed it off. Bathroom amenities were all very nice and nothing missing. Turndown service every night was so nice. They leave a little orchid on your pillow which I loved. Views from the balcony over Key Biscayne are lovely. Only thing is you are not in South Beach, you are in Key Biscayne, so it's about a 20 minute cab ride to any of the nightlife there. The pool is small but right on the water and nice and sunny. And the spa was incredible! The food by the pool was delicious. I did not eat in the restaurant, but it is supposed to be very good!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Disfan
Reviews.Content: I recently came back from the Mandarin in Miami. I was there for a conference which actually took place at the hotel. The smell in the lobby and public areas remind me of a spa... Asian spices and scents. The room was spacious with well appointed bathroom and nice amenities. The desk was comfortable and larger than most. I had a terrific water view and a nice balcony on the 15th floor. The fitness center was rather small and as a hotel guest with access to the spa, I was surprised when I tried to visit the spa facilities upon my arrival. Per hotel policy I needed to use the facilities immediately if I wanted to go inside. The thing I appreciated most of the hotel is the huge amount of electrical outlets in the room; plenty to charge my laptop, cell phones and many more to spare. This is invaluable for business travelers and seldom overlooked by hotels. Great place for business!

Reviews.Title: “Understated elegance and the best service you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: imsadriver
Reviews.Content: This place is very classy, quiet, and close to everything you could want in Miami without being on the beach and in the crowds. The service from the valet parking guys all the way up was impeccable. I would highly recommend this hotel. Two very nice restaurants with great views. Close to the beach and right in the Brickell area. Just fab!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Can Host a Conference Too”
Reviews.Author: FredTravelVa
Reviews.Content: I just finished a day at the Mandarin Oriental, where I gave a speech. I have previously stayed at the Mandarin with my wife and consider it one of the best hotels in the USA. This stay was in and out to give a speech. I had to work in the business center. It is very well-staffed, which is consistent with the five-star level of service at the Mandarin Miami. I printed out hundreds of pages in color slides -- which was pricey -- but the service center had supplies (folders, big staples, etc.), which I have never found at a hotel business center. The conference itself was excellent. And the conference food was certainly a notch above what you expect. One of the most interesting surveys I conducted at break was how many of the convention goers bruoght a spouse. Highest number I have ever heard. Almost everyone staying more than a night was being met by their spouse. That is almost unheard of in most conferences, and a testament to how much people enjoy this hotel. Particularly since the conference was international and most spouses were coming from far away at the attendees personal expense. I love this property. The staff are uniformly pleasant, gracious, etc. Every part of the common public areas are immaculate. I wouldn't say anything about the Mandarin is cheap -- coffee is $4 -- but you expect that at a six star hotel. The important thing for me is expected premium pricing to get premium service. And the Mandarin delivers. I also think the location is superb. The views from the Mandarin are picture-postcard-perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but rooms beginning to show their age”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekker63
Reviews.Content: Generally excellent hotel- have been staying here for years. Very good service, nice lobby, very attentive valets etc. Rooms beginning to show their age, but would still stay here when I come to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: andyc53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Miami last night. We last stayed in a Mandarin Oriental in San Francisco a few years ago and the experience has deteriorated a bit. The rooms are nice but the bathrooms are weird. There are no real places to put things around the sink. So much space, nice design but poor function. The service was exceptional in all respects. It could not have been better. At these prices, the Mandarin Oriental, is good but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel & very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: mrfabchick
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay at MO was great. The hotel is beautiful with impeccable service, however, I would like to call out 2 areas that took away from my stay being absolutely fabulous. First, with MO being a 5 star hotel it should offer guests free wi-fi, and not charge $15 per day for this service. Second, it's misleading for MO to say they have a private beach. I was expecting that we would have access to going into water, but that is not the case. In actuality, they have created the "atmosphere" of a beach complete with beautiful lounge chairs/umbrellas, relaxing music playing from speakers positioned in palm trees, all overlooking Biscayne Bay....but there is no access to the water. If you want to go IN THE WATER or be CLOSER to a real beach, then this not the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Views - Loved The Location”
Reviews.Author: diamondsnowball
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in both South Beach and at the Mandarin Oriental. I much preferred the location of the Mandarin Oriental. The views of the downtown skyline and the ocean from my bayview room were breathtaking. There is a very nice 1.3 mile (pet friendly) walking path surrounding the hotel, which also has great views from every angle. The views from my South Beach hotel weren't even close to comparable. While South Beach may have a lively party scene, it is not a beautiful beach. I would much prefer to view the Miami skyline over the bay, which is one of the nicest skylines I've seen. There are many outstanding restaurants within a 10 minute walk of the Mandarin Oriental. I didn't once feel isolated at this hotel...I actually felt more isolated in my hotel on South Beach, which is only a ten minute drive away from the Mandarin Oriental. If you are seeking the hip, Miami party scene, perhaps South Beach is a better spot, but for a business traveller or someone wanting a more sophisticated, urban vibe, I would recommend the Mandarin Oriental. The service at the Mandarin Oriental was also outstanding, as were the fitness facilities, the spa and the food at the restaurant. The only negative about the hotel is that the beach and pool are both smaller than they appear on the website, so you may be a bit disappointed if your main goal in visiting Miami is to soak up the sun. Otherwise, I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Fine Food but no real beach”
Reviews.Author: Travelin4Fun704
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel in order to have a 5-star experiece away from the hustle of South Beach. We thorougly enjoyed our time there. The food at Cafe Sambal was excellent. It is expensive but I expected that. I did not think the prices were outrageous. For breakfast the average dish was $15, for dinner about $20. They actually had some nice bottles of wine for around $40. The other thing I liked about it was that I did not get a feeling that the folks were standing around and waiting for tips. Service was great. As for someones comment about seeing a cockroach - one can not expect them to be able to control the wildlife of south Florida if you chose to sit outside. We sat outside for every meal - there are birds and bugs but we worked with them. The only drawback I see is that there is not a real beach. I knew that going in. The "beach" is basically a basketball-court-size sandbox with nice chairs walled by the sea wall facing the bay. My 10 y.o. daughter enjoyed it and I had a nice drink. Parking is $34 a day but that is pretty much what all these hotels charge. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach and garbage!”
Reviews.Author: rounsley
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed was hair and dirt on the floor in the part of the bathroom where the toilet was and the vent fan didn't work. When I tried to relax by the pool there was a bunch of loud and obnoxious frat boys in the pool. For some reason I thought $600.00 a night would guarantee peace and quiet at the pool. When I went to get into the jacuzzi by the pool there was a plastic water bottle, better known as garbage, floating in it. What a turn off! Then at the outdoor restaurant for dinner, Cafe Samba? I think it's called. A huge black cockroach was crawling around by the wall and then right under my feet. I screamed so loud it made a scene. My compensation from a manager that called me said "That has never happened before": translation: you made it up. Then the next part of my compensation was to tell me they would fumigate the next day: translation: we will not comp your dinner . When checking out, after telling my woes to the front desk agent, she asked if I wanted to speak to a manager. I had a plane to catch. Apparently the front desk staff have no authority to make monetary amends for difficulties during your stay. I did not have time to talk to a manager and what a hassle to have to repeat it all again. never again. at least the spa was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night for the Newlyweds!”
Reviews.Author: mrsarodriguez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in downtown Miami (Brickell area) and he booked a night at the Mandarin Oriental the night of our wedding. I am not a big fan of staying in a hotel only a few minutes from where we live because, really, why spend the money? But the Mandarin was so different and unlike any hotel I've ever been in. And the room and bathroom were HUGE! We had a balcony that faced the waterway leading out to Biscayne Bay and the view at night was gorgeous (and that's coming from a couple who has a similar view every day, since we live downtown). The hotel was quiet and breakfast was great (although I personally thought it was a little pricey). I'd definitely recommend this hotel for visitors and locals alike!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best experience I've ever had at any hotel ..5 star all the way..it is what it is!!..Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Docman115
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days and it was My second experience at a 5 star hotel..the vallets guys were unbelievable prompt professional friendly service. The hotel and the room perfect. Love the big screen tv and surround sound in the room. The tranquil ambience thru out the hotel I loved. We had our dog with us and we truly felt special and not like the dog was a nuisance for the hotel staff. Toy in the room for our dog and food. Bachi our dog was in doggy heaven. I truly felt like a celebrity at the hotel. The staff at the Mandarin Miami should be commended for there excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: umgeni
Reviews.Content: I chose the Mandarin Miami based on the positive reviews on Tripadvisor and my previous positive experiences with Mandarin Hotels elsewhere (particularly San Francisco) but was disappointed with the Miami property. A major issue is the location which is inconvenient and very isolated- you almost feel marooned on the island with very little available within walking distance- a downtown location would have even been more preferable. The facilities were also disappointing with a pond sized pool that was difficult to access and a nearby "beach" where you are unable to swim. Perhaps the most disappointing was the patchy service- with the exception of the excellent concierge desk I had service issues that were not resolved with the hotel trying to extract more money from me for anything I asked for such as a late check out or a room with a better view (I was told many times that this was because I was on a corporate rate). The room I stayed in was well appointed and comfortable but I could not sleep properly for two nights as there was a constant creaking noise which sounded like loose metal but when I called to ask for it to be looked into on two separate occasions I was told that it was probably the wind and nothing was done. I had breakfast at the hotel and the service and quality of food was fine. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a Miami experience due to the poor location, lack of facilities and indifferent service. It is at best an acceptable 4 star hotel with comfortable rooms and clean public areas.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Sehrkritisch
Reviews.Content: We chose the Mandarin Oriental because we had heard so many positive comments about the hotel chain. We needed a hotel which was close to the port since we were going to start a cruise the next day. The arrival at the hotel was fine, staff was very friendly. Then we strated having issues: we went to have dinner to one of the Restaurants, the service was extremely bad, the food was OK but even the floor was very dirty. We went then to our room and had a major issue with our air conditioning system. We turned it off but it was still making noises and this continued for the entire night! Next day we went for breakfast and the expensive buffet - the eggs benedict were cold - and if you ordered another capuccino you had to pay another $5 per coffee. Again the floor was dirty! we then went to the beach and staff was unfriendly and there was not enough space, the beach was dirt ... At check-out I complained and the lady just told me she would tell her boss! That was it for a luxury 5 star hote! I would certainly not recommend this hotel to anybody! Overpriced and overrated!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied, but not WOWed”
Reviews.Author: we5travelers
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental location is beautiful. There is water everywhere you look. The hotel is nice, but I certainly was not wowed. We have stayed in many five star hotels and this certainly was not top on my list. The service was fine, but not exceptional. The stay was nice but definitely not worth the price we paid for this room. Upon check in our bags were taken by the bellman at the front door and we were told they would be sent to our room directly. After arriving at our room, we entered to find someone else's bags in the room. We had to call the front desk to verify that we were in fact in the correct room. They explained there was simply a mix up with the luggage. The mix up took a short while to resolve, which delayed us getting ready for our evening out. The room was well appointed, but not not exceptional. The view was lovely, but unfortunately our particular room only had a very small balcony that could accomodate one chair. We had booked the bed and breakfast package, which meant we could have late check out if available and included breakfast. The late check out was not available we were told as it was a busy weekend. We did order two breakfasts to be delivered to our room. We were told at check in we had the option for in-room dining or one of the dining rooms. Upon arriving home we noted that we were charged $20.00 for breakfast. When we inquired, it was explained that there was a maximum dollar amount allowed. This is understandable, but first that was not explained to us at the time of check in. Secondly when one books a room inclusive of a breakfast the maximum dollar amount should at least be substantial to cover the cost of the available breakfast. We did call the hotel and after some discussion they reluctanly agreed to credit us for the $20.00. The spa was beautiful and we booked several treatments. I was in the spa for five hours. It, too, had a gorgeous view (in the spa suites). We had arrived early to inquire about storing our luggage as we would be checking out before the treatments were complete but we would need access to our luggage to dress in the spa after the services were finished. We were told that the bellmen could store the luggage and then have it sent to the spa at the completion of our service. This did happen but it took almost two hours for our luggage to arrive after we first asked to have it delivered. To sum up, I would certainly return to the spa but probably not the hotel. It really was not worth the price. I would recommend the hotel only under certain circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “quiet luxury in a busy town”
Reviews.Author: citymouse225
Reviews.Content: As with all MO hotels, they aim to please and you the standard you come to expect at a 5 star hotel. Service is impeccable and overall quality of everything is great. We came with two school-age children and found a board game and two big cookies in our room upon arrival. Nice touch. We also had a noisy neighbor (a guitar player at midnight) and the hotel was very quick to deal with that on our behalf. The location is also good -- close enough to cab it to South Beach and to downtown and to Key Biscayne. It's a quiet hotel -- no nightlife on property unless you go to Azul which is a high-end restaurant. The walk around Brickell Key is a treat. Nice pool, cute "beach" and awesome views. Esp when you get to see dolphins!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Hadn't....”
Reviews.Author: tom90210
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in this MO property and really wish that I had booked the Setai instead. The hotel feels very much like a business hotel and not at all like a vacation to South Florida. I am traveling with a small group and we are all planning to move to the Setai tomorrow. Sorry, MO...it's a big NO for me.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels - superb service & pure luxury - if you can afford”
Reviews.Author: elzny
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for a business trip, so I didn't have the time to enjoy the gym or spa or beach or pool. But I did eat at the Cafe Samba twice (forgot the name) - awesome food. Waiters could be less forgetful. but coming from NYC - my colleague & I were just happy to escape the snow & ice mess we have up there, so we were in a great mood & nothing could've ruined the bliss. Rooms are spacious. Great service at the reception & valet, nice touch to offer water - so thoughtful. The only reason I took 1 star off is that the rooms need some upgrading, but that could be because I work in commercial real estate, I check out properties for a living, so I notice everything - the wall paper near my night stand has some suspicious dark red splash stains (?? blood??!! grape juice?), the balcony paint has some chips, the corner of the furniture shows signs of worn, the desks in the hallway needs some dusting... I didn't bother turning on the TV so I don't know how good/bad it was in terms of resolution/HD factor. While these might not be a big deal elsewhere, but the Mandarin charges $500 for a night so it's not acceptable for them to be so sloppy. But I wasn't too bothered. I slept really well & when I woke up in the morning I had no idea where I was... Overall a great hotel & a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant retreat from south beach scene”
Reviews.Author: cmm_travels
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a sophisticated hotel with world class service, a top rated restaurant and spa/pool to relax...look no further! Even with the substantial road construction currently taking place in downtown Miami, this hotel is Worth it!! My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and found the location perfect (it's about 15-20 minutes. Drive to south beach...depending on bridge traffic). The mandarin oriental is a world class hotel chain and this location does not disappoint. It's a quiet property, but has all the elementsyoy would want for relaxation or romance (and was well suited for business travelers as well...there is a lovely restaurant scene just a few minutes drive/ or 20 min stroll away).

Reviews.Title: “Fovorite hotel anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: sailorjone
Reviews.Content: Have Stayed here for years on Business/pleasure. Have traveled around the world and nothing beats this place in Beauty of the rooms with Balconies, Service - great folks- Food and Spa - simply continuously the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: qaz123
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent urban resort. This property has large, sleek rooms, beautiful views, excellent service and top-notch facilities. We had a Deluxe Bay View Room. It is worth paying the extra money for the bay view, as opposed to the Deluxe Skyline View rooms. The Deluxe Skyline View rooms look out over the bridge that connects Brickell Key, the island on which the MO is located, to downtown Miami, and as a result, you are exposed to the attendant traffic noise when sitting on your balcony. Deluxe Bay View rooms are further from the bridge and provide better views of the Biscayne Bay. The higher the room number (i.e., Room 1717 has better views than Room 1711), the better the view. The rooms have been recently revamped and are in like-new condition. They are spacious with the all the modern conveniences and luxuries, including large Sharp Aquos flat screen TV, Denon iPod dock, multiple phones, plenty of storage space and separate tub/shower/water closet. The rooms have a Asian design aesthetic, which is consistent with the feel of the MO generally. The only gripe I have about the rooms is that the bathroom offered a one sink vanity and lacked sufficient storage/counter space for two people. We traveled with an infant, and the hotel set up, as we had requested, a crib, mini-fridge and microwave, all at no cost and with no fuss. The pool area is plenty spacious and the pool, despite what some reviewers have said, is sufficiently big to accomodate all types of guests. The views from the pool are are nice, but the view from the "beach" are even better. We preferred the beach area because we found the sun loungers to be more comfortable, and there was generally more space to move about. Service at both the pool area and beach was friendly and efficient, with good food and drink service. The gym at the hotel appeared to have almost new equipment--the cardio machines all had TVs and the weight machines were in great shape. The gym is constantly cleaned and refreshed, and offered complimentary scented towels, hand fruit, newspapers , headphones and bottled water. The gym also happens to look out over the baby, which is a nice change from the many subterrenean gyms that I have visited. Brickell Key is a nice place for families, offering a 1.5 mile jogging/walking path free of cars that is great for pushing the stoller and enjoying the weather. There is even a grass field and playground--try finding that so close to a 5-star hotel in South Beach. We ordered a number of room service meals and the quality of the food was uniformly excellent, the value propisition reasonably good and the service exceptional. The service generally was outstanding, from the valet and bellhops to the concierge and front desk staff. My wife had a treatment at the spa and was very impressed. The hotel offers complimentary access to the spa facilities for hotel guests, a policy that I applaud. Hotels that charge guests to access the spa facilities cheapen the overall experience. The locker rooms offer a steam and sauna as well as an experience shower. I found the spa facilities to be perfectly adequate, but not exceptional in any real way. There is no comparison to, for instance, the spa facilities at the Landmark MO in Hong Kong or the Ojai Resort and Spa. I found that they could have tended to the locker rooms a bit more than they did--in the afternoon, there were many dirty towels scattered about and things were generally askew. All in all, this MO meets the standard set by other MOs where we have stayed, including the Oriental in Bangkok and the Landmark MO in Hong Kong. I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to check out!”
Reviews.Author: Winetastindiva
Reviews.Content: My daughter gave us a weekend and dinner at this awesome hotel. We arrived at a busy time, so we checked in and was escorted to the elevator within five minutes. When we opened the door, we found a heart made of rose petals on the bed and a smartly decorated room. The wrap-around balcony allowed for views of the city and Bay. It was love at first sight. If you are traveling with a spouse or partner, you might like the view of the bath from the bedroom. We had the tasting menu at Azul that night for our anniversary. The food was excellent. I don't eat much Asian or Med inspired food, so the tasting menu was ideal for us. You can pay a little more and have it paired with wine. The Sommelier there is great and will suggest the wine to make your dining a pleasure. He suggested a champagne for our toast that we normally don't select. Yes, the tab and tip was more than I normally pay, but the experience was worth the extra expense. It is definitely a special occasion restaurant, if you are on a budget. We then spent time in the lounge listening to live music. The area is tastefully appointed and it gives you a calming, zen feeling. This weekend was the most relaxing hotel stay that I can remember. When we returned to our room, we found chocolate-covered strawberries and our bed turned down for a relaxing evening. The breakfast on Sunday in the casual restaurant offered menu items and a buffet choice. The buffet offered assorted breads, waffles, pancakes, eggs benedict, bacon, eggs,etc. I would have preferred a good egg white omelet. On Monday morning we ordered off the menu, because the offered a Continental Breakfast Buffet. The Cuban Omelet was great. The food is great and expensive compared to hotels where I normally stay. We walked across the bridge to another hotel to compare prices and decided we would rather eat at our hotel. The pool and service was great. We ordered Mojitos and shrimp wraps that were very tasty. We had Kobe beef burgers for dinner in the casual dining restaurant. I have not figured out the beach without being able to go into the water, but I enjoyed a swing or two in the hammock. There's cabanas, and lounge chairs available for guest, as well. Despite losing a small bag between South Beach and Mandarin Oriental, I had such a great time that I didn't worry that the bag was missing. The bag was not found but the clerk took my info in case someone found it. Can you believe that I order lunch to go? The homemade chocolate from the restaurant went on to South Beach with me, too. I am a fussy traveler, who selects 4-Star hotels and find it difficult to sleep in most of them This was a 5-Star experience. Thanks MO for my best anniversary experience!

Reviews.Title: “great service, rooms need some upgrading”
Reviews.Author: vacationjason
Reviews.Content: i actually stayed here two years ago as part of a holiday retreat. the service and the facilities were great. my main complaint is that the actual hotel rooms were much less than what i would have expected for the prices we were paying. our room needed some upgrading. the tv was old and not even a flat screen. the room need to be re carpeted. also, this hotel is quite a distance away from miami downtown/beach so there wasn't much to do outside of the organized events held by my company. overall great hotel for the service, but plenty of other options in miami to choose from where your money will be better spent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel. You'll really like it”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveler34530
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel for business of pleasure. A employee of the front desk will check you in and then walk you to your elevator. The shower, tub and sink open into the room with a shade to pull down if you want privacy. Interesting and kind of fun if you are getting dressed up for a big evening with your spouse. Wonderful restaurants and a beautiful bar that is lighted from the floor at night. Room service is perfect and the staff will treat you so well making sure you are pleased in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxurious getaway”
Reviews.Author: tl10025
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Mandarin in two years, and everyone from the bellman to the front desk reception to the concierge welcomed me back. I needed a few days away, and I also spent a day at the spa. The spa is the best spa I have been to, because of the space and the service. I would highly recommend this hotel as a relaxing weekend getaway. The pool is beautiful, and the manmade beach is heavenly-- it's private and very peaceful. They even upgraded my room at check-in without my requesting it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: RJB1000
Reviews.Content: We originally had considered the MO but thought it might be too corporate for a leisure break, having checked in and straight out of Lowes on South Beach which was a nightmare we decided to get rooms at the MO. It made our stay in Miami, so much we ended our trip there as well. The hotel was simply fantastic, very relaxing and not at all corporate to the level you may think, it's not south beach, but if you want a few days in fab surroundings in a relaxed chilled out stay this place is fantastic. We stayed for 5 nights at the start and 2 at the end. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the rooms are lovely. We had 2 rooms with balconies facing the water and it was a fab view, particularly at night to see the city lit up. The location may not suit all as its on the edge of the financial distriict so its a 15 min drive to key biscayne or 20 mins to south beach, but if you want tthe benefits of Miami on your door and a 5 star hotel this is a very good choice. The hotel sits on a small island with 3 or 4 residential expensive condo buildings, there is a 1.5 mile running track around the island/hotel. MO its own artificial beach which is actually very good, but its not a beach where you'll find jet skis on it etc. However if you want a view of the water and sand beneath your feet then its a very relaxing place to soak up the sun and makes a nice change from sitting at a pool. The MO pool is an ok size but its not huge, the restaurants were very good indeed for both breakfast and for Azul for dinner. We had room service a couple of evening and one evening it wasn't particularly good, one of my party wasn't well the next day, however the management dealt with this very quickly indeed and could not have resolved my compliant any better. As we came to the end of out stay we cancelled where we had intended to stay and came back here for the last 2 days of our stay. Summary: Great city/water hotel Fantastic water views Good location but you will need to take taxi's or car hire for trips further a field to south beach etc Very relaxing Nice pool Not for those who want to stay in South Beach type location, with large hotels with extensive pool complexs etc Fantastic rooms Good management Overall great experience Easily recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great, Spa is NOT!”
Reviews.Author: Muccimooch
Reviews.Content: I live in Miami and stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for a weekend this summer to experience the spa and feel like a "tourist". The hotel room was beautiful, and even though we had a city view (not water), we still enjoyed looking out over our tiny balcony. We had dinner at Azul (on property) and it was FANTASTIC, the food was incredible and the servers were very friendly and attentive. So, I was horrified the next day when I walked into the spa, and realized that I had basically walked into the Mandarin Oriental's basement closet. It isn't JUST small, it is cramped. It was like walking through a tunnel. The changing room was tiny, the waiting room was tiny, the steam room was SO tiny, that I felt uncomfortable being in there with another person...same goes for the teeny tiny sauna. There is NO whirlpool. Let me repeat...there is NO whirlpool. I could not believe that the hotel touted themselves as having a 5-star spa, because this was a 1.5 at best. I discussed this with my massage therapist, and he told me that EVERYONE who comes to the spa complains about it. He also told me that the spa was just about to be renovated, and I just checked the website, and it says that they spa is undergoing renovations. My opinion is, unless they are going to knock down some walls and create about 20,000 more feet of space, then the place is still going to be like walking into a basement closet. Otherwise, the hotel room and the restaurant were great! I would recommend the hotel and restaurant to friends, but definitely NOT the spa.

Reviews.Title: “A real 5 stars hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liylly
Reviews.Content: LOved Mandarin Oriental,from the moment I put my foot there til the check out.The hotel is fantastic,the staff perfect,EVerybody did everything possible to make us feel comfortable and happy there.The room is large and well decorated,the bathroom is all marble.View from our balcony was great.And I had a great time in the " private beach"!!! I`ve stayed in excellent hotels in Miami,like Epic,Four Seasons,Acqualina and Gansevoort,but now my favorite is Mandarin Oriental!!!

Reviews.Title: “Save your money”
Reviews.Author: nick60898
Reviews.Content: I was not at all impressed. We booked a room with a 'balcony' which actually wasn't. it was too small to even put a chair out there. When I questioned this with the front desk they said I had to request a balcony that I could actually sit on (like I knew I'd have a sliver of concrete outside my sliding window). We requested a late checkout but they said they were booked and couldn't provide unless I wanted to pay half the room rate ($200) to stay an additional 3hrs. Huh, I thought you were full. Gouged again! Service was marginal at best. there are literally hundreds of employees hanging out looking for tips but 'service' sorry welcome to Miami. Save your money book a top of the line room at a much cheaper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service from doorman to spa”
Reviews.Author: PGrace3224
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights in a Dynasty Suite. The room was business- like, spacious, comfortable, and clean - the balcony stretched from the bedroom to the living room. I can't say enough great things about the staff. They were all pleasant, courteous, attentive, and accommodating. Excellent, excellent service from all the staff. The hotel faces Key Biscayne (not beach). The swimming pool is small but the "beach area" is large. The spa services were fantastic. Only drawback I experienced was the absence of complimentary internet usage center if a traveler does not have a laptop. Business charges $5.00 for 15 minutes to use their pc. Otherwise, if one has a laptop, there is free internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not a real Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: Andy11081977
Reviews.Content: We went for the last days of December and start of January, the check in and the concierge desk are the only experiences that I can save, all the rest poor very poor for a MO....the restaurants in the hotel? you can survive to the one under the lobby, but to the main one the Azul, God help you! For what you pay I don't know what you get.... A special mention for the cleanliness, I belive that in this MO they don't have any vacuum cleaner......

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Miami...”
Reviews.Author: TB08
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mandarin Oriental a few times on different occasions, and really love the hotel. It is located on a small private, mostly residential island right near Brickell and very close to downtown Miami. The location is nice, but it is alittle bit of a drive to South Beach, Coral Gables, Coconut Grove,etc. It's a short drive from the design district and all of its great restaurants and shops. If you are coming to Miami for the nightlife you may want to stay somewhere alittle closer. The grounds are really nice and the entire place has a very peaceful oriental feel to it. Both of the restaurants in the hotel are really good, and the MO bar makes one of the best Mojitos I've had. The pool and private "beach" are awesome and feature great skyline views across the water. The staff is among the friendliest and most accomodating of any hotel I have stayed at thus far. The little things (like leaving cold water in your cup holder when they bring your car around) really made a difference. The concierge also opened the gift shop up for me at 11pm and brought me a pair of black socks (because I failed to pack mine like I always do)... The rooms are excellent, and very simple. Bathrooms are amazing...separate tubs and showers, large sinks, robes, scales, everything you need; and floor to wall yellow marble. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Miami who doesn't want to stay in South Beach. Miami is a great city, and there is a lot to do outside of the beach anyway, so why not give it a try...Mandarin Oriental is an amazing hotel and I am looking forward to staying at some of their other properties.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Friendly Hotel Located in Downtown Miami Financial Area..”
Reviews.Author: chris_runkowski
Reviews.Content: Miami is of course a large city with much to offer. Being from Canada, I did enjoy the hotel even if it may not have a great beach to enjoy. Located in the Brickell Key area (I hope I spelled that correctly) the man made island, on which the Mandarin Oriental sits, is impressive and it has wonderful view of the downtown sky line to enjoy at night. The Beach at the hotel is not the usual kind one may think of in Florida, but for being in the centre of town it is a nice oasis to relax in the heat and sun which I crave. The Mary Brickell shopping area is well within walking distance, as are several wonderful restaurtants locally within a few blocks away. I found the staff to be warm and friendly to myself and very helpfull even though I may not be a demanding guest. The rooms are clean and elegantly appointed and of a fair size. There is some minor construction in progress at the hotel but nothing to be upset over. The pool area is clean and well appointed with staff and sitting areas and a bar for your use. Towels are provided and staff attentive. I was also able to take in South Beach as well on this trip which I would recommend to everyone to enjoy with far too many attractiions to possibly list here. Overall a good clean hotel with much to offer....so I give it a very good rating, nothing over the top spectacular but nothing really to complain about here. My compliments to the hard working staff and continued happiness. I will be away travelling again in October and November so will be adding my latest adventures then. Bye for now. Christian.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid. Unless you're a star or an outlaw”
Reviews.Author: WanderingProfessor
Reviews.Content: Let's say it first: THERE IS NO PRIVATE BEACH! A beach usually involves a sandy access to the ocean, which is impossible there due to the location of the hotel. You got the sand, but you cannot swim in the ocean. The MOM is in an area that resembles downtown NYC, an isolated fortress for the rich and scared. So, if one expects to take advantage of beautiful Miami, this is not the place. About the hotel, it is cold and gloomy even if the rooms are great, and so is the gym, but the pool is actually tiny and the restaurant very disappointing. One thing I will always find funny in this category of hotels: Internet is extremely expensive! 14 dollars an hour. I believe the rate has been decided by the North Korean government 15 years ago, and has not changed since. Overall, it seems to me like the Mandarin Oriental is not adapted to the European and American clienteles. Staff is always making sure to use both hands to give you a piece of paper, which shows training for the Asian customers. I don't think we care about those details, but we focus on other important things. So, one great (and free) idea for management: ask employees to smile! Or ask Ritz-Carlton for a training to learn how to interact with patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel on the water.”
Reviews.Author: sookie77
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent 5 star hotel near downtown Miami. It's on a small island connected to downtown, but it feels safe and the entire island is made up of high end properties. The hotel room that we had was very large, clean and plush. We also had a balcony with a really nice view of Miami on a high floor. This was really romantic with my wife since we were on our honeymoon. We loved every moment at this hotel. The pricing is very affordable in the summer. The staff was excellent. We had dinner at Azul and the view was perfect. The food and service was excellent, and of course it was expensive. South Beach and American Airlines Arena is very close by, but you will need a car. The Bayside marketplace is also a good place to visit. Overall, this is a great 5 star with an excellent location. Quieter than staying at South Beach, but close enough to all the fun places.

Reviews.Title: “What a HUGE Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ChristosFSCU
Reviews.Content: This is an expensive hotel with an OK location and subpar service. This was a business meeting I organized and ran with 25 colleagues. Upon checking in at 3:30 pm on a Thursday I was told the room was not ready (did not become ready until 5 pm) I was given a room facing the city. I requested a room with an bay view and was told that it would be a $25 surcharge. She must have read the expression on my face and quickly disappeared coming back 2 minutes later to proudly tell me that the manager comped it for me. Bless her but if I were at the Ritz Carlton I'd been given a suite without ever asking. When we entered the room i found that the balcony the so much spoke about could only seat one person. My wife called the front desk and managed to movevus to a different room. All was fine until 1:00 am when a group of South American teenagers on the next floor had their music so loud that the walls were vibrating. It took half hour to get that under control but it was the same story the following night. The conference room the next day way uncomfortably warm before 25 people entered it. The thermostat could only be operated by engineering which took half hour to show and an hour to cool the room. The restaurants were marginal, not terribly clean and the staff left a lot to be desired. To top it off, while attempting to have a quiet breakfast on the terrace on a Saturday morning, there were workmen running power tools nearby. That on top of the boom box through the night was a bit much. At 1:00 pm web thought we'd take a break by the pool. No space was available and there was water spilling from the pool all over the deck. Again if this were the Ritz, ten attendants would be working on the problem. We went to their "beach club" which is a half acre of man made beach withnnice lounge chairs and 4 cabanas. It was mostly empty. I asked for an umbrella but could not have one because it was broken. The other two were in use. Are you serious? All 4 cabanas were empty and available. I asked, and was told that I can have one for $150 for half day ($250 full day) but that includes a fruit platter and two bottles of water. I thought of offering $50 sans fruit and water but I knew the answer. Mercifully it started to rain and we left. This is almost comical and could be enjoyable if it were not the Mandarin. We later went by the pool and managed to get two chairs under an umbrella. Within 10 min a South Florida rain storm was passing over and we were thoroughly enjoying it under the umbrella, when the pool staff lowered the umbrella exposing us to the rain. I asked why, he said he had to. Who runs this joke of a place? But it is, so I have no sense of humor left. Unfortunately, we have one more night here and I am not holding my breath for an improvement. I'll be happy if someone locked the kid with the boombox in a storage room so we could get some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, private, away from the chaos”
Reviews.Author: rda506
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! We had a corner suite with two balconies on the 2nd to top floor and the view was absolutely beautiful. We stayed here for my husband's 30th birthday celebration and are happy we choose this hotel and location (and not South Beach!). The lobby smells of incense when you walk in and every staff memeber was very friendly and helpful. Our pre-ordered and timed room service came at the exact time earlier specified and they left my hubby a sweet birthday card. :) Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thetraveldoc
Reviews.Content: My second stay at the Miami Mandarin, first time for business. Once again, the class of this chain shines with impeccable and friendly service, from the car jockeys to the front desk, cleaning staff and restaurant staff. The rooms are large, bright and celan. The beds are comfortable, the view of the water lovely, bathrooms well equipped and luxurious. The pool area is lovely, although the music could be more modern for my taste. The gym is well equipped with lovely fruit and spring water available free of charge. Restaurant food great, either at the low key Sambal or the high end Azul (where the beautiful people hang). If you want to go to south beach, it's a $30 cab ride away and well worth the night life. But if you must stay in downtown Miami for business, all in all, it's a great place to stay and worth the price

Reviews.Title: “Items stolen at private beach”
Reviews.Author: JaneSnyc
Reviews.Content: In regards to the management's response to my husband's post, I must ask the manager to take another look at how the situation was handled. After the incident had occurred, I continually had to call security, as no one was following up with us on what was being done. We asked them to file a report with the police, which they agreed to. 15 minutes later, a security guard came to our room to have us fill out a report and asked us if we wanted to call the police. Confused because I thought this had already been done, I said yes and that we already made the request. 30 minutes later, I called security to see if there were any updates; the man said no but asked if wanted to file a report with the police. At this point, I could see we were getting nowhere - clearly the staff was not communicating with each other. Half an hour after this (at this point about 1 1/2 hours after we made our first report), I decided to call the manager - it was then that I realized that I had not received one call or visit from the manager since we reported this incident. I explained the situation to her, and her response was that she thought only our sunglasses were stolen. More miscommunication. We had the police called and when they arrived, they said that the hotel staff had informed them that stuff was stolen out of our room. It was at this point I became very frustrated. Clearly, no one was talking to each other, the manager seemed to care less about what was going on, and even the police seemed shocked at the hotel's reaction. The entire thing was handled so poorly, my husband and I decided to go to the Four Seasons. The only resolution the manager on duty offered us was to comp our $25 lunch and drinks at the bar. Um, thanks, I guess? The only hotel employee who even offered an apology was the receptionist at check out. This whole issue is not about what was stolen - it's about service. An employee should be on site at all times. The manager told me it is okay for them to go back and forth to the pool area, leaving the "private" beach unattended. Had an employee been there, non-hotel guests would not have walked in and stolen our stuff. Besides, why isn't an employee on site during the hours of operation in case a guest wants a towel, drinks or food? I believe the hotel should put a sign up informing guests that employees are not always present and inform the employees themselves not to tell guests that leaving their stuff on the beach is "no problem". Don't get me wrong - the hotel itself is fine and Azul is a great restaurant. I'm just shocked at how this was handled, when a simple call from the manager and basic communication skills would have sufficed. We love visiting Miami, but when we do, we'll be staying at the Four Seasons where they know the meaning of service. The manager, Daniel Miravel, was beyond accommodating and, despite what happened at the Mandarin, our trip to Miami was fantastic thanks to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: miami_f2003
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin July 17th for an overnight stay to celebrate my birthday. From the moment I stepped onto the premises, the valet service, Carlos and Roberto were very friendly. The young lady, Jessica, at the front desk was very professional. Overall, my hotel stay was wonderful. I was upgraded to a bay view room. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Deeply disappointing service - items stolen and hotel did not seem to care”
Reviews.Author: nschwartz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I attempted to stay at the Mandarin Oriental Miami over July 4 weekend for a quick getaway. The property itself, which is located on a private island, is lovely, as are the rooms. However, the service is not nearly up to the standards that one would expect at a hotel of this caliber. On our second day at the property, we were enjoying the beach club, which is theoretically private for hotel guests only. We had ordered lunch, but it started to rain so we decided to eat our lunch by the pool, which was covered. Before we left, we let the staff member at the beach know that we were going to leave to eat, but would be returning shortly and consequently were going to leave our beach bag at our seats. She indicated that this was fine, and we proceeded to enjoy our lunch. However, when we returned, there were no staff members on the beach and our beach bag (including an iPod and a Blackberry) were gone. Despite repeated attempts, it took approximately 15 minutes for any of the staff to pay any attention to our concerns. In fact, the waiter who had been helping us previously continued to close other guests' bar tabs even after we told him our items were missing. Eventually, security was called and it was determined based on conversations with other guests who had been at the beach that two individuals had taken our items while we were at lunch. While the mere fact that there were not staff members monitoring the supposedly private beach at all times would have been disappointing, we do understand that things happen. However, it was the hotel's subsequent response that was truly galling. At no point did the hotel apologize or take any responsibility for the incident, nor make any attempts to make the situation right, and at one point the manager on duty even essentially told my wife that it was our fault for leaving our items unattended. Had the hotel responded appropriately (or even politely) we could have salvaged what remained of our stay and even left with a more positive impression of the service, but the utter indifference of the response was so shocking that it caused us to cut short our stay. We left the Mandarin and moved down the street to the Four Seasons, which was spectacular from a service perspective and even repeatedly apologized for our experience at the Mandarin. Overall, with the ample number of luxury hotels in Miami, including the Four Seasons down the street, there is no reason to stay at the Mandarin Oriental, and, in light of our experience, I am highly doubtful that I will stay at a Mandarin property anywhere else either.

Reviews.Title: “A solid five star hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Fun_Fily
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed their great service and friendliness of hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel with a 90's modern feel”
Reviews.Author: eaglebac
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel. The lobby has a really clean scent and the lobby bar has an amazing selection of martinis. The beach beds are comfortable (as are the beds in the room), although I was disappointed to see that the beach doesn't actually go into the water. Still, it was nice to get sun while laying on a soft mattress. The fitness center is awesome and has great views of the water. The rooms are clean and comfortable. It was strange to have a window between the bathroom and the bedroom but my friend and I had fun going in and out of the bathroom through the opening. One major downside is that Key Brickell is residential and I prefer to be within walking distance to South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - relaxed atmosphere, relax and enjoy!”
Reviews.Author: FFC_RJ
Reviews.Content: Two nights at MO Miami after a great holiday in Nassau. Purpose of my stay was to disconnect and relax. Mission accomplished! At the beginning a small setback due to the wireless connection. I believe that the hotel needs some technology upgrades - if compared to MO NY, for instance. All in all, after some time on the phone to fix the problem I was able to enjoy. By the way, due to this problem the hotel Manager indulged my with a free session at the Spa. Not bad at all! Service is perfect, staff is discrete, educated and efficient. Romms are spacious, clean and silentious. I had a room with views for both city and bay and it was simply amazing. Spa: perfect. It deserves 5 stars and more! Azul: great restaurant, delicious food and a fantastic sommelier - I had a tasting menu paired with great wines based on my taste and (limited) knowledge.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Mandarin Oriental saved my trip!”
Reviews.Author: empresz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here five nights and loved every waking (and sleeping) moment of our time here. We never visited Florida before and I believe we came at the "down time" where the weather was just miserable. It was very difficult to do any sort of activity when it's almost 100 degrees out and the air was so thick with humidity that you could barely breathe. Our escape was always our hotel. The main lobby area was beautiful, airy and clean. Every staff member was beyond accommodating and sweet. Housekeeping did an excellent job with keeping our room spotless twice a day. The pool area is not large, but it was never too busy like it gets here in LA. The man made beach was tranquil, but it's hard to stay there too long when you're sweating buckets from the heat. We also went to the gym a few times. The equipment was clean, the fridge was always stocked with water bottles and cold towels that were scented with eucalyptus. All in all, staying at this hotel saved my trip from being just average. Miami is beautiful and all, but I guess I confirmed that I'm a desert girl and can't stand the humidity unless I'm in Bora Bora. :)

Reviews.Title: “Distinctly Mandarin Service but maintenance details need closer attention”
Reviews.Author: lid222
Reviews.Content: Love Mandarain Orientals for service and luxury - both the concierge and front desk clerk were amazingly helpful with requests for information, dinner reservations and transportation - and they always greet us by name. Luxurious surroundings, decor, amenities - order room service just for the experience, great attention to detail and little luxurious touches! The down side is that this hotel, which I believe is only about 10 years old, needs a closer watch on maintenance issues. There are little areas that seem worn out, chipped, old, simply in need of care or replacement. Very clean rooms and hotel, it's just the maintenance issues that leave you with the feeling of not quite well cared for. Have stayed before and will definitely return again, though. Pool, beach area are awesome. Location is away from it all and the views are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall...a few quibbles”
Reviews.Author: beachmandublin
Reviews.Content: We wanted 5-star luxury for the honeymoon and we got it. Didn't want to risk blowing the budget on a South beach hotel and getting a big pretentious letdown. Stayed in Oriental in a suite for four nights - paid for 3 in deal. room was huge, great living room, big TVs, dinner in restaurant Azul very enjoyable, food was first class, the service excellent. we enjoyed the Spa but prices are a little excessive, we felt. overall found the staff very helpful and the concierge in particular for great tips on what to do in Miami. We used the hotel as a base but we really enjoyed the faciltiies. the fitness room was notable for its comfort and size, towels and water at every machine and bowls of fresh fruit. the bar in the hotel is surprisingly disappointing, tucked away at the end of the lobby area - like a small airport kiosk - not a space worthy of a Mandarin Oriental. so when you come back to the hotel, all you have is a draughty, pokey space for a drink. we took them to the room instead the pool area is very nice, the staff are very approachable and attentive. overall it's a pretty satisfying experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what you'd expect of the Mandarin Oriental Chain”
Reviews.Author: fivecDorset
Reviews.Content: Room nice - v comfortable bed. Lacking in little touches - no moisturisers etc left in bathroom. Bathrooms a little tired - shower not great - could do with a bit of modernisation. Bar in hotel atrocious more of lobby hatch than a bar! Swimming pool very very small for size of hotel - very disappointing. Staff hit and miss, a couple of really helpful staff, others off-hand and in need of sessions in customer care! Island nice to walk around. Breakfast nice. Expected a little more luxury it is not a patch on hotels in the chain in the Far East.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best - the place to stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: shildon
Reviews.Content: We were in Miami for the weekend and had the perfect stay. The room, the view, the restaurants, the pool / fitness room and, most importantly, the service were all excellent. We are planning to go back to Miami, in large part because of the wonderful time we had at this hotel. We thought about staying in Miami Beach but after spending a day there, we were glad to get back to the Mandarian Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay, would return”
Reviews.Author: michmsg
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for our mini get away and we were very pleased. We found each and every staff member to be very helpful and the service from the concierge desk excellent. Our only comment for change would be to not charge guests for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to impress”
Reviews.Author: bwcooper
Reviews.Content: I wanted to spend a special weekend in Miami for my girlfriends birthday. This hotel really impressed my lady from the friendly staff to the grat decor in the rooms. It was one of the best getaways we've had together!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but it is pricey”
Reviews.Author: bhsu21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a little 3 day 2 night trip to Miami. Our family booked with AMEX so we had the added benefits of a $100 spa credit, $200 resort credit, breakfast for 2 every morning and a 4pm checkout. We had 6 people so we had to book two rooms. I thought about booking us on South Beach but with these benefits, I decided to try out this hotel. It is located on a little island but it is not far away from shopping and restaurants. Bayside Marketplace is about a 5 min drive from here. We were greeted very nicely by the valet and bellhop. Checking in went smoothly. They showed us to the elevators.
