Pros: Rooms were what you'd expect from the Mandarin Oriental. We were upgraded to a Deluxe Skyline view and were able to see the city and the bay! Amazing view! There is a table and two chairs out there for those who want to sit there and enjoy the view. Could see the pool and the little beach from our balcony. Had breakfast at Cafe Sambul the next morning. Very delicious breakfast! We bypassed the all you can eat continental breakfast and ordered something off the menu. Prices are not cheap though. My mixed berry juice was $6. That morning we had 5 and our bill was about $135 total including service charge. I wouldn't normally pay this much for breakfast but we had the free breakfast credit and the resort credit to use. I really like the lobby. They burn incense inside so there is a light smell. I loved it though. Cons: There were somethings I didn't like however but it didn't ruin my overall experience. In the room, the bathroom and the main room are open. Meaning you can totally see in. However there is a blind you can pull down for some privacy. However that doesn't mean you can't hear what's going on. I'm sure it's fine for couples and families but if you're not too comfy with your roommate, it might be weird. In the room we were provided with one umbrella. We had two rooms so we had two umbrellas. However we had six people total. One day we went out and it was raining. We just needed one more umbrella and would just have two people per umbrella. We went to the front desk to ask and the lady said we were only allowed one umbrella per room and could not give another!!! Unbelievable. The rooms are $500+ a night and we just asked for an extra umbrella to borrow for the day. Surely they can afford umbrellas. I was disappointed. This class of hotel seems to go out if its way for the guests but in this instance, I don't understand what's the big deal with just one more umbrella. Also like many have said on here, it's crazy to charge $15 for Wifi when the rooms and everything else inside the hotel costs so much. Valet parking is $34 per day for example. Budget hotels give away free Wifi. Don't understand why the expensive hotels need to charge when they're already making a lot of money from other areas. We never used the Wifi. Overall, our stay was nice. We slept well every night. Staff was friendly. Didn't get a chance to enjoy the spa. Food tasted nice even though it is pricey. Luckily we had the resort credit. Would I stay here again? If I'm just going with my girlfriend, we would look somewhere else cause of the price. But because my mom went and a family friend from overseas, sp we stayed somewhere nicer. But if you're looking to stay at a fine hotel and are willing to spend the money, you will enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever! The Spa is Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Sharttle
Reviews.Content: I have to say The Spa is Amazing!! Best Spa I have ever been to. This is a 5 star hotel all the way! Amazing rooms! Comfortable Beds. Huge Bathroom! Luxury. Beautiful Decor. The Pool and Jacuzzi are to die for. Great for relaxation! I have nothing bad to say except everything is very expensive in this hotel, if you dont mind paying $7 for a hot green tea then stay here. With that said I would stay here again, just for the Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: lex2901
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter, you know you are going to be relaxed. Beautiful bay views, wonderful over sized rooms and a gorgeous bathroom. I was very, very content at this hotel. All of the food and cocktails were delicious and service was spot on. I would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Every bit as good as those in Asia”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: Brief visit, close the perfect. I have stayed at several Mandarin Orientals in Asia and thought this captured the feeling very well.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay ... quiet relaxing oasis ... just watch out for misc costs”
Reviews.Author: stephentrip
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on Brickell Key and faces Miami. It is perfect if you want to be removed from the busy areas of South Beach but still only a short drive to either the city (just across the bridge) or to Miami Beach itself - 10-15 minutes away. The room was spacious and quiet (we were fortunate to get an upgrade) . There is a fairly large exercise room (no stairclimber), with several treadmills and resistance equipment. We used the spa and pool area - .. wonderful massage, .. both very relaxing. A comment on charges which make an expensive stay even more so - daily WiFi, overnight parking, and morning coffee .. One morning (9 AM), we went to work out at the gym , asked for two cups of coffee and said we'd be back shortly to have breakfast (which would include unlimited coffee) - they said the free coffee service ended at 8:30 AM, so we were charged $9.50 for the coffee -- low class . Otherwise, the miscellaneous rates are pretty standard (i.e. expensive) for the area - for eg.$35/overnight parking. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Would recommend staying if you want a quiet relaxing oasis.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacobfuller23
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely hotel for 2 nights and we have been totaly satisfied with our stay. We had a very warm welcome by the stuff and given essential information that we needed during our stay. Without any exception, all the hotel staff were very friendly and so warm not to only us but every guest in the hotel. Our room was large enough and very comfortable. We can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobolito
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel sits on a tiny island and does not have beach access, it is a spectacular hotel in many ways. We spent two nights in a beautiful room with a great city and water view. Every thing was 5 star all the way. Staff is probably the best I have ever encountered in the U.S. All were extremely helpful and kind with out being over the top and in your face. The concierge, bellmen, front desk, room service, wait staff, and spa clerks were all there to serve in the highest way possible. Room set up and amenities were wonderful. Every thing was clean as can be. You never once on any floor saw house keeping and it is amazing because the hotel was full and they cleaned 2 times a day. The food was fabulous in every restaurant and the drinks were top notch. My spa treatments were some of the best I have ever had. Nothing fancy or over the top in this spa but wonderful quality. My husband said he had someone who seemed new for his session and his treatment was just so so. Oh well, it was my turn this time! It is a nice walk over the bridge to the area called Brikell. We ate at a wonderful local restaurant, the name I forget, but it was just a short nice walk and amazing food. The gym was spacious and had all the equipment you could desire. The pool was tiny and didn't have too much atmosphere. (this is probably my only complaint.) They had lounge chairs with imported sand at one edge of the island but there was no water to go in at this area. This hotel is not a trendy hot spot like some may want in Miami but it is truly a wonderful place to chill, be served and be quiet. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: riblet80
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Friday morning (2/19) early and the junior executive suite I reserved was available. I asked for an upgrade (AMEX program) but the clerk kept saying" we have you in the room you reserved". I asked 3x. Oh well. The room was beautiful and large with a nice terrace overlooking the key. The bathroom is open to the bedroom but you can close a blind for privacy. I do not like this new trend of open bathrooms. There is a seperate shower from the tub and a private toilet. Nice touch. The room was spotless and very quiet. Bed very comfortable. My 2 complaints: 1 the charge for internet access. 15/day or 35 for 3. For 700/night they should provide wi-fi. 2. Overnight parking is 34/night, but hey it is Miami Beach. The pool area is lovely but not large. Not a pool for lap swimmers.If you are there on a sunny/warm weekend I would go down early and reserve a seat. They have very eager pool staff who immediately approach you to set up your towels and offer advice on the best area for sun or shade. They do allow you to save seats. I got there at 9:00 am and was one of the first, but the attendant told me 6 other people had saved chairs and then went off to breakfast. They did not come back until around noon, by which time every chair was taken. They constantly come around offering ice water/suntan lotion/fresh fruit kabobs. A very nice touch. You can eat right at the pool in your chair or there is a small area to eat right off the pool. The beach is lovely, (no water access). They have large king sized beds you can lay on and relax along with hammocks. The beach area was not crowded so if the pool area is too busy check out the beach. They serve drinks and food there as well. They are very accomadating. I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Luxury”
Reviews.Author: TeaTrip
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference with my husband and our teenage son. We had a great stay and found a cute little neighborhood sandwich/grocery shop within walking distance. As others have mentioned the beach is unusual since it doesn't provide access to the water but it is very pretty. We had the pool all to ourselves which was luxious. My only complaint was the Internet access. It seems the more you pay for a room - the more they expect you to pay for the extras. I was totally shocked that they wanted to charge for wifi in the lobby after we had already paid for it in our room. They promised there policy was going to be revamped ... but a recent check only reflected free Internet with some rates such as Business.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiguyz
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay 3 nights here before embarking on a Caribbean cruise. The hotel is nice, but we had read many glowing reviews describing it as really something special. It is nice, but it's just that--nice. Not extraordinary in any way. We think there are better choices in Miami for less than the $495 rate we paid.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: cemory268
Reviews.Content: This hotel is breathtaking! First, my compliments to the staff! Every person we encountered was helpful, friendly and very professional. The employees are as lovely as the hotel! My compliments in particular to Roberto, Carlos and front desk person- Khalid (spelling?). FANTASTIC!! We stayed in the Biscayne suite, and believe me, there is nothing like it! What a beautiful room! The furnishings were elegant, and the bed was sooooo comfortable! The bathroom was absolutely exquisite. The tub is enormous and makes for a very romantic setting. The sitting area was magnificent and the view from all rooms was spectacular! The terrace was simply amazing as it encompassed both a view of the city and the ocean. I could go on and on, but suffice it to say that you will find no better accommodation than the Mandarin Oriental! This hotel has EVERYTHING, and the attention to detail surpasses all others! From the bed linens, to the bath towels, to the comfy robes and slippers, to the flat screen televisions, to the fabulous staff and hotel grounds--- this place is exquisite!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to getaway inland.”
Reviews.Author: emiliomendoza
Reviews.Content: One of the best places I've ever been. You feel better than home!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Amy R
Reviews.Content: Service is amazing. Rooms are beautiful and immaculate. Restaurants are wonderful, but very pricey. Pool is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good...but a little bit more to great!”
Reviews.Author: Saxmax
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for five days. Gorgeous looking hotel from the outside as well as on the inside. From the onset, I would've never stayed in any hotel except for the Mandarin Miami. Rooms are clean and spacious. And, the terraces are always a good plus. Though the staff were very nice and accommodating, being used to luxury Asian hotel hospitality, I would've appreciated a little more attention to detail. This is something I am sure the Four Seasons or the Ritz-Carlton will not be lacking on...more so will the Mandarin Oriental in Hong Kong be lacking on this front. Do I recommend this hotel? Yes. But study it's location carefully and see if it fits what you want in Miami. It worked out just fine for me. Oh, valet parking can cost you an arm and a leg too.

Reviews.Title: “Every moment, every detail, absolutely amazing.”
Reviews.Author: judsonabts
Reviews.Content: Every moment, every detail, absolutely amazing. Summer was coming to close here in Boston and my girlfriend and I weren't ready to put away our swimwear. After spending countless hours comparing hotels on every island in the Caribbean, I realized that there were no guarantees for sunshine, most hotels involved compromises and with only a week off I wanted to maximize my leisure and relaxationâ€”not spend the entire first and last days of our time off traveling. After reading many mixed hotel reviews and upcoming weather reports for the region and I was frustrated. Then I remembered my stay at Mandarin Oriental, New Yorkâ€”where the accommodations, service and general atmosphere made the hectic center of New York City feel like a leisurely escape. I had been to their properties in Boston and Riviera Maya, Mexico as well. There is a consistent feeling when you enter a Mandarinâ€”it is calming, sophisticated and luxuriousâ€”what I wanted in a romantic/leisure getaway. Neither of us had been on vacation in quite some time and so we wanted perfection and at Mandarin Oriental, Miami we got it. Arrival: From the moment we stepped out of our taxi, everything was absolute bliss. The charming staff treated us like royalty, they learned our names, and made themselves available at any momentâ€”with a sincere smile. The lobby has fantastic views and smelled incredibleâ€”I was told it was some jasmine incense, I don't usually like incense, but this was instantly relaxing and therapeutic. We had arrived approximately an hour before check-in, which was not a problem as they upgraded us to an available room for free. After being brought some delicious peach tea blend, we were shown our room. Room: Our room was stunning. Plenty of space, quality furnishings, very comfortable bedding; it also had a unique layout where the bathroom opens up to the rest of the spaceâ€”yes; the water closet is still separate. The vibe was very romanticâ€”relaxing and exciting. The huge flat screen television and ipod/iphone dock with a Denon sound system were nice bonuses. We used that iPod dock nearly the entire time, but when we didn't, the hotel was dead quietâ€”as if we were the only ones there. The view from the 18th floor was surrealâ€”the entire downtown Miami skyline. I did have one serious issue with the roomâ€”No HDTV. A 40"+ flat screen television looks pretty bad without a high definition signal. I noticed there could have been more counter space in the bathroom. Leisure by day: While I had planned several day trips and nights/dinners out, after being at the hotel for only a few hours we had little interest in leaving. We spent our 5 days and 4 nights almost exclusively at the hotel. By day, we split time between the infinity pool and the hotel's private beach along the bay. The pool was clean and very refreshing. I did not understand how they overlooked the pool nets and floatation devices on the fence that interrupt the viewâ€”but at this point I was being very picky. The private beach was like stepping into another worldâ€”laying out on daybeds over white sand in the middle of a gorgeous city skyline. The staff, as always was very attentive to us. When my girlfriend would mention to me she was thirsty, seemingly out of thin air was a staff member with ice water. When I would start to sweat, someone was there with a eucalyptus-scented cold washcloth. The drinks were a little too sweet for my taste, so I asked them to make them a little bit strongerâ€”from then on we never had to ask again. Being a hotel guest you can use the spa facilities any time for freeâ€”take advantage! Steam room, sauna, oversized towels, plush robesâ€”a great way to relax pre-flight as we did! We got a couples massage. While I get intense bodywork once a weekâ€”I had never been so relaxed as I was after our couples massage. It was pricey, perhaps a little over-the-top for my budget and the changing room was a bit small, but a nice way to spend a cloudy afternoon. I would highly recommend a day at South Beach. The water, the sun and the people are beautiful. The concierge gave us directions for a great drop-off location close to the best shopping and dining in the area. By night: At night we would sit out above the pool area in the chic M-Bar; watching the distant thunderstorms, listening to the sounds of the rolling palm trees, enjoying the warm Miami breeze, sipping from one of the hundreds of cocktail offerings. The server at M-bar found out I had been to their Riviera Maya property and had a special drink he concocted for that menu. Ask for the Riviera Maya! We utilized room service every night to some degree. Yes, it is expensiveâ€”but not unreasonable. Our meals, the presentation and the friendly staff delighted us. The hotel is a bit secludedâ€”so late at night room service is the only option unless you want to walk about 15 minutes. I believe all the food is served from Cafe Sambal (one of the two restaurants on-site). The Pad Thai is incredible (best Iâ€™ve had), and we couldn't get enough of their Sushi. The Sushi is perhaps the best 'value' on the entire menuâ€”fresh, flavorful and delightfully presented. We spent our final night at the hotel's signature restaurant, Azul, which I have written a separate review for. You cannot stay at the Mandarin Oriental, Miami without spending a night dining at this restaurant! I could not have asked for a better vacation. I realize that this review lacks much negative criticismâ€”but it is simply a difficult resort/hotel to find fault with. Yes, all this luxury, pampering and decadence, comes with a hefty priceâ€”we left feeling like we received an excellent value. We sacrificed a couple nights stay somewhere else to afford what we had at Mandarin Oriental, Miamiâ€”but it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - true 5* experience”
Reviews.Author: Mark2211
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at the Mandarin. Our room was upgraded upon arrival and the lobby was very welcoming. The bedroom was excellent - clean, spacious, lots of natural light, wonderful shower and bath etc. The spa was wonderfully relaxing and luxurious and I would recommend anyone to at least head for the sauna and chill out room! The restaurant we used was truly excellent, although we didn't get chance to try the famous 'Azur'. Although I'm not a reviewer who picks out every flaw, I do feel that it's worth noting a few areas. We would have really appreciated tea and coffee making facilities in the room, rather than having to ring down every time we needed some. Also, our upgraded room had a very small balcony and our ideas of sitting out under the stars were slightly dashed! The cost of the car rental was also very, very high. However, it is also true that we could have gone elsewhere for our car and highlighted any issues we had to the staff (who I am sure would have resolved them!). We didn't, so I guess we deserved it! The hotel staff were excellent throughout our stay and I'd like to take this opportunity of thanking them for a truly wonderful service. First class hotel and fully recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere a little different in MIA”
Reviews.Author: Jan_ATL
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night on our way through MIA, but really enjoyed the hotel. Service was excellent. Room was spacious and really well equipped. Pool was great. Zero to complain about. The Sun Fun & More rate is great value - $250 per night and includes breakfast ($65), valet parking ($30) and a 4pm check out - a steal we thought.

Reviews.Title: “Take a pass on this one! I would stay at the W or the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: Geekontherun
Reviews.Content: I had looked forward to my trip at this hotel. When I checked into my room they told me my room was not available. This was at the check in time. They told me they were "upgrading" me to a better room. The better room was right on top of the elevator. Additionally the room was hot. I turned the thermostat down to 60 and it still was not cooling. The gauge stated it was 72 but the temperature was at least 90 in the room. I went down stairs and they sent up engineering. They were in my room for more then an hour. I found out from the engineer that the temperature was regulated outside of my room. No matter what the gauge in the room stated it was not going to change. They told me that they would cool the room down. This was after he asked me if I opened the doors which I did not. I called the manager and he was down right RUDE! He told me that no one else complained. I went down stairs and asked for another room. I had to leave for dinner so I did not have time to move my things until after. When I returned the room they gave me was on the 20th floor at the same location. It was HOTTER THEN THE ROOM I WAS IN. I did not move. I stayed in that hot box all weekend. The hallways were a hot box. I went downstairs and one of the people in my group said the same thing about her room. Additionally, I had the pleasure of hearing the elevator all night long. Moreover, I would not spend a dime here! I travel extensively and TRUST me this place is overrated! Service is horrible! They do not care whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “Plush, if you fancy it”
Reviews.Author: nickoedwards
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Mandarin for more of a stop over period of 4 days. It was in November and as it was Florida, the weather was great. The hotel is based on Brickell key looking into Miami, as you would imagine the hotel is very plush with exotic bars, resturants and a man made beach. On the Friday night we arrived the reception area was full of large private cars and beautiful people, there was a party on the man made beach. I'm not sure if this was a one-off, if it wasn't you need to be at this party, it was amazing. Our room was on the 7th floor with an amazing view and furnised very extravagantly as your would expect. We headed out to South Beach on Saturday night, the concierge at the Mandarin was very helpful with his knowledge, advise and contacts! I don't have any faults with the hotel itself other than the distance from South Beach itself, but I do suspect that if you wanted to stay in Miami and weren't in need of an over extravagant hotel then you might consider staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place away from the hubbub”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend & had a wonderful time. The hotel is beautifully done (elegantly simple with an Asian twist) & the rooms are incredibly inviting. Had a room with a city view, which was perfect. You get a water view, as well as nightime skyline; loved sitting out on the nicely sized balcony (even in the August heat). Service was good, but a little spotty (it could have been the weekend crew, valet service seemed appreciably better on Monday morning). Housekeeping was spotless & invisible. Restaurant (only ate in cafe 3x) & poolside service was a little slow. Nothing was bad, but didn't seem quite up to the 5* level you expect from top-end hotels. The location is both an asset and detriment. Its placement on an island off of downtown provides great views & virtually no noise. the downside is that you have to drive everywhere & there are no restaurants or shops within walking distance (you are essentially forced to eat there for a light meal, snack or breakfast). HOwever, I was happy not to have to deal with the noisy, drunken masses of South Beach & more than willing to make the 15 minute drive when I wanted more excitement. The pool (& poolside sushi bar) were great. Not too crowded, though I don't know if that would be the case in peak season. I agree that the beach area is a little forlorn & appears slightly neglected. It is apparent that they created an artifical beach; I didn't use it at all. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay & would absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Not a holiday hotel”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelledKW
Reviews.Content: We chose the Mandarin Oriental for its reputation as one of the best hotels in Miami. We were, however, sadly dissapointed. The hotel did not live up to expectations. Whilst the service and food was good. The pool is tiny with only a few sun beds, there is no beach (unlike the pictures on the website which are incredibly misleading, it surprises me they have not had any consumer related action in that respect), they charge $36 a day to park your car, and it is miles from South Beach. We made an error in the location and that was our fault - we would have been much happier on South Beach, but, nonetheless, the hotel is not a 5* one it professes to be. I would not return to the Manadrin Oriental and would not recommend it to people going on HOLIDAY to Miami. It's a business hotel and nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Accolades Deserved”
Reviews.Author: IADbound
Reviews.Content: Spent three (3) nights at this hotel. Valet is flawless, as entrance is relatively small, so eye contact is easy. As one would expect, the lobby and common areas are Caribbean mixed with Asian flair. Very clean, crisp colors and sight linesâ€”very relaxing. Check-in is sort of a scavenger hunt (to the left), but not ridiculously so. Rooms are the best I have been lucky enough to sleep in. Cream and brown throughout with an all-marble bathroom with separate shower and water closet. Sleeping quarters and bath are not really separate rooms, but I actually liked the design (think a large pass-through). Balconies are a great place to relax and it is hard to imagine a bad viewâ€”either the City of Miami (Brickell Financial District to immediate west, downtown to the north), the Port of Miami/Miami Beach (due north), or the Atlantic Ocean (due east and south). Turndown service is a sight for tired eyes and does those little things such as turn on soft, relaxing music. Asked for small space in honor bar for personal snacks and housekeeping obliged. As for the hotel grounds, they are beautiful to look at. The problem for us was what to do. The pool sure cost a lot to build and is visually impressive, but is it small and in an odd spot. Drink service at pool was bad. There is a small (fake) beach at the tip of the hotel, but with a seawall at the end, you cannot swimâ€”making it more of a â€œnightâ€� spot than a â€œdayâ€� spot. Service at beach was almost non-existent. There is not a whole lot more to the property, as it sits on tightly packed (and security gated) Brickell Key. Ate at Azul, which was great, but not memorable (given the tab). If you stay here, you had better be comfortable navigating the City of Miami. Coconut Grove, downtown, Miami Beach, and Key Biscayne are all right there, but navigation is like any other big cityâ€”requires some thinking before calling for the car.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dejan317
Reviews.Content: That was our first stay in Mandarin Oriental Hotel. We stayed for 10 days and during that time everything was great. The rooms are very comfortable and very well equipped ( LCD, Hi-Fi...). The room were cleaned twice a day so they ware very clean. Bathroom was clean so everything was as it should be. The stuff is very friendly and helpful. They were nice all the time with smile on there faces, each single time you look at them. The downside of this Hotel in my eyes are only the prices. We had dinner in Hotel restaurant and we had some Thai food with 2 glasses of red wine. We payed something over 100$ for that and in my opinion that is too over priced. Prices are also high when you order a drink in hotel bar. But in Hotel like that what should I await. Only big minus are parkings, because they offer only valet parking which is not cheap. Its great that every time you go from Hotel there is your car waiting, but I payed more for parking the car in Hotel as I gave for complete rental the car :( Overall the Hotel and Stuff is great and i would recommend this hotel to everyone that would like to have a good time and have some taste of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: bsqgeo
Reviews.Content: If you want to be pampered, it's worth it. The facilities were great! the pool, beach, Spa/Gym restaurants. We enjoyed it all. But dont' expect it to be cheap. We had a nice dinner w/drinks at it was about $160 for two. a small pot of coffee in the room as $12.00 before tip. But the service, rooms, view. overall attitude was very nice. If you want to enjoy the time you spend, they will take care of you. I think in a 2 hour period. My girlfriend and I used about 6 towels between going to the beach and having them make up the beds, then going to the pool. and the gym before hand. Bring you credit card and relax!

Reviews.Title: “It was ok I Suppose”
Reviews.Author: allaround87
Reviews.Content: ive heard many good things about mo over the last few years and wanted to try one out for myself. This was my third time in miami but the first staying away from south beach. All was good with the hotel door staff very helpful and polite and made you feel welcome. Rooms large with great views however found a porn film on the dvd player on check in to the room, reported this to reception and gave it to them however they did not appear to interested or apologetic which was very strange. Food in the fine dining was of a high quality although poor for vegetarians which is typical of miami in general. Room service, great if not pricey, wish i could say the same for cafe sambal and the poolside bar overpriced and not that great $19 for a club sandwich and not a great one an that when combined with the very slow service was not good at all. Strange layout of the hotel m bar tiny wish it had been a lot bigger and constant charges for everything, $36 a day for parking then $15 a day for internet access then a 10% service charge on the mini bar(in your room !!!!!!), it all starts to add up to an already expensive hotel which don't i have a problem with it's all the additions that are standard in many other lower standard hotels and would not be charged for. Overall nice but your paying for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: caetanomi
Reviews.Content: I love Mandarin Oriental because of the great service and i got a wonderful welcome from the staff when i arrived as throughout the whole stay. The room is spacious, has an "open" bathroom that is always not ideal but works for most of us. Housekeeping was excellent and i truly felt that my room was cleaned in every detail. Maybe there are cooler places in Miami to stay in that are closer to South Beach but if you want to be sure to have a great stay i would defenitively recommend Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a great stay and received even better”
Reviews.Author: rpdl1402
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at Mandarin hotels before so we knew we were in for a treat, but Mandarin Miami was even better than I had expected. To begin with, we received a complimentary upgrade upon arrival - a crazy upgrade to a beautiful suite overlooking the Bay. Room was great - we had a minor problem with a few ants in the corner of the room, called front desk and maintenance was there immediately and no further sign of the ants for the next three days. We were in Miami on business but we found time to enjoy the fantastic pool and 'beach' area - great poolside service and a beautiful view. Azul was fantastic dining, but lunch at cafe sambal could have been better. I know it is the more casual restaurant in the hotel but there could have been more attention to detail in service, food quality and presentation - the outdoor dining area was a bit run down as well. Overall, great experience. I did not find the hotel to be too far from action on south beach - it was actually a very peaceful feeling to cross over to the Mandarin after a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “SURPRISING MANDARIN”
Reviews.Author: EddieMonaco
Reviews.Content: 1) Checking in, we found some dirty underwear from the previous customer in the closet. 2) Ten minutes later girlfriend freaked out : she spotted some suspect stains on the one of the pillows. 3) The plumbery ( water and shower taps) usually remains in one's hands. 4)The reception will not ask permission to "retain" any amount they decide to on one's credit card , as it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Oriental magic?”
Reviews.Author: Riki747
Reviews.Content: Had a quick 3 day detour to Miami after attending a seminar in Tampa/Treasure Island and the Mandarin was high up on my to do list. Overall it was an enjoyable experience but lacked the attention to detail one expects of the world class Mandarin Oriental group -it prides itself on looking after the smaller details and hence distinguishes itself from most "run of the mill" 5 star hotels. Sadly, in my case, these finer details were lacking...... By the end of the 3 days i had clocked up a number of items which put it into the "run of the mill" category. Most of the "criticism" centres around the service levels of the staff, particularly the food and beverage outlets. It is still a good hotel and i guess for most travellers (not used to the highest of standards expected of M.O.) they would be very pleased with the end result. I would add that from some of my observations there were also others who would come to the same conclusion as me. e.g. waiting over 15 minutes for a "non existent" beach attendant. Looking now at some of the reviews i would come to the conclusion that the hotel "offers" attracts a less experienced traveller who has nothing but praise for the hotel based on their "lower" previous experiences. Finally, praise where praise is due: Carlos the bell boy, i think he has a great future either with M.O. or a similar hotel group and is a budding future manager (Jorge, please note) along with Priscila in reservations who was most helpful in assisting me with a few queries -both exceeded my expectations, thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect..”
Reviews.Author: apples99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Miami to celebrate our one year anniversary and we stayed here just because we didn't think staying on the strip would be for us and we were looking for a little bit of r&r type of vacation - staying at this hotel was the best decision ever!! From the moment we stepped in to the moment we left, we felt as if we were with friends and it made our celebration all the more special. From fixing your bed and leaving a little orchid, replenishing toiletries right away, second wake up call with a weather update, complimentary water for your trips.. really just makes you feel as if you are not just another customer. Customer service at its best without being intrusive! The pool area is great, small but it fits in right in with the homey aspect, the beachfront is lovely and the beds are perfect to lay on and let the world pass by and sip one of their signature drinks. The spa is experience is something in itself, from the elderberry tea to the soothing instrumental music in the background, aromas (not sure what it is) that linger in the air, just feels like you got transported to another realm. We had a car, so we were able to drive around - this is a far cry from the hustle of South Beach, which of course we visited. No trip to Miami is complete without a stop to the strip, but it was lovely to come back "home" to Mandarin Oriental. Parking is a bit expensive and we looked at other options but your on an island, so you have to use what they offer. If possible, definetly do Azul, the food is really good, not excellent, but the service is something to be experienced. We ate at Cafe Sambal once, the sushi was good - try to order room serivce atleast once, I think the items are from Cafe Sambal but its just so much better to have it set up in your room especially breakfast!! So in a nutshell, was it pricy, yes but not as much as some other places we have been to but it was totally worth it. Take advantage of the specials they have on their site and try this place. You will be so happy you did!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, wow, wow...”
Reviews.Author: explorepossibilities
Reviews.Content: This was our first Mandarin Oriental stay and it was amazing â€“ everything... the lobby, the restaurants, the service, the rooms. We stayed one night here after a cruise, the last night of our trip in celebration of 5 years together and I let the hotel know that in advance. We were just getting off a cruise, so we went to the hotel early, around noon to see if we could check in. There was a wait, but it is not like we are preferred guests â€“ however, I was informed that a room was available, but we should wait for our room because we were being upgraded to a Bickel Suite! The suite was beautiful â€“ one an a half baths â€“ 885 square feet, we were on the 18th floor (room 1805). I cannot begin to explain how happy we were with the room - it was ridiculous. Not to mention, the bed was covered in rose petals and a rose, the bathtub (huge) was full of rose petals and chocolate covered strawberries adorned with orchids were delivered to our room as a surprise later in the evening!!! This was the best night of sleep on the 10 night trip. We had breakfast and dinner at the cafÃ© on the property and ordered sushi by the pool and both were wonderful. The pool was large enough and towel service was fantastic. We were there on a Friday and Saturday during the day and only saw about 20 other guests total near the pool. Keep in mind, we are independent ladies and â€œbudget travelersâ€�, so we do not require these perks, but I cant imagine more efficient service. Saying we are budget travelers should not suggest we do not know of luxury â€“ I just put in the work to find fantastic deals, we travel off-season and we do not require constant assistance. We will ALWAYS, ALWAYS check for a Mandarin Oriental for our future travels (not that it will always be the best deal, but I will check this branch first if they have a resort in our travel destination and be willing to pay a reasonable amount more for a room knowing we will be 100% (+) satisfied :-).

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great location & service, but over-priced”
Reviews.Author: Fikoukla
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times over the last 6 months. Without doubt a very comfortable, beautifully appointed hotel - just what you'd expect from a brand like the Mandarin Oriental. Its location on Brickell Key gives it great views in every direction, the water and the high rise skyline of the CBD. However, its location is also kind of dull - there aren't any local shops or restaurants, except for expensive corporate steakhouses in other hotels or apartment buildings. My main gripe with the hotel is that I think the rooms are underwhelming for the price you pay. They are lovely, beds very comfy, bathrooms impressive - but they lack the wow factor I'd expect for the kind of money they're charging. And the cost of the in-room dining is huge.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Best For South Beach”
Reviews.Author: kimberlynyc120
Reviews.Content: This won't be a complete review because we did not really experience this hotel service or food wise. We booked the Mandarin in Miami based on great reviews but were disappointed when we got there and, while waiting for our room to be ready, checked out the pool area. It's very disappointing. For a luxury hotel, the pool/"beach" area looked pretty average. The pool was really small and there weren't many chairs around it. The "beach" area, which is just basically a giant sand pit with beds on it, was SO big, yet the pool and pool are was SO small. My husband and i were really underwhelmed and based solely off of that, since relaxing outside was our sole purpose for going to Miami, we decided to move over to South Beach and stay in a hotel on the beach. I dont want to comment on the food or service or anything else. Im sure it is all up to par with the Mandarin chain and we had a fine experience with the service, the short time we were there, but it just seems weird to go to Miami and not be near the ocean. In the end, I think that this hotel should have an amazing, palatial pool that is up to par with the mandarin name and it just isn't. Bottom line, Im sure this is a great hotel, but if you're looking for an optimal pool/beach experience, I dont think this is it.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: LocusPointBaltimore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four nights during a recent visit to Miami. The service was great and the location was perfect. A short ride to South Beach. Best place to stay for a lovely weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The Spa Scam.”
Reviews.Author: abtfulmind
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are very well appointed, and the staff is very helpful. But, the Spa is a Scam. I made an appointment for a facial, and after arriving was told that the services that I had arranged for could only be had if I paid for a significant upgrade in price -- despite the written descriptions in the Spa guide. Basically, I felt like I was at a car dealership. It was a bait and switch operation. To further enforce this impression, the manager was unapologetic about the scam, and coldly agreed to release the "non-refundable" deposit that was required for an appointment. It was a very disagreeable place, and I recommend avoiding it. To make things worse, the hotel management was unavailable to receive my complaint on the matter.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: morehou30
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four night trip to the MO Miami. I loved absolutely everything especially how they referred to me by name. I had the dynasty suite and loved everything in the room... The only thing I was displeased with was the pool and Oasis beach club service. It seemed to be very slow. I love how they offer complimentary tastes of their homemade smoothies and water. The staff was very courteous and referred to me and my girlfriend by name. Room service was brought up quickly and the food was still very hot. All in all for the price and everything you get out of this hotel I've yet to find one in Miami that tops the MO.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: EmilieV7
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I mentioned to my father that we were planning to stay at The Mandarin Oriental he assured us we'd have a lovely stay and said "Mandarin Oriental really knows how to run a hotel!" We couldn't agree more. From the moment we pulled into the driveway to the moment we left -- our stay was as perfect as it could be. Everything gets high marks: service, location, food, decor, view, cleanliness, quiet, spa, drinks at the bar, comfort of the bed, calm friendly professionalism of every staff person we encountered, etc, etc. We love it and can't wait to return. When we arrived an affable professional porter immediately approached our car and offered us bottles of chilled water, gathered up our bags, escorted us to the check-in desk and handed us small glasses of iced tea. Check-in was a breeze and the upgrade that came with our room based upon availability was given to us without a snag. The style is modern, sleek, contemporary, colorful and tasteful. Gorgeous and innovative while at the same time projecting a restful confidence. Make time for the Spa because it rocks. And the food in the restaurant downstairs by the bay is delicious with sparkling fresh sushi, ceviche, lettuce wraps, sashimi and great drinks. And, the martini bar adjacent to the third floor lobby reception area is a wonder -- 250 martinis all overseen by a terrific bartender who makes quite literally the best martinis that any of the 4 of us had ever tasted. He took the time to us what we like vis a vis flavor, sweetness, tartness and then he went away to create a tart fragrant ginger martini that I will be dreaming about for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect until a staff member pissed me off”
Reviews.Author: missnice2012
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I take a sweet random weekend get-away to Miami for particular no reason. He decides to go out with friends, I decide to stay in. I go downstairs to the small beach pool area to the small sand area. I am by myself, not a lot people down there. A staff member comes to me, and ask "What am I doing here?" and demanded to know my room number AND see my key. I thought that was annoying. We haven't been there since. Really a turn off, it sucks. We used to stay there 4 times a year. Whatever.

Reviews.Title: “Another great mandarin experience”
Reviews.Author: buccsmf1
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the New York City mandarin oriental many times before we decided to give the miami mandarin a try. Everything was up to par as far as mandarin standards go, beautiful loby, modern romes with great electronics, wonderful views. Location was great, it is located on a small island off the main portion of maimi, the island is private and i believe there are just a few high rise condominum complexes along with the mandarin, it's very private. My massage at the spa, while very expensive, was the best i've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag, but 85% great”
Reviews.Author: Goldrusswoman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Mandarin Oriental in Hawaii (before it changed hands) and loved the style and level of service there, so thought we would give Miami a chance. We were there for 3 nights. Roomâ€”We specifically asked for a room without a connecting door, was assured at check in that the room we were assigned didnâ€™t have one, and when we got there, there was the door AND a card addressed to another guest with a plate of chocolates for that guest. A bit bizarre---did we get someone elseâ€™s room? Why was there a connecting door when they were so confident there wasnâ€™t? We called down and they changed the room, and our bellman handled it all with ease, but it delayed our getting comfortable/settling in. The room was beautiful, beds comfy, and quiet. In terms of the room layout, the only concern, although it wasnâ€™t a problem for us, is that there is a large opening between the bathroom (sink/shower/tub) and the bedroom (toilet was enclosed in its own area). They had a shade that could come down, but if you werenâ€™t with your spouse, it may be a little strange to hear someone in there showering and using the sink. Turn down service was excellent. Staff---friendly, helpful, welcoming. Beach---So itâ€™s not a â€œrealâ€� beach but a large man-made sanded area on the intercoastal--- thereâ€™s plenty of sand to feel like a beach, but you canâ€™t go in the water. But it met our need to lie out in the sun, the big beds are wonderful. It wouldnâ€™t appeal to children. Itâ€™s located on the major thoroughfare for boats leaving the harbor. Nice to see the boats, big and small, go by, but there was a frequent smell of fuel. There was a lack of service on the beach---all 3 days there was no one there to set us up and we needed to go back to the pool to get someone. We were never approached on the beach to see if we needed water/drinks/food. Obviously this was not the level of service we expected or have experienced at other hotels at this level. Restaurants---All food was wonderful. The sushi in particular was stellar. Because this is a very international hotel, we were one of the few tables speaking English at any meal---this wasnâ€™t a problem, but may be for those used to a more American atmosphere. Wine list seemed to be limited with a focus on California and European wines. The only white we drink are Sauvignon Blancs from New Zealand, but there wasnâ€™t even one on the menu. A short walk over the bridge brings you to a few nice restaurants (we went to Rosa Mexicana---excellent margaritas and guacamole). Azure was great. Pool---we didnâ€™t spend any time at the pool. It was â€œintimateâ€� (small) and not what you would expect from a resort. There was constant music there, which we found irritating. This seems to be a bad trend at many even high-end resorts---itâ€™s unlikely that everyone at the pool likes the same music, and most people travel with iPods these days, so itâ€™s an irritating waste. Fitness Center---was well equipped for weight lifting, which is what we wanted. Spa--- I usually get a massage twice per month at home, so I am always interested in the quality at a high end hotelâ€™s spa. I got a 50 minute massage and it was just OK; she seemed to spend a lot of time on pressure points, not really massaging. They went on to me that they just got some elevated rating for spas but I found that the common areas were new, but not unusual or anything special (common sauna and steam room, two showers that had a curtain, not really private. The one I was in wasnâ€™t clean and had a draining problem). I was not invited to use the shower in the massage room. Overall---A mixed bag, what was positive was great. Given the size of the pool and the beach, this isnâ€™t really a resort for families.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Hotel I have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: catwoman84
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel and was turned away by security and staff. We were harassed. Worse hotel I have ever been to. Too much hype. If your not a celebrity, stay away because you will not be treated with the same respect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Style and Service, Exactly What A Hotel Should Be!”
Reviews.Author: Afuego
Reviews.Content: Just a great hotel. The design is gorgeous, if you enjoy asian styles this is for you. The housekeeping is at the top of hotel industry. The hotel is secluded enough to have total relaxation, yet a short drive from many great South Florida sites. Make sure you to visit the Spa, which provides complimentary facilities for guests, and Cafe Sambal, which has a great staff and delicious breakfast. The view is just great too. For a special occasion, if you save money (parking is $36 a night!), I cannot recommend another hotel, Mandarin Oriental is it!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and Hip!”
Reviews.Author: 2TravelerNuts
Reviews.Content: This is a very stylish modern hotel. The views are stunning! My husband and I went for my birthday. This is the second time we have stayed here. The first time was for our honeymoon. The hotel is perfect! The only neg comment I can make is that the rooms are a little pricey. Other than that, this place will make you feel like a jet setter!

Reviews.Title: “By far the best hotel and service!”
Reviews.Author: JamJorAnto
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed at. We stayed the night before we went on a cruise for our honeymoon and it was wonderful. Valet was very attentive. Don't expect to open any door for yourself. The guest service desk was very informative. The concierge desk was wonderful. The room was great and they set up a romantic scene for us while we were out with rose petals and chocolate covered strawberries and plenty of extra soaps for us to bubble bath. A personal note from the manager and a flower. The staff brought up our bags to the room. The bed is comfy. Only downside was the tv was small and the round kind, not plasma. The room has a cordless phone, mini bar with lots of bottles if you don't want to leave your room. The bathroom is open to the bed area and our room had a beautiful view of the water and the city. The best part of our stay was that we were getting ready to leave and we discovered that we needed a new battery and memory card for our camera and we asked concierge where the nearest camera shop was and he sent someone up to our room to get the camera and an hour later returned the camera, the battery and a memory card. They went out and got it for us! They didn't charge us to go and get it, only the cost of the items were added to our bill upon check out. There's nothing they wouldn't do for you. It was awesome. I checked out the pool area but didn't use it. I didn't visit the spa or any of the restaurants but it was still excellent. I wish we would've stayed there longer. :)

Reviews.Title: “My absolute favorite hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: AbdullahKuwait
Reviews.Content: My absolute favorite hotel in Miami I frequently visit Miami and had the chance to stay in several hotels. Having spent 30 nights there over the course of the past 3 years, the Mandarin is my favorite. The main drawback as most people familiar with Miami know is that the hotel does not have a real beach. Also, the pool is a little small. Other than those two things, the hotel is excellent. The staff are very good. Very helpful and friendly. While the staff at CafÃ© Sambal are quite good, they can try to be a little more proactive. For example, at breakfast they see me carrying several plates from the buffet back to my table for my kids and they donâ€™t volunteer to help me, however, when I ask them they do it very eagerly. At breakfast (especially during holidays) it gets crowded and the service can be slow and a little frustrating. The room service menu is VERY limited after 11pm. They are in the process of upgrading the AV equipment and during my most recent stay the equipment in the connecting room for my kids was upgraded but not in the suite. The SPA is AMAZING one of the best in the world. The ambiance is very relaxed. One of the things I look for in a spa is a separate locker/shower from the gym and the pool and at the Mandarin spa the facilities are top notch. They have a large number of treatment room and therapists on hand so getting an appointment is not a challenge. Even though it does not have a real beach its is on a small key/island and is very well integrated with the surroundings. There is a very pleasant walkway circling the island and itâ€™s a good 30 min walk. There is a small park with kids playground that the island residents use and my kids love going there. The concierge were very helpful in making my arrangements but they really put a big surcharge on transport and car hire. The hotel has an amazing lobby with breathtaking views of the ocean and the Miami skyline. During prior stays it was very lively with good food and beverage service and live entertainment (afternoon/evening), however, during my most recent stay I hardly noticed any live entertainment or food service. I found out coincidently that the hotel has an arrangement with a nice beach club on Miami beach (South Beach) which hotel guests can use, however, I wish they made this more obvious. Overall, its an excellent hotel, with some room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm!!”
Reviews.Author: MacyLondon
Reviews.Content: I'd give this hotel four and a half points if half points were possible!. I've subtracted half a point merely because the hotel is expensive, and you will need to get a cab whenever you want to go out to the shops or bars (south beach is around 20 minutes drive). BUT if you're happy to relax in the hotel - or if you're a business traveller - it's perfect. You cannot fail to feel pampered and relaxed. We thought the service was impeccable and I was surprised to read some of the negative comments. Every member of staff (front desk, spa staff and pool staff) were focused on making sure we had a comfortable stay. We loved the complimentary smoothie samples by the side of the pool!! I would also recommend Azul (the hotel restaurant) which serves delicious asian fusion food and fantastic wine.

Reviews.Title: “Hype...Just a Lil”
Reviews.Author: Cruzan22
Reviews.Content: We just completed a seven night stay at the Mandarin in Miami. Overall we were pleased with the stay but felt the hotel did not live up to our expectation of service from a Mandarin. Noone ever addressed us by name. I thought that was a signature for Mandarin. The service is definitely on the cold side except for the housekeepers They worked very hard and were always asking us if everything was okay and if we needed anything. They were just great. Front Desk left a lot to be desired, especially considering the usual standards of Mandarin Hotels. We asked on numerous occassions that the luggage needed to be brought up, but time and after time they forgot and we had to call and ask again. One morning we were awakened in error by a wake up call that was meant for another room. They apologized for the error. The hotel lobby and pool grounds are beautiful. The rooms are medium size, well appointed, and views are okay, nothing too great. There is construction going on next to the hotel and there are two big construction cranes. We could see one of the cranes from our room. The food and drinks at the pool were pretty good but nothing fabulous. I did not see anyone using the pool with the palm trees in it. They never offered to set our chairs up in that pool as it pictured on the web site photos. The pool with the palm trees is much smaller that you would think from looking at the web site photos. The hotel is a great respite from the constant action on South Beach. Every time I entered the hotel I felt like I was in my own sanctuary. Very quiet, great smells fill the air, it really is a relaxing environment. Free bottles of water at the valet desk and use of hotel umbrellas is also a nice touch. We went to the health club on a few days, it is very large and seems to have all the equipment one could need. The views of the city are nice, expect for the building across the stree that is under construction. We spent a lot on cabs, but felt the cab service we received was very good. We secured a great room rate throught Travelocity, we paid $200/night for all seven nights. We enjoyed our stay but really have to say that we were disappointed that the hotel did not meet our preconceived notion of Mandarin service standards.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TB123
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 4 nights at the Mandarin Oriental in Miami and to be honest Iâ€™m glad it was only 4 nights. True the hotel is a spectacular building in a fabulous location however the moment you enter you canâ€™t help but feel that something is missing. The entrance lobby is has floor to ceiling glazing which offers fantastic views across the bay but little else. The large open space doubles as the hotel bar which lacks any kind of atmosphere, that been said, the rooms are large and very comfortable with fantastic bathrooms and great views from the balcony. The pool area is small and the pool (almost an infinity pool) is not heated and is consequently pretty cold. Incidentally the comments from other tripadvisor reports is unfortunately inaccurate, the service around the pool area is not just poor its pretty much non-existent. On all but one occasion I had to make up my own sun lounger and get my own drinks from the bar, my only comfort was the fact that this was the case for most pool users, unless they happened to look like a movie star or a model. With the exception of a couple of the valet parking guys I would best describe the Mandarinâ€™s staff as being aloof and unhelpful. There are on two restaurants plus pool cafÃ© at the Mandarin which given the fact that itâ€™s located on an island and a good walk 10 min walk from alternatives, means that choice is strictly limited. Despite this fact the food is very good, expensive but very good. I would strongly advise making a reservation at the Azul restaurant as this does get very busy especially over the weekend. A great alternative to the hotel restaurants is the Island Market Place, a small super market / deli that serve good coffee and hot food as well as some fantastic sandwiches. The Island market place is a short walk form the hotel towards the centre of Brickell Key â€“ I would urge you to try it. On a number of occasions I found myself being disappointed by the Mandarin. These disappointments largely relating to the fact that I felt I was being exploited. For example; â€¢there are no tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms or complimentary drinks in the lobby which means if you fancy a drink you have to pay $7 for a coffee from the restaurant. â€¢ Distilled water was placed in the rooms however if you wanted spring water it was in the mini bar and was chargeable â€“ penny pinching! â€¢ Internet access was charged at $15 a day. I would expect the above to be complimentary in any half-descent hotel, but for some reason the Mandarin considers itself to be far too superior to offer these amenities to its guests. The Mandarin Oriental Miami could be a fantastic hotel it has a great location and has good rooms however the attitude of the hotel staff really lets this place down. If I go back to Miami Iâ€™ll be staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the MO”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelhk
Reviews.Content: I booked (what I thought) was a good internet rate direct with the hotel online at $200 a night. When I checked out 3 nights later, the bill for food, spa and the fixed 18% gratuity cost me over DOUBLE of what my room cost! The staff did try their best, but I don't think their service warranted the 18% gratuity I was forced to pay at the restaurant , room service and spa. Whilst this hotel was a fairly decent hotel, the image on their website is decidedly different to the actual hotel. If you saw a private beach on the website, you will be surprised to find something similar to a sandpit with a couple of deck chairs and a few sad looking cabanas. The pool was small and chairs were placed closely together. The Spa was a reasonably sized where I had body, face and hand treatments. I had to shuffle between 3 different rooms, which defeats the purpose of "relaxing", having to dress, undress and walk around the spa to get from one room to another. I was surprised the hotel room just had a bulky old TV that didn't even have an entertainment system. No movies or music on demand. The selections on TV were similar to those found in Holiday Inns. Complimentary toiletries were very limited - just had shampoo, conditioner, soap and lotion. The bathroom had a big bath, but no bubble bath to put in for a good soak. The tap on the sink didn't extend long enough into the sink, so water went everywhere when you tried to wash your hands. The gym was located in a weird place - by a door next to the M Bar (!?) Or you can go via the Spa by lift. This hotel is nothing to rave about for the price that I ended up having to pay for the extra services. It was not quite the MO experience I was expecting being from Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “WIsh We Stayed Elsewhere for our Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: WestEndAvenue
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling on business this is a great hotel; but for those of us wanting to get away for a long weekend in Miami go to South Beach. The hotel is very nice. However it is a bit of a bait and switch. The rates are great, but once you get here the drink/food (and cabs...because it is near nothing of substance) gets to be very expensive. As a matter of fact I spent more on cabs then we did on airfare from NYC. One-way cabfare is approx $30 to South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Service Not Good Enough at Mandarin - Lauran Childs and Prime 112 Trump Again!”
Reviews.Author: MrMouseNewYork
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin has the reputation of having the best service in Miami, but it's still a shocker! Quite a nice hotel - we liked our room, and the bay view, although hearing the noisy hotel guests next door was not a pleasure. Obviously the Mandarin needs to sound proof it's rooms, as should most hotels. Service around the pool is terrible. If you can get the attention of a waiting person, they will often nod their heads and say yes, they'll get your order - and then it doesn't appear. Some friends of ours arrived and wanted a drink above the pool, and had all manner of problems getting served there, including being ignored. When eventually they got a drink the champagne was served in a plastic glass, even though they were well away from the pool. Not good. Other than that, it was a delight to be able to go to see Lauran Childs' art studio again in South Beach (www.MiamiArt.biz). One evening we went there and bought a couple more paintings, then went on to Prime 112, which had wonderful food, of course. Service in the Mandarin is slow and often inefficient - for example room orders were often not quite right, although I might specify, for example, that I want warm milk with my coffee, then cold milk would arrive. This is not acceptable for a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, mediocre pool service”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller360
Reviews.Content: We had a very relaxing stay at the Mandarin Oriental Miami, the Front Office staff was lovely and the service excellent. The room was simply perfect, relaxing like a spa-suite and had a gorgeous view. The only thing I could complain about was the service at the pool and the beach. That was absolutely not what I know as the Mandarin Oriental Standard. The waiters were unfriendly and barely took a look if we needed something. I couldn't even recognize a smile during my whole stay. There can be improved a lot, especially if I compare it to a hotel like the Oriental in Bangkok... They should go there and see what real 5* service looks like. Besides that, great place!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: girlmar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mandarin Oriental last week and have to say that everything is simply top notch. Excellent food and service, attention to detail is phenomenal. Furnishings and comfort of bedrooms and public rooms is second to none. We are returning next month and would not contemplate staying anywhere else in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Savage Hotel. Perfection”
Reviews.Author: ciarmoran
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the mandarin for eleven nights in January. Everything about the hotel was fantastic. The high prices truly reflected the facilities , the standard of service and the quality of the food. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and served always with a smile. We have no hesitation in recommending this five star hotel to any five star travellers- young or old. We are both in our mid twenties. We will be going back !!

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Stefsims
Reviews.Content: Checked into this hotel and was amazed at the level of service, from the car valet to the front desk staff. The hotel is amazing. The furnishings are well appointed and modern. The rooms are fabulous with georgeous bathrooms and amenities. Would stay here again in a "heart beat". My view was phenomenal! Only place to stay in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Angela6
Reviews.Content: we checked into the hotel after our cruise and the hotel was fab. we got a great rate online, I think this may have been reflected in our room as the balcomy was more of a "one person standing area" but never the less it was a great room and the view amazing. As it was our honeymoon we had a lovely message and strawberries in our room and rose petals on the bed - I'm not sure if this is normal , but it was fabulous. The Concierge were great, recommending a great restaurant in south beach. It was fantastic food. The facilities at the hotel were great, lovely pool, we didnt go the beach area as we had too much shopping to do! We went to a big Mall that you can get to on the train its basically the end of the line. There's a cheesecake factory and all the normal shops nine west, macys etc. cost there and back was $6 each! and you get to see some of Miami. We also went to the everglades which was a great trip - organised through the hotel. All in all a great couple of days to end our honeymoon - would I recommend the hotel? - absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mandarin - great Zen experience”
Reviews.Author: bubblybianca
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. We stayed on South Beach for a few days and then checked in to the Mandarin Oriental. You feel relaxed as soon as you enter the hotel - the atmosphere is beautiful, very serene. Our rooms were wonderful - spacious, modern and had all the amenities one would need. Staff was very helpful and professional. This is not the hotel for you if you'd like the typical South Beach experience - it is for those who would like to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city, in a wonderfully calm and zen environment.

Reviews.Title: “Good for relaxing but far from everything else”
Reviews.Author: jy99
Reviews.Content: I went here with my boyfriend in June for a short 3 day trip. We were really excited because we had seen all the pictures on the website and of course Mandarin has a great reputation. They happened to have a cheaper rate that weekend so we decided to book this location. The GOOD things first - The hotel is beautiful - the lobby was clean with modern decorations and very sophisticated. The people in the lobby were helpful (although a little too helpful wanting to take your luggage for the tip). We checked into our room and it was beautiful - the bathroom especially. There was an opening between the room and window that could be closed with a shade. A glass shower, tub and bathroom closet. The not so good things - Pool is NOT what is pictured on their website. I was expecting a huge large pool, but it was really small. There weren't that many chairs, and if you didn't get there in time there was no room. Drinks were way overpriced. The private "beach" area they claim to have is just a small man made area of sand (no water to even go into) and some beds / chairs. Hotel is very far from everything else. Very few restaurants in walking distance and cabs were really expensive to get into the main part of Miami. Would recommend this hotel for those wanting to just stay at the hotel and only relax there. If you are wanting to experience the rest of Miami, go to the beaches, go out, not the hotel to stay at. We probably spent more money on cabs than food.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to relax”
Reviews.Author: supersunfish
Reviews.Content: After a busy stay in New York, the Mandarin was the perfect place for me and my wife to relax for a few days. The hotel itself is excellent. Our room was spacious and had a great view. The bathroom was massive. Staff were always polite and very helpful and we made good use of the fitness suite which was fairly well kitted out. The pool was a little small for the size of the hotel, but overall it is a great place to stay. As other reviews have said, it is about $25 taxi to south beach, but there are a few nice restaurants close by in a small complex just off Brickell key.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon heaven”
Reviews.Author: eaglesham
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Mandarin Oriental in Miami for our honeymoon was truely a wonderful experience. From the moment you walk into the foyer, you enter a calming, relaxed environment. We found the staff to be very friendly and extremely approachable. The concierge provided great information on restaurants to visit. Staff at the pool and the beach were very attentive, making up beds and bringing water throughout the day. The beach is beautiful and extremely relaxing and the pool and outdoor spa bath also ideal. The rooms were extremely spacious,especially the bathroom and were kept immaculately clean by the maids who visited twice daily. Every day, a goodnight mat was left on the floor, alongside a next day weather report and a quote with an orchid. each of these little touches added to the experience. The views were simply stunning looking over biscayne bay. Although the hotel is located in downtown Miami and requires transport to South beach, the superb facilties at the hotel encourage you to spend most of your time at the hotel which we did. There are plenty of places near to the hotel to eat and drink, one of the best being the Rosa mexicana only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. I would definately recommend staying at the Mandarin in Miami as I found it to be very luxurious. I am now looking at staying at one of the hotels in another country as I thoroughly enjoyed my holiday in the Mandarin in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: Brian&Alan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel recently for 3 nights. The Hotel location was a disappointment. Although you have a nice view over Biscayne Bay, I would have preferred to be on South Beach which was a $25 cab ride each way. The hotel is not really up to the usual Mandarin Oriental standard. Having stayed at Mandarin Oriental properties in Asia, this one looks dated. The rooms are nothing special. Very little asian influence and very bland. The bathrooms are a good size and well equipped, but again, nothing special. I guess I have high expectations of Mandarin Oriental and have never been disappointed (up until now). On the plus side, the concierge, and Giselle are worth a mention. She was fantastic in assisting with restaurant reservations and an excellent choice of bars/clubs etc. The pool at the Hotel is also a good size, but again, looks dated. The private beach is really not much bigger then a sand-pit and not at all what I expected! Would I stay here again, well....you know what, probably not. I bet there are other properties in Miami for a similar price but of a much higher standard and in a much better location. I guess to sum up, the hotel was average and more worthy of a Sheraton, but not a typical Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: scottyb72
Reviews.Content: In September 2007, I stayed here for three nights on business and it was a fantastic time. I booked through the Mandarin website hotel directly and received a great deal - probably because it was toward the end of summer (low season) - but still nice time. The room had a unique layout and was wonderful since it was not your typical box hotel room you see more and more of these days in chain hotels. King bed very soothing, sofa and seating area cozy and comfortable. Bathroom was maginficient - great soaking tub and see through shower so you can see outside - great shower head. Toiletries top notch as expected. The small things really made it, for example, the mini box of chocolate waiting for you, the full ice bucket set up for you every night and the orchard. The only problems I had were hotel key demagnetized and the television was old and picture quality very fuzzy. Had some time off from business and spent it in the pool - so calm.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: HotelHelixAGM
Reviews.Content: I recently had a fantastic stay at the Mandarin in MIA. The service was excellent from start to finish. The door/valet staff was friendly, engaging, and above all knowledgeable! The room was spotless, all of the mundane details that some places miss were addressed with overwhelming consistency. They truly exceeded my every expectation which is not an easy thing to do. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious, Service Without Exeption was Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: ATLTravelsALot
Reviews.Content: Overall a fantastic property with incredible levels of service. The only downside is no beach - but, took the shuttle/option of using Casa Casuarina (former Versace mansion) on South Beach one day and it was such a nice change of pace. Pricey but worth it - you don't mind paying premium prices when you get what you pay for. Just be aware the hotel is NOT on the beach and in fact has very little beach/swimming compared to actually being on South Beach. On the other hand, it is more relaxing and not as hectic as the overall South Beach experience. Rooms are perfect - no problems - great bed and great bathroom. I have stayed in two room types and any room at this property from a furnishings/functionality perspective is very nice. No request went ignored and overall staff training/experience level is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place”
Reviews.Author: NYCGirlNyc
Reviews.Content: This is the third time my husband and I have stayed here and we have enjoyed each of our stays. Check-in âˆ‘ Fast, no wait, polite service âˆ‘ Booking was easy, did over the phone, however I requested a crib and high chair for our 6-month-old baby and we did receive an email confirmation confirming my request however when we checked in there was no record of this. It took a very long time for the crib and high chair to be brought to our room âˆ‘ We valet our car, however they did not retrieve our entire luggage and we had to call down to request that everything was brought up- they apologized about the error and we had our remaining bags within 15 mins Rooms âˆ‘ All of the rooms offer nice views of either the bay or the ocean âˆ‘ The amenities are very nice âˆ‘ Rooms are spacious and nicely appointed in calming tones âˆ‘ I think all of the rooms offer soaking tubs âˆ‘ The hotel provide slippers which is a personal pet peeve I have with hotels that charge high high prices but can not even bother to provide slippers. I mean how much can they really cost and who wants to walk around barefoot after getting out of a shower on hotel carpet âˆ‘ Beds are comfortable and linens are nice âˆ‘ The baby crib we requested was very nice to look at, however the mattress in it was horrible, very soft and not comfortable at all âˆ‘ House keeping was good, not great but well enough. A few things that should have been removed remained in our room the entire time (example empty paper cup of coffee) Food/Pool âˆ‘ Did not get room service so no comment âˆ‘ The two restaurants offer a good variety of food options, enough so that you do not need to leave the Mandarin to go elsewhere (provided you are only staying one weekend) âˆ‘ Service is very, very good. The staff at Sambal remember us by name the second day, which was very nice, servers who did not wait on us even asked us where the baby was. âˆ‘ The pool is unusually small for the size of the hotel however I have never found it to be crowded âˆ‘ Pool offers wonderful view of the water and it is truly a very peaceful place to relax âˆ‘ Poolside service is fast however the food is not the best âˆ‘ Poolside service is just ok, hard to flag a waiter, hard to get more towels, etc âˆ‘ Spa/Gym âˆ‘ Great gym as far as hotels go. Lots of new equipment to work with âˆ‘ Spa is beautiful and treatments are worth the price âˆ‘ Spa exercise classes are a mixed bag. I have taken yoga twice and the first time the instructor was great the second time she was just awful to the point I thought she may injure some new students in the class Over all we love this hotel, however this last time left a few things to be desired. We will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise stay was the real Vacation”
Reviews.Author: scotchyroo
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Mandarin Oriental Miami for Easter weekend before leaving on a Royal Caribbean Cruise from the Port of Miami (a five or ten minute drive from the hotel). We took our five year old son. Every single aspect of our visit was perfect. The staff was kind and professional. They treated us very well.
