We participated in their easter celebration which was lovely. The room was large and clean. Oddly, it was the best part of our trip. The Royal Caribbean cruise sucked.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: wgw_ssw
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fantasic weekend trip to the Mandarin Oriental-Miami. This was our best experience ever in a hotel. Service and attention to detail was the best we have ever experienced. From the time we droped our car with the valet on Brickel Key until we checked out, we were treated like VIPS. The room was wonderful. We were there celebrating our 15th Wedding Anniversary and they had roses in the shape of a heart on the bed. The view from our balcony was breathtaking. We saw the boats sail through Biscayne Bay. Everthing about this hotel is world class. It was such a unique experience, very different from the "chains". The room included: bathrobes, a Bose radio, stocked bar, pillows with goose down feathers, clear glass shower etc. We ate dinner at both restaurants. Azul is the eclectic restaurant with food prepared by chefs. Cafe Sambel is the "daily" place with out of this world food. We were delighted in how our food was presented and prepared in unique ways. I had the Hot Stone massage at the Spa and it was the best massage I have ever had. We went swimming in the "Infinity" Pool and had drinks afterward on the deck. We also sun bathed at their private white sand beach under palm trees. We will remember this trip for a long time This place is expensive no doubt, however, for a SPECIAL experience this is a place to consider. I choose this hotel because it was ranked #1 in Miami, and I now know why. Think of this as an investment in your relationship.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: srosenberry
Reviews.Content: I was not sure what to expect with this hotel being downtown, but it was perfect for a weekend getaway with my husband. The service was excellent, the views were remarkable from every angle of the hotel. If you are looking for the South Beach scene, this probably isn't for you - it's quieter and much more low key....but if you are looking for a nice weekend to lounge at the pool, take advantage of the spa, etc., pure relaxation, it is lovely. Only caveat - there is a "man-made" private beach,but not a place where you can swim.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ildici
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pure luxury! We had a "spa-room" on the 6th floor, those are the ones with the huge terraces (we were upgraded at no cost upon checking in from a standard room). Bathroom is amazing, bed is very comfortable, the only complaint we might have is that the A/C is kind of noisy and you can't turn the fan off completely (we are used to sleeping in total silence at home, that could be the reason why it bothered us a little). Service all around the hotel (valet parking, concierge, restaurants, bars) is impeccable, very professional and kind. We loved the private beach as well, drink service on the beach is very convenient too and the sun beds are so comfortable! We would absolutely stay here (or in another Mandarin) again and would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: gnolect
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, beautiful decor, very attractive setting, lovely ocean view. But for the price, it did not offer what I would look for whether I was there on vacation or business. For this trip I was there on business. I was 'upgraded' to a deluxe room with small balcony and view. But the room had two standard sized DOUBLE beds, not even queen size. For $500 a night, my feet hung off the end of the bed. Room had internet hook-up but no wireless and they charged $15/day for it. C'mon! even the Hampton Inn provides free internet! The pool area was very small for the size of the hotel. There was a private beach area but it is also small and it's man-made so it's not like enjoying a long stretch of Florida Beachfront. Except for being on the water, It's not particularly well situated for much else. It's a cab ride to everything. There's a walking path around the site, but there's no place to walk to. There did not seem to be anything of interest on the city side. On the plus side, the room was well appointed (except for the standard double beds) and had a fabulous bathroom. The conference area was spacious and well organized. We only had buffet style meals so I can't really comment on the food, but our buffet meals were very good. There is a spa but I did not see it and since I'm not into the spa experience, for me it doesn't add value. I did not mind staying since it was business and I wasn't paying, but I would not consider coming back here for my personal holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Miles From Anywhere”
Reviews.Author: YvonneUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights - big mistake as it's just so isolated - perhaps good for business travellers but not for holidaymakers. Just to go anywhere else do something like visit Coral Gables/ South Beach/Bal Harbour involved a 30-45min cab ride so added at least $80 a day to your costs. Ghastly fake beach - no shade - very windy so be careful if you go outside in sun. Pool looked totally uninviting and a bit dirty. Hard old sunbeds. Most souless atmosphere in Sambal Cafe where you ate breakfast/lunch/dinner - like being in a concrete open fronted warehouse. No flowers anywhere to add some ambience. Azul Restaurant supposed to be highly desireable in area but very expensive. Was well annoyed at being charged 18% gratuity PLUS local tax on everything which added 25% to prices shown on menus, whether breakfast, snack or drink. Maybe I'm stupid but America is seriously expensive even with the Sterling/Dollar rate at present. Cost $5,000 for 6 nights with only 3 dinners!!! No champagne either. Bedroom was very comfortable - but no catering for overseas guests - i.e. no channel on TV for foreign services like BBC World which you get everywhere else - all American stations only. Staff very nice though but so they should be at those prices. Would never go back - view was okay if you like looking at office buildings and a bit of water. Such a disappointment really for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aadalal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin for a few nights in March. I have to say that the service was excellent. The entire staff team was extremely gracious. The 1.3 mile loop around the hotel was wonderful for jogging/walking and the fitness center was very well-equipped. The only complain we had was that the pool is a little too small - especially when the hotel gets busy. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Relaxing Experience”
Reviews.Author: aluciano
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin for two nights, and have never received such great customer service in my life. The staff was friendly and professional, the rooms were amazing, and the food at Cafe Sambal and Azul was phenomenal. And the martini bar has over 250 types of martinis! The only downside to staying at this hotel - for me - was the beach. While laying on the man-made beach was nice, there isn't any access to the ocean... which is a big negative for me. The pool nearby is very nice though, so at least there's some water. This is not the place to stay if you're looking for an active nightlife (the hotel is about a 15 minute cab drive into South Beach), but it's a great way to pamper yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Zen Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Foodmaster68
Reviews.Content: Have been there about half a dozen times before, always enjoy the peaceful zen spirit. This weekend was no different, but some observations. The hotel service was top notch, although the restaurants were somewhat slow; waited 25 minutes for a sandwich and sushi roll. The pool area is very small (although hip and easy access to cocktails and snacks), but the fake beach was very relaxing and quiet. This is not a hotel for small kids; better for business people and hip couples. The views of the bay are amazing, and the food and drinks at all the restaurants are high end and healthy. Small aside: Lobby chairs were stained, needed replacement. Overall, the meditative quality is worth the price tag, and the hipness of the clientele adds to the overall "star quality" feel.

Reviews.Title: “What you get for $655”
Reviews.Author: Travel Richly
Reviews.Content: Sorry but I don't get the hype here. For $655 a night, one gets a 4 star hotel room -- an old, medium-sized TV, worn curtains, carpets and armoire, a stained white sofa, and a lousy shower head. The bed, though, is very comfy. Plugging in my computer required unplugging the one desk lamp as there were only 2 sockets available (the internet charge is $15 per day). There is no coffee/tea maker in the room and so, if you order the SMALL coffee from room service, you will pay $13 (once you add in the $3.50 delivery charge, 20% service charge, and sales tax). Be warned that the room doors are constructed so that they will slam shut if left on their own to do so (NOT suggested for those who like to sleep in). As for the location, you are near nothing that is within walking distance and so be prepared for 20-30 minute cab rides if you haven't rented a car. I will say that the staff are all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: twinsdd
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for my boyfriends birthday, and we LOVED it!! This was my first time going to the SPA & the mandarin made me feel so RELAX & COMFORTABLE!! From the time you check in until you check out they treat you like ROYALTY! The turn down service EXCELLENT!! Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: sd_globetrotter
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a room through Amx for the first night of our honeymoon before we departed to the Caribbean. He then called the Mandarin to upgrade to a suite. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to the next level suite, the Biscayne, and given first-class treatment all the way. The room was more than spacious- 1600 sq ft, immaculately designed with wonderful views. The master bathroom was incredible, the robes and slippers luxurious and the bed & linen so comfortable, we could have slept through an earthquake. A handwritten note from the GM along with chocolate strawberries the size of plums and a bottle of champagne were also delivered. The pool and man-made beach for sunbathing are lovely. We were hoping to dine at Azul, but it was closed the Sunday evening of our stay, so the staff made a reservation for us at Cafe Sambal. We were treated to a lovely dessert and dinner was excellent. Upon our return to the suite from dinner, we were so pleasantly surprised to see our bed and bath were covered in rose petals- and my husband was not the one that arranged it. Wake up call was pleasant & punctual. We enjoyed our breakfast on the patio with the sunrise. Top quality ingredients. What a way to start our marriage... Everything about the M.O. was a five-star experience.

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil oasis”
Reviews.Author: Hou_architect
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental Miami is a tranquil oasis. If you are not into the hustle, bustle, noise and crowds of South Beach, this is a perfect spot. The lobby and restaurants are stunning, and the rooms have a spectacular view of the city and the water. We found the service to be impeccable, and particularly liked the pampering we got poolside- a terry cloth cover for our beach chairs, big fluffy towels, and ice water without having to ask. With our mojitos in hand, we enjoyed the view of the infinity pool and the boats beyond. The bed was absolutely to die for â€“ so comfortable we were asleep in about 15 seconds. We also enjoyed the big soaking tub and separate shower in the bathroom. As for nightlife, the hotel bars were attracting a very fashionable crowd on the weekend. If you want to venture beyond the hotel, it is an easy 10-minute walk to get to the 9th Street and South Miami Avenue restaurant area. We had a lovely candlelit meal there at Dolores. The Mandarin is serene and elegant. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Spa-like feel in downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: Citizen_0f_the_W0rld
Reviews.Content: If you find yourself in downtown Miami (business trip), this is the hotel to stay at. Better yet, if you can bring along your significant other, you can be sure that they will have a really nice time too. We stayed in a Junior Suite, which was on the corner, overlooking the magnificent Bay and Downtown skyline. Coming from New York City, I was very impressed. Our room had a balcony and we often sat there, reading or enjoying a drink. The hotel rooms were very comfortable, the staff very attentive, friendly, and fulfilled every single one of our requests. Their slippers are very comfy! What I love about the hotel is aroma that is in the air. It's as if you walk into a spa the minute you step inside. It's a relaxing smell. The spa at the hotel is quite special too, I tried the "Ritual Experience", it was nice. On the other hand, this hotel is not in the middle of a vibrant neighborhood...that is why it's really only good for business travelers. Companies also host offsite meetings and conferences their too. The ride to South Beach is 15 to 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carla123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in downtown Miami walking distance to the financial district. The room: The rooms were large and spacious decorated as if you were at a beach house. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was very good with a large bathtub and seperate shower. The ammenities were excellent. The location: Good business hotel location within walking distance of the financial district. On the bay so nice views and lots of delis and restaurants including a Vietnamese & Thai which served sushi restaurant the hotel reccommended which was great. It is a good 20 minute drive to South Beach. Would stay there again if the trip was for business purposes however ours was a stopover on route to pick up a cruise so would have rathered a South Beach location.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: enicideme
Reviews.Content: First: This is a very expensive hotel, located in an expensive area of an expensive city. Having said that. . . it was still well worth it. Great service. Everyone is exceedingly helpful. The on-site restaurants were great. The room was a decent size, was high-end throughout, and our bay-view, high-floor room had an incredible view of the Miami skyline. Its location on Brickell Key is great: a small semi-residential island just off of downtown Miami. Nice pool, great jogging path, even a small beach. Yes, its expensive if your company is not paying, but I think you get what you pay for in this case.

Reviews.Title: “not worh it”
Reviews.Author: dmercer45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MO in Miami for 5 nights during the New Year's holiday. Although we had a nice time and enjoyed the views of the bay, I would have to say that the service of this hotel is not up to par. We found the concierge(s) to be more dismissive than helpful. We found it difficult to get service at the pool or beach and the food was very slow in the restaurants. We also had to call three times to ask for help with our luggage. We ended up carrying all of our heavy bag ourselves. Not what one would expect at a 5 star hotel. The prices for food and amenities (not to mention the rooms) is astronomically high...and I'm comparring that to NYC. I also found it irritating that the service was already included with each check. That standard gives very little credit to the customer. I also think the hotel is too small. Granted it was New Year's weekend and one would expect a large crowd of families and europeans, but the pool was jammed packed all day as was the so called "beach". These areas are just far too small to accomodate the hotel sufficently. The service could not manage to take care of everyone' s needs and keep the place clean. The pool area is way to small. It was difficult to even walk past the pool without almost falling in. The beach area too - Guests would leave books and such on the beds early in the morning and then not show up to use the beds till the afternoon. Subsequently there were not even enough beach chairs for everyone that wanted to sit on the beach. Some these things are understandable and I am not that high maintenance of a travellot. Ultimately I still enjoyed the hotel, but for the price you are paying they should be able to meet everyone's needs.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service in MIami”
Reviews.Author: DNewYork
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week at the Mandarin with my partner and my family and we had a terrific time. The rooms are quite luxurious, the service is divine, and the food always brought a smile to our faces. Room--Very comfortable and spacious with a terrific balcony. I especially liked the marble bathrooms! The beds were very easy on the back and the sheets and linens have thread count galore. Maid Service--One of the best parts of the hotel. Rooms are cleaned in a timely fashion and requests can be made with ease for both daily housekeeping and turn-down service. Who can resist the little orchid bud they leave on your bed each night? Restaurants--Quite tasty. Good Asian fusion and we like how grams of protein and calories are listed for several of the choices. Azul is quite upscale, but the cafe downstairs is simple and consistent. Public Spaces--I loved going down for coffee each morning at the coffee bar across from the front desk. The lobby is filled with light and the faint scent of something delicious always hung in the air. The tranquil music was also a good touch. Service--Yes, yes and yes! Miami is not known for its excellent service, but the Mandarin delivers here. Everyone is gracious and willing to work with you to get it done. Price--A bit tricky here. The hotel isn't cheap and the constant add-ons--from the morning coffee to the expensive lunches--added up fast, but it was worth it.... Interesting Side-Trip--Check out the Casa Casuarina, which was the Versace Mansion on South Beach. Now it is a private club and hotel. For $175 a person you can spend the day there through an agreement they have with the Mandarin. Yes, a bit pricey, but when else will you be able to swim in Versace's pool replete with gold tiles? Tacky, sure! But what fun! Overall--A great hotel. Two weeks prior to this trip I stayed at the Four Seasons in Miami. The verdict: stay at the Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “One night of pure relaxation”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller143
Reviews.Content: Spent one day, evening and morning at the MO Miami in December 07 prior to a flight back to London. Never left the hotel, which made it easier as the location is very specific for where it is - that is, not close to anything really, so taxis are necessary. Have done South Beach a lot, so decided to stay on site and make the most of the spa, pool, room, balcony and restaurants. Service was good - not as exceptional as you get in the MO hotels in the Far East, but good nevertheless. The Azul restaurant was excellent and we had great advice from the sommelier who really knew her stuff. The standard room was chic and comfortable, with open plan bathroom (with a silk screen divider if necessary) but separate WC, so nice to be able to lie in the bath and chat to someone else relaxing on the bed. Balcony with both sea and city views. All in all a very good stay, and served its purpose well for a relaxing one night stop prior to a 9 hour flight.

Reviews.Title: “very good indeed !!”
Reviews.Author: puma1.716v
Reviews.Content: My partner and i have just completed a one night stay at the Mandarin Miami.What struck us the most was the size of our room, it was huge! The bathroom was well appointed with high end extras for you to use( we took these home)and i particularly like the BOSE sound system,very swish.One down side about the room was the lack of Plasma/LCD tv,just one of those old boxy things. The room did not have tea/coffee facilities so if you wanted a cup of either you hade to use room service,this can be expensive but also a chore.We did not eat at the hotel but at a nearby Italian restaurant which was excellent . Would i stay again?....yes if the rate was good as you do pay for every thing and i mean every thing so your bill soon mounts up.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel...but more trendy than great”
Reviews.Author: GroundedKiwi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the MO for 4 days. The hotel is up to the standard you would expect for a 5 star property, although the land constraints of downtown Miami mean you don't get the wild size and luxury of some other properties. The rooms are lovely and the staff mostly helpful and knowledgable. There is some tendency to trency over great...which is what seperates it from my favourite recent hotel - the Four Seasons Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Something of a disappointment in comparison with other MOs”
Reviews.Author: RDHNewYork
Reviews.Content: I have always been a big Mandarin Oriental fan but must confess that the Miami one was a disappointment and I would not return. The famed Martini bar is very small and the infinity pool minute (three strokes and you've reached the other end). The service, although always given with a smile, is slow and the automatic gratuity added to the bill simply an irritant. Moreover, should you go onto the private beach section, be sure to spray yourself with anti-bug bite spray as otherwise you will be eaten alive. But on a more positive note, their restaurant Azul is superb and having the Tasting Menu is a must.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Service at a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaDeem
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Mandarin and expected much better service than I received. The service turned bad when I returned to my room to change for the evening and realized that the hanger that I brought with me to hang my suit on was missing from the room. I searched all over because even at 2 star hotels the maids know not to throw anything away unless it is in the trash can. Well the maid threw it away so I had nothing to hang my suit on for my travel back home. I then called the housekeeper to get them to bring me a replacement "plastic hanger" but was delivered a bulky wooden hanger. They later brought me a wire hanger, once again not what I asked for. When I spoke to the manager on duty he assured me that he would get what I needed but he never even called to say that he couldn't get it. I guess I was a little dissappointed since I am accustomed to the Ritz who will send someone across town to get whatever it is that you desire if they don't have it there. I have to say that when I checked out the lady at the front desk was very apologetic and tried to compensate me for my inconvenience. So FYI, don't leave anything lying around that you don't want to be thrown away. Other than that, the hotel was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: BluMartini
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have experienced. The view on the ocean is just amazing from the rooms & suites. Valet parking was a bit slow, even when called from the room with nobody waiting before or after me. Like all chain hotels, relationships with staff are a bit cold & impersonal but at least, no intrusion to bear with. Ideal for corporate or leisure stay, except your eally need a car to go out, or use a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Make Mine Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: villanova97
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin is a beautiful hotel with first class amenities including a terrific spa, and most notably, an amazing pool that overlooks the Miami harbor and skyline. The hotel bar is hip and the overall atmosphere of the property is chic but doesn't guild the lily, it is quite tasteful. One problem is the hotel is somewhat isolated form the rest of town (need to cross a bridge to get to it), and of course, being a Mandarin hotel, it is pricey, but overall, the Mandarin Oriental Miami is a wonderful hotel. The room was exquisite, the staff was friendly and helpful, and we had a balcony with an excellent view of the city. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: nycflyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for a conference, and it was unfortunate I was traveling by myself because the hotel and its location are fantastic. The hotel itself is situated on Biscayne Bay. I was fortunate to get a room facing the bay and took full advantage of the private balcony that comes standard with every room. (Have a room service breakfast on that balcony and you'll know what I mean) The room itself was done in rich mahogany and the bed was extremely comfortable and very sleepworthy. The bathrooms were superlative and done in marble. It was really a nice treat to sleep at night with the windows to the balcony open and the ocean breeze blowing in. In regard to items outside the room, the lounge on the lobby floor of the hotel was superb and as you would expect also provides great views of the bay. The pool scene is also top notch, but the wait service by the pool could have been more timely. There is a walking/jogging path that winds around the hotel and hugs the bay through some adjacent condo buildings. The only minor downside I would state is the ability to walk to anywhere notable from the hotel. Its location on the bay also puts it at almost a required taxi (especially given Miami's heat) to anywhere notable. But taxis are always available and immediately summoned by one of the valets. However, given that significant upside of the views based on the hotel's location, this would be a trade-off I would make anytime. In terms of security, this has to be one of the most secure hotels in which I have ever stayed. First the only reason you would be on the road to the hotel is to visit the hotel---so there is no drive-by traffic at all. In addition, there are security/concierge staff all over the lobby and curbside areas and they know what they are doing. For example, I went out for a run and exited through the back of the hotel but entered back in the front. I looked less than attractive upon my return, but the hotel staff opened all of the doors upon my arrival no questions asked. On the other hand, one of my clients who was dressed in a business suit who was not a guest at the hotel was questioned (in a subtle gracious way) if "they could be of assistance", which is hotel code for "What the heck are you doing here?" Finally and certainly not least is the staff. Absolutely first rate and ranks with the best I have ever experienced. Everyone at the ready to assist, with attentiveness that was both subtle and gracious. As an example, I walked up to the concierge and asked him to FedEx a golf club. (Do you know how hard it is to package a golf club?) Rather than the anticipated drill of filling out numerous forms and time taken for them to find materials, the concierge simply took the club, had me fill out the destination for the club and that was it!! (Of course, the charges were billed to my room) But the whole experience was effortless. Bravo to the Mandarin Oriental...

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lenny1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Miami on a business trip in October 2007. This hotel is exactly what I like in a business hotel. The room was tasteful and modern with a view of the Miami skyline. The bathroom was very large and had a window as well â€“ a nice touch. The service was great. Check in was quick and courteous. At 6:00 am I got a bit turned around looking for the gym and the coffee bar attendant walked me all the way across the lobby to the gym entrance. The gym was well equipped with modern equipment. Both restaurants at the hotel are good. I had a business dinner on a previous trip at the formal restaurant, â€œAzulâ€� and the food, wine, and service were excellent. My only small complaint is that for a hotel of this caliber the rooms should have flat screen TVs not standard TVs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: Mahaguru
Reviews.Content: OK, it's a very nice hotel. I did not like the area though - it's completely dead and you have to drive anywhere/everywhere. In addition, I found that the place is packed one night with people en route to cruising, and empty the next. The lobby is very cold and terminal-like. I am a regular "fan" of MOHG and stay with them 40-60 nights per year around the world. I will not go back to this place and in fact, I moved over to Miami Beach just to be able to see some live people about (another story of a severely over-rated and overpriced hotel). In any case, the rooms ARE nice and if you don't mind treating the hotel as a bolthole, you're set up good here. If you like to have a walk seeing people going about life, it's not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A destination onto itself - Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssirak
Reviews.Content: The Miami Mandarin is an excellent hotel all around. My wife and I stayed at there over the Labor Day weekend and loved it. This is one of the best 5 stars hotels we have stayed at. I was not that that impressed with the lobby but our room was excellent and the service was superb. Considering the class of the hotel, the prices for everything including the restaurants were reasonable. The attention to detail was amazing. The pool area is a little small but we loved the man made beach. We will take the Mandarin man-made beach over South Beach any time. We made a couple of trips to various area beaches. We will definitely go back to the Miami Mandarin and consider its other locations around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin is a class act all of the way...”
Reviews.Author: legaleagle55
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over Labor Day Weekend with our 6month old baby. The hotel staff was fabulous. Many staff members remembered baby's name and ours. Azul tasting menu is superb. Sushi Cafe Sambal was really nice for a hotel in Miami. We stayed 3 days and never had reason to leave the hotel. The hotel is exceptionally clean which is a must for us. No complaints about this mini-vacation... Only that the pool could be a bit bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Great Miami Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kolya
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions and it always has been an excellent experience. The rooms are very comfortable and stylishly decorated. Service is friendly and efficient. The hotel is very expensive in high season but in the summer it is the best value for money in the area. Overall, it is probably the best hotel in Miami. It goes without saying that this hotel is not at the beach as it is in Miami and not Miami Beach, but if you have a car it doesnâ€™t matter as you can go to any beach you like.

Reviews.Title: “service at this hotel is a joke”
Reviews.Author: Mijgaja
Reviews.Content: Everything in this hotel feels like a joke Service- terrible rooms-old and no flat screen nor wifi valet-26$+6$ tax and 45 minute wait for my car Room service 20 minutes wait on the phone cost of food-wasnt a joke was 45$ for an omelet what else can i say

Reviews.Title: “OK for Business”
Reviews.Author: californiavacationer
Reviews.Content: Overall the Mandarin is great for business travel. The rooms, service and staff are excellent. However, it is not on the beach but in the city. The beach they have is man made and does not have access to any water. Cab fare to the beach is $30 each way. The pool is very small and overlooks the bay and city. There is not much dining around the area at all. Very convient for business but not a place for vacation unless you are looking for a spa vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: cjmeg
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the Mandarin. Very pleased with our experience. The hotel during the day doesn't seem like much as far as decor goes but at night it's transformed, due to great lighting, into a very chic hotel. The staff is extremely helpful & friendly--maybe not as top notch as the Four Seasons which is across the bay--but still very good. Ate at Cafe Sambal--food was excellent. In fact, the two restaurants at this hotel are worth staying here alone. Also ate at Azul (my second time) and it did not disappoint. The service is 5 star as well as the food. Only one complaint--could not believe that a family had decided to bring their 2 year old in here and at 10:30pm!!! I was told by our waiter that it's a cultural thing & there's not much they can do. Took advantage of the spa too--pedicure--good but not $88 good. But the facial was one of the best I've ever had. Ask for Courtney & the reguvenation facial. Relaxing, amazing--no extractions or deep cleansing on this one though. It was a nice change. Great hotel & would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Soooooo fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: AliChris
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at lots of hotels and this is the nicest one I've ever stayed at. Simply fabulous!! I attended a corporate event/meeting held at the hotel. The room was beautiful with a view of the city and water. I ordered room service for breakfast and it was really excellent. All the food at the event was excellent also. I can't say enough about this property. It is truly beautiful and luxurious. I would recommend this to anyone wanting a gorgeous hotel. I guess if there is one small downside it's that the hotel is further away from most things - you'd have to take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “WOW... I MEAN... WOW”
Reviews.Author: Baker-Mayy
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I went down to Miami for a 3 night stay at the Mandarin Oriental as part of a trip to Southern Florida. I had this expectation before going that this hotel was going to be a little too "Stuffy" for me... a little too uppity... I was happily mistaken! This was a very upscale hotel, very sleek, very stylish but not at all stuffy. The rooms were crisp and well designed with a beautiful large bathroom with many amenities. It had a good size balcony overlooking Biscayne Bay. The hotel itself was beautiful but I think the Service is what really made this hotel a step above the rest. The front desk was very pleasant. Concierge exceeded every expectation. Not only did they answer every simple question, we Miami first timers had, they gave us inside tips, detailed maps, helpful hints that made the whole Miami experience more enjoyable. We really felt like we were taken care of. The cafe in the hotel had exceptional service from pleasant bus boys up to the Manager. They really had the knack of servicing the customer without being a nuisance, you know, with asking if everything is okay every two minutes. The valet... I am not a valet person at all and if there was one negative to mention, it was that you had no other choice but to valet your car... but even though that is not my thing, this valet crew was also at the top of its game! The hotel must do extensive customer service training.. I'd really be interested to learn about the steps taken in hiring a staff like this one, how the hotel trains them and what types of incentives might be involved. I can't imagine anyone leaving this hotel dissatisfied. So anyway, the Valet... We could see this crew from our Balcony and these guys were always on the run. We never waited for our car. This was truly a WOW experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but pricey”
Reviews.Author: AlBeter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for a conference. The hotel was great but pricey (luckily it was on the company's dime!). PROS: Bedding was CLEAN and comfortable Room was designed well (bathroom and lighting overall were standouts) Hallways were a bit dark but cool Live music in the lobby CLEAN everywhere Jogging path around the hotel island Beautiful pool area Service was attentive CONS: A bit isolated from the rest of Miami Definitely don't go there for the 'beach' (its on a bay and far from a 'beach vacation' hotel and/or destination) Billing problems seem to be the norm (I had one also) Restaurants were expensive (but good) $5 for internet in the business center?! Come on... Did not allow late checkout Overall I enjoyed the hotel and that's hard for me to say at the prices they charge. Its not good for a beach vacation but its a great hotel nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Very unique experience”
Reviews.Author: kyrikos
Reviews.Content: I had a beautiful experience with Mandarin Oriental. Beautiful room and views. Staff a bit obnoxious, helpful though. We used the private beach which is not really a beach, it 's just a stripe of land with sand, so do not expect to dip into the sea. However that was nice too. Nice balconies. We also used the hotel's gymnasium. Fantastic equipment and helpful service, although there was no qualified instructor. Overall a beautiful experience at the Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the service but ...”
Reviews.Author: Jin_Jiang
Reviews.Content: Have travelled to Miami several times in the past and just stayed at this hotel for the first time on a business trip. I thought that the service was above-average for a Miami hotel. From the reservation process to the arrival, the check-in and check-out, felt as if I had been treated well. Another positive (and negative) is the location. The hotel has views of Biscayne Bay which make for a very peaceful sleeping environment. This perhaps augmented by the balcony which would allow those to open windows and sleep with nice bay air (definitely a plus on cooler evenings). However (as a business person dressed in a suit and tie), I felt a little isolated at the Mandarin given that a taxi is a must if you choose to go anywhere on a normal sunny, humid day. Some not-so-positives: - Toiletries were sub-par compared with other hotels; especially missed were mouthwash and a razor - would it cost that much more to provide these staples? - Bed mattress was sunken; woke up with a back-ache. - Hallways were a bit dark. - Neither lobby bar opened until 5pm. The only other place to get a beer before 5pm is the restaurant on level 2 -- which unfortunately is just not comfortable. Still shaking my head on this one. Overall, I may opt for another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Sariano
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome property years ago, but it appears the Mandarin Oriental chain is not investing to maintain its standing as the best hotel in Miami. It is hard to understand that there is no wi-fi access in the rooms, that TVs are not flat screen. The rooms look worn out. Very friendly staff. Would go again for business meetings downtown but only at discounted fares. The hotel is not up to its reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Really a grand chain”
Reviews.Author: Jwolu
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to know what to say about this hotel having stayed there with my partner for 5 nights in April on a short break before moving on to NY for a business trip. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are a treat. That is the best feature of this hotel. The hotel is situated in barren condo land in the financial district. The guests are definitely of the large chain variety -families etc. As a luxury hotel, it just doesn't quite click.The service is patchy. For example, we had to call for our bags to be delivered to the room. We would have done it ourselves but they had been whipped away when we checked in and then they were forgotten. In the Martini Bar, after ordering and receiving our drinks, we asked for water but it did not arrive, even after "Certainly". On the other hand, the young woman on duty mornings at the Concierge's office is excellent. The biggest disappointment is the food. The breakfast is very poor value for money (72 USD for two) with different and therefore additional prices for hot and cold buffets which means you pay a separate and additional price, if you have eggs. The breakfast is very average for this class of hotel with quite poor quality bread and eggs. Hot chocolate and a single portion of toast late in the evening cost 20USD. You are better off leaving the hotel, crossing the road and grabbing breakfast in the local gourmet supermarket. The spa is phenomenally overpriced e.g. 271USD for a massage and you have to arrive 45 minutes before an appointment.

Reviews.Title: “Service issues spoil a great venue”
Reviews.Author: TheVoyeur
Reviews.Content: Attended the hotel on a business trip combined with some pleasure with my pregnant wife. Called hotel concierge a day in advance and booked a prenatal spa treatment for my wife. Explained that she would be checking in ahead of me and should be told upon check in that her husband had given her a gift of massage and she should book a time of her choosing. Called wife and found that this was not communicated. Called concierge to confirm that they did not communicate this to her-asked that they send a bellman up to her room to hand-deliver the message. They did send someone but they enclosed it in a sealed envelope with my name on it-my wife doesnt open my mail especially when I am on business. The concierge was unapologetic, unwilling to make any concessions and generally unresponsive to my requests. I wont stay there again. After reading other reviews-its no surprise that my experience is similar to other people's in remarkably similar circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place but Inattentive When it Counts”
Reviews.Author: CTProfessional
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Mandarin at the beginning of February. We loved our room, the spa, and the little beach area. The hotel is beautiful and conveniently located. We had a nice time overall. The food, however, (and particularly the room service), is overpriced ($70 for breakfast for 2). Unfortunately, our stay was spoiled when the hotel incorrectly billed my boyfriend's credit card at the end of our stay instead of mine (the weekend was my treat to him and that was made clear to the hotel). In the end, we felt that they took their time resolving the matter weeks later. They didn't seem particularly interested in doing anything of value (to us) to compensate for the error and inconvenience. This was an unfortunate end to a stay that was otherwise very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Elegantly Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: lagniappe34
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was an absolute dream. Really. Our room was average-size, but well appointed. It was on the balcony deck, so we had a lovely balocony in which to soak in the wonderful weather. The staff was great. They catered to every request - from numerous mojitos at the pool/beach to extra chocolates every night, they were great. The food was good. Just had the sushi, which was good. Nothing spectacular, just really good quality. I loved the bath products, LOVED them. The soap, lotion, shampoo and conditioner was great. The gym was adequate, really sufficient. Many hotel gyms, IMO, are subpar and an afterthought, but this one, while small, met every need. A nice feature in the hotel, there were large bottles of Evian water and bowls of fruit (Asian pears - my fave) for the taking. I would stop by before heading out for the day get some water and a pear for a snack. The spa was exquisite. Guests get complimentary use of the spa and it was really nice. Boyfriend and I both took steams after working out and the entire spa experience was just sublime. I really enjoyed the pool/beach area. The Mandarin has a a great little beach area on the bay and it's fabulous. They have those great, big beds on which to lay and it's just so relaxing. One thing I didn't like (and it drives me crazy at all hotels), they charge $5 per 15 minutes for internet usage. I know it sounds petty, but when I am paying $500 for a hotel room, for a property to charge so exorbitantly for internet time is just petty. But they're making money, so I would do the same if I was in that position. Overall a remarkably relaxing, special stay. Cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Oriental Miami = dreamy”
Reviews.Author: amizu
Reviews.Content: I just spent a night at the Mandarin Oriental - Miami this past weekend as an escape from South Beach where I live, and also to celebrate a birthday. From start to finish the experience was dreamy. I had read that service could be iffy, that the pool was small and cramped, and that the bill might include extra charges. The pool was area was small and cramped (but the pool itself was empty), but the service was fantastic and the bill was correct. When we checked in we did not wait at all, and the very friendly man at the front desk (Raul) brought us up to our room, which had been upgraded to a junior suite with a huge balcony and a great bathroom. It's true that the bathroom (tub, sink, shower) are open to the bedroom with a screen that can be lowered, but the toilet is separate and has a door. We liked the unique design feature because it made the room feel even bigger (but then again, we got up at the same time as each other). The TV was old and had no movies (but we weren't there for that, so we did not mind.) Five minutes after we entered our room, just as we were cracking open some champagne, room service brought up a delicious birthday cake as a surprise! (There was also a box of chocolates, which I presume is always there.) Turn down service that night left us bottles of designer water as well. That night we ate at Azul, and the great service continued. (Another birthday surprise after dinner too!) The 2 sommeliers were attentive and helpful. The food was delicious - I particularly recommend the rainbow of oysters appetizer if it's still on the menu, ditto the salmon tartare and the surf and turf. The scotch selection was impressive. The scotch was brought along with a cup of ice each, so we could control how much ice we wanted - nice touch. The cheese selection, on the other hand, was weak. There were only 5 options, and 1 was out. Still, overall a fun, delicious experience. The next morning we ate at Cafe Sambal. The food was good, but exactly the same prices as room service - in other words, overpriced. It was a bit chilly in the morning and the maitre d' noticed I was cold and offered to bring me a wrap - another nice touch. The individual syrup was also warmed up - again, nice touch. The buffet did not look particularly appealing, so we ordered from the menu and were happy with what we received. We spent the day at the beach, enjoying the raised beds and hammocks. The attendants were great - not intrusive, but they did bring us water frequently. At the pool (where we went to each lunch and to swim a bit) the attendants provided ipods, magazines, water, mango sorbet, etc. For lunch we ate sushi which we found generally to be overpriced and not particularly appealing. After the beach we took advantage of the spa by booking a couple's suite for a few hours. As spa waiting areas go, I expected a bit more, but it was relaxing. There are two showers, which separate the sauna from the steam room. No jacuzzi. I would have preferred to have showers near the lockers & vanities. The 2 toilets were also separate from the lockers & the showers. The relaxation area itself was pleasant, although there was a guest snapping pictures, and talking on the phone! Anyway, the couple's suite massage treatments were delightful. We started out with rose petal foot treatments, while we watched dolphins dancing in the bay below. Next we chose to have sea salt exfoliation scrubs, then massages (aromatherapy & hot stone & swedish for me, deep tissue for him), then clay scalp massages. In between the salt exfoliation and the massages, the massage therapists exited the room so that we could shower (in the suite) and return clean to our massage tables. An absolute delight. Overall, despite the hefty price, I heartily recommend the hotel for spa, dinner at Azul, romantic getaway or just rejuvenation in general.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance Embodied”
Reviews.Author: NJLovestoTravel
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, especially in overpriced Miami. Reasonable rates for the room. Very elegant styling, beautiful views, quiet, and safe. Only drawback is no place to buy simple amenities. Not on Miami beach, however we enjoyed not having to deal with the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “One of the top three in Miami”
Reviews.Author: MartinJH
Reviews.Content: Definitely in the top three hotels in the Miami area - I have stayed at most of the decent hotels in the last couple of years. The Setai is the best (and most expensive by a long way) and then it's between the Mandarin and the Four Seasons for second. The Mandarin wins in terms of style and facilities, the Four Seasons on pool area. The Ritz Carlton would be next and then the Shore Club, Delano, Victor, etc. below that. For my long weekend stay, was given a Bay View King room on a lower floor, which gave good 90% view over bay towards Miami Beach, and a decent sized terrace with loungers. Room was asian-infludenced in style and consisted of large room with separate bathroom with a bath and a shower. Room amenities were a bit sparse for a 5-star room (standard shower kit, etc.) with no handy extras (razor, ear-cleaners, etc). Also the TV only had standard cable channels (plus a couple of premium movie channels) but no pay-per-view. Pool and outdoor area are small and slightly cramped - we visited during half-full weekend and by 10am all the beach chairs were full and packed in like sardines. The beach-area, outside gate across path, with a few cabanas and beach-beds, is much better - it gives you a better view, is quieter and you have more space and sand between your feet. Pool menu is asian-based and while not extensive was of a good quality. Breakfast at Cafe Sambal is a good option - an extensive menu at decent prices and there's both inside and terrace tables - note: the outdoor tables get very busy and the queue one morning was 30 mins. The 2 main bars at the Mandarin (Lobby and Bar M) are small and disappointing and should be avoided for all but an emergency last-minute drink. Service was impeccable at all times - e.g. lady delivering breakfast set up the table on the terrace at our request, and upon spilling a few drops of milk on the table, came back 5 minutes later with more milk and a few extra pastries. If you have the money, stay at the Setai. If you want 5-star luxury and to lie by the pool, stay at the Four Seasons. if you want 5-star luxury and impeccable service and style, stay at the Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “tripadvisor review right on the money”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsLouise
Reviews.Content: It's true -- the shower door leaks; there are strange charges added to the bill; the management tries to make good when problems are pointed out -- the general impression I got from reading other visitors' comments was an accurate one. In my opinion the hotel tries to maintain an high standard but the staff is not necessarily up to the task. The service was uneven. For instance, when we opened our box of welcome chocolates, they were half eaten. When we tried to consult the hotel information guide in our room, many of the pages were missing. An 18.5 percent tip was added to the checks for breakfast and refreshments by the pool, but not to the dinner tab. When we checked out the guest in line in front of us was explaining that his family had not used the mini-bar. Our bill had two nights' valet parking fees ($64) but we didn't have a car. Overall, we had a pleasant stay and particularly enjoyed the hotel's quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “The best in the City”
Reviews.Author: GlobetroterCostaRica
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is the best large Hotel Operation I have seen in Miami. The guests rooms are very well done perfectly maintained and offer everything you would expect from a TOP 5 star hotel. Employeeâ€™s attitude is simply unmatched more like Asia then any other hotel I have been in the USA. I consider out of the 10 Spa Operation I did visit in Florida this Spa as the number one, design, service, and quality of the treatments beat all the rest it offers everything a Spa can possibly have. The food quality and presentation n all Restaurants as well as in Room Service is simply perfect, the outlets are well decorated and beautifully located and are for sure not expensive. Check in check out is perfect; Guest Relation services are Top of the Line. The pool, garden and beach area is well maintained and beautifully planed, missing nothing. I could not think of anything missed in guest services or employees attitude great and beautiful Resort Hotel with best possible quality service.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: NYC24
Reviews.Content: stayed at the MO Miami for two nights in february. this is the 8th time we've stayed at the hotel and we always enjoy it. Summary: MO Miami has excellent design, a very relaxing and tranquil location, but the service level keeps it from rating 5-stars. Room: reserved and received a deluxe bay-view room. great balcony with room for 2 lounge chairs, nice view over the bay and downtown miami, very comfortable bed and nice furnishings, and love the layout of the room with the view from the bathtub. Food: Ate at Azul - always excellent. The food as well as the service from the wait staff and somalier were great. They do a great job with both fish and meat selections and have an really fantastic wine list. Also notable - great selections from room service - pad thai and shrimp dumplings were fantastic and a nice alternative to the usual room service fare. Deliveries were always within 30 mins of ordering. "Beach": They brought in a lot of sand to create a beach area with very comfortable lounge "beds" and great food/drinks service. You can't get access to the ocean from here, but the view is relaxing and they do a nice job pampering the guests. Pool: smallish pool with lots of chairs packed in. We opted to hang at the "beach" instead but the pool area was very popular. Service: The only down side. Although room service is very quick, the front desk staff is not up to the same level. We had to call down several times to report that our neighbor was smoking a pipe in his room (we were on a non-smoking floor) and the smell was coming into our room via the balconies. Each time they said they'd call him; finally after the third attempt they actually did and the smoking stopped. Overall: relaxing and enjoyable oasis within downtown miami.

Reviews.Title: “Got Engaged here...”
Reviews.Author: cmdace18
Reviews.Content: I stayed in their deluxe skyline rooms. Incredicle room with crown molding gorgeou bathroom (open to the entire room). In the evening, I rented out their private beach for a propsal to my GF. I had everything i needed at my fingertips. It was amazing. This hotel is 5 stars. Second to none. From the service to the fantastic room, to the private beach, it was unbelievable. I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking to romance their wife, gf, or for a honey moon. Great for a private getaway, away from all the noise on Southbeachl. Very private, secluded place. Excellent hotel. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Never wanted to check out”
Reviews.Author: travlife
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the MO for our anniversary in January. It was a splurge but having stayed at other MO hotels we expected the best. We loved our stay. We were upgraded to a suite. The views are gorgeous . I loved the large balcony. The staff could not have been more accomadating. The pool is lovely and the beach beautiful. It was expensive but definitely worth the money. Using AM EX Platinum we also enjoyed a 6 PM checkout. The restaurants were outstanding also. I did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: ramos123
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks in Florida, stayed 4 nights at the Delano to start with - great - then down to Key West, then we went, don't ask me why, to the Biltmore in Coral Gables. Great if you're more than 70 years old and are willing to come to Miami to read a 500 pages novel, because that's the only thing you can do. And forget about the "largest swimming pool in continental US", it's colder than in Alaska, and nobody is swimming. But I must say yes, it's large. Big deal. So, we left after 2 nights and booked at the Mandarin. This place is amazing, great view on the bay and on Downtown skyline, great rooms, amazing service, not huge but delighful pool, nice restaurants and bars, etc. The service is amazing, specially for our two kids. We asked a baby bottle to be warmed up, they brought a micro wave, they gave our daughter a bagpack with her name on it, a bathrobe for her, everything. Yes it's expensive, yes it hurts when you look at your bank account afterwards, yes it's not on South Beach but it's worth every single dollar we spent, even the 300 at the Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Could be much better”
Reviews.Author: touchich
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks at the MO (12/21-01/03) and had many bad surprises, like a crowded pool and no seats at the beach (except if you tip the beach waiter to reserve it), what I think is totaly unacceptable when you're a guest. I saw for exemple many daybeds reserved for an entire day without anybody on them...and some clients could not enjoy the beach, ridiculous ! Go for a deluxe bayview room, they are much nicer than the ones in the back of the hotel. Room service will charge you even a glass of milk for your baby (10 US $) if you don't make complaints to the manager. Service at the Cafe Sambal for breakfast is very good and the buffet too. Sushis are very expensive (almost 100 US $) for one party ! There's a very good market on the island where you can eat or buy food and drinks. Read carefully each line of your check when you checkout, they tried to put 1500 US $ not due (like valet parking, mini bar, ...) If you want to get great service you have to make complaints every day about everything, and finally you forget about it, because you don't come for that and you're fed up. I think this is more a business hotel than a tourist hotel even if the clients are more tourists than business men, that's the reason why there's a small pool, a small artificial beach, small restaurants, small bar,... It is surely not mandarin oriental class !

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good...But...”
Reviews.Author: RLA
Reviews.Content: We went to the Mandarin Key Biscayne over Labor Day, 2006. The purpose of our trip was to decompress for 3 days... basically do nothing but sleep in, eat great food, work out and enjoy the spa -- the Mandarin Oriental was pretty on target for our objective. The gym is OUTSTANDING. The Spa is luxurious (expensive, but worth it in our opinion). The bedding was extremely comfortable. And, the service was very, very good. However, the food was not perfect: The casual restaurant is nice -- not great -- but nice. "Azul" (the fancier restaurant) is above average... not excellent (we actually bellied up to the bar and had the very knowledgeable bar tender wait on us one night, which was the highlight of our Mandarin dining experience for the weekend). The pool-side bar/restaurant is below average, which is consistant with the pool in general....which is why we give this hotel a rating of "above average", instead of excellent. If you are looking for a beautiful, spacious pool with wonderful pool-side service, this is NOT the place for you. The pool is almost laughable, so it was a good thing we weren't banking on that for the perfect vacation. For the size of this hotel, they should have a pool that's triple the size with five times more lounge chairs. As well, if you are looking for onsight consistant dining options, this probably isn't for you either. We ended up hiring a car service to bring us to South Beach for dinner (which ended up being worth the 30-40 minute car ride). Bottom line -- if you want a hotel that has a really terrific spa, very nice service and a great gym, and you are ok with 'average' onsight dining options and a below average pool scene, this is a good option for you. If you want an expansive pool scene and multiple onsight dining options, and aren't willing to leave the locale to dine elsewhere, this probably isn't the place for you. Note: There is virtually no beach at the Mandarin Key Biscayne.

Reviews.Title: “Star spotting at the pool!”
Reviews.Author: Irishflute
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself stayed at hotel September 2005. We've stayed at various hotels in the MO Group including Bangkok, London Toyo and Hong Kong and this one really lived up to our expectations. We had a spectacular suite on the penultimate floor with a balcony which swept right round the side of the hotel. We could have held a party for 50 poeple on the balcony alone! The views os the bay and Downtown Miami were absolutely phenomenal. One of the highlights of our stay was going for a swim and realising that we were shaing the pool with a certain actor of Irish extraction who was staying there whilefilming the movie Miami Vice. Our suite was beautifully decorated with an incredible bathroom. The restaurants were of a high standard although you had to make sure to book well in advance for the main one, as no priority was given to residents. Only disappointment was the bar which was situated at the end of the lobby. It seemed like more of an afterthought than an actual bar. Cocktails were good though... One of the most striking features of the hotel is the beautiful lobby area. It was a real reat to stay there and I would recommend it highly

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JC&BEB
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I spent the second week of our honeymoon at the MO, after the Bahamas, in early November 2006. I chose it as Brickell Key was quieter than, but in easy range of South Beach and close enough to the centre of Downtown. (From the airport, it is 15 mins & $25 in a taxi). And because, having spent hours on Tripadvisor, it came out very well. We had a suite (an upgrade!) overlooking the bay - which was amazing, particularly in the early morning and at sunset). The hotel is superbly positioned, the building is very impressive and the staff were, without exception, excellent. They couldn't have been more helpful/ attentive. It is not cheap, but every bit a 5* hotel. We had breakfast each morning in Sambal - great, again, the staff and the food are superb. Supper there was also very good, particularly if you like Sushi. I don't, but found plenty to order instead. We didn't eat at Azul, but people who did, raved about it. The Sushi bar by the pool was also very good and the staff were constantly bringing round chilled water and sorbets - a nice touch. The pool is, as some other reviewers have said, a little small. However, it was never that busy and if the sun beds are a little close together, there were never so many people that it was a problem. (This is a business hotel; I saw more people wearing suits and looking wistfully at the pool than I did actually in it). The spa seemed very popular, though my wife didn't use it, so no personal comment. The gym is very well equipped; a good range of machines and free weights - and never that busy, even at peak times. There is a map with a couple of running routes in the room, which is helpful - a reasonably traffic/ road crossing free route. There is internet in the rooms - if you have a lap top, or about $6 per fifteen minutes at the business centre. Business hotel - what do you expect? There are internet cafes in downtown (10 minute walk) for one dollar per hour. We loved the hotel. It isn't, as several reviewers have said, cheap, but it is definitely 5* in every respect and you get what you pay for. I would certainly recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else - waste of money!”
Reviews.Author: skrosvik
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not up to the guiding lines of the Mandarin Oriental hotel chain. A waste of money. Stay somewhere else. My stay was a huge disappointment to my sister and me. We were staying for 5 days. Already at the check-in they assigned us to wrong room. We had booked a deluxe twin bedded room. And we got a king bedded room, but had to change it into a twin bedded room, which they managed to do - after a long wait!! Further on, there were not much deluxe over the room. On the positive side the room was large and had a nice balcony. But it had only very basic things; like an old fashioned television, a cordless telephone (which did not work) and a radio. There were no dvd/cd-player in the room. No international plugs. Nothing extra at all!!! The beds were fine and good size (but I have experienced better beds). But lightening in the room were terrible, no bedside reading lights, and so on. Also, terrible bathroom solution...I mean the bathroom in itself was beautiful, but only thing that seperated the bathroom from the bedroom was a single, thin and sliding screen. So it was impossible to have an early morning shower without waking up my sister. Cause all the bathroom noise goes out to the bedroom. Not very smart solution!!! I prefer privacy when I am in the bathroom and beside this stupid screen there were no locks on the bathroom doors.... The housekeeping in this hotels are the worst ever housekeeping I have experienced in any hotel. And it is such a shame that a hotel like Mandarin Oriental offer so poor service to their guests. The second day there were no towels provided, the third day there were no toiletries provided, the fourth day there were no water provided, and the fifth day there were no newspaper provided. I had to call for everything. This is not up to the reputation of the Mandarin Oriental. The business center was nice, but kinda pathetic that they charge you for using the internet there. I think it was 6 USD per 15 minutes, which is very expensive. Food was so-so. Tried the food at the beachside "restaurant" and in the Sambal Cafe. The sandwich at the beachside "restaurant" was very plain and tasteless, but the lunch in the Sambal Cafe was quite good. A nice feature on turndown service is that the hotel provides complimentary water from Voss. The onsite spa and pool was very nice, and the best thing about this hotel, I think. The service here is very slow and extremely inefficient. It took them like 30 minutes to get some towels to my room. The doormen outside are more busy talking private stuff, than opening the doors for the guests, you have to stand in line to talk to someone the front desk (which is unusual for a MO-hotel), the concierge is good (when he is actually on his desk). I also find some of the employees to have attitude-issues, which is not proper for a 5-star property. The concierge for example was kinda unpatient and rude when I wanted to ask about the limo-service. And an evening in the pool I was approached by a member of the security staff, and he told me in a very rude way: "You have 10 minutes to leave the pool", I think it is kinda rude to talk like this to guests. Where are the humble hospitality?? I was told at the check-in by the manager on-duty that I the pool was official closed at 9 pm, but I could use the pool at my own convenience after this. So, I did at 11 pm. And then this happened. I tried to explain to this guy that I was told something else by the front desk. But he told me something else, and that I had to get out of the pool. I think this guy was very rude, and it is incredible that this can happen. All this made me very angry. I also notified the front-desk about the phone in my room was out of order. They said they would send someone up to look at it right away. But it never happened. I think I reminded them about 4-5 times during my stay, but NOTHING happened. The location of this hotel is depressing and out of nowhere. There is nothing to do there. You better have a car, or prepare use taxi every time you want to go somewhere. You can still walk downtown or to Bayside shopping, which is 25-30 minutes walk away. This was my first visit to Miami, and next time I go to Miami I would rather stay in South Beach/Miami Beach area (Delano Hotel/Setai/Loews Miami Beach Hotel), cause there you will find the points of interests. There is nothing to do downtown, and there are no good shopping options around (except Bayside). You have to go up North Miami or down South Miami or to Miami Beach:) I think this hotel are on a very wrong course, and that the management should be replaced. This is far by the worst 5-star hotel I have ever stayed in, and it is incredible that this can be a member of the MO-chain. Well, I will never return to this hotel. I'd better stick to Four Seasons Miami - which is a beautiful and a serious hotel. Great service at the FS too!! Miami was an amazing experience and a wonderful city, and I will go back without doubt, but not to the Mandarin Oriental!!! I sent a complaint to the hotel manager, but did not receive any reply at all.

Reviews.Title: “PAST ITS PRIME ?”
Reviews.Author: Toopicky
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at this hotel. Overall a very good hotel to stay at, but has lost its sparkle compared to the Four Seasons. Okay so most of the staff are friendly & helpful, but too many mistakes, it took 4 attempts just to get complimentry tea & coffee in our room, wake up calls at 4am which we had not booked, only one bed turned down at night when previously two were. Silly mistakes that should not happen in a 5 * hotel. The rooms are large & the beds were great, even better then my own. The pool area is just far too small. On the website, a very good photographer makes to pool look huge, when in reality just too small, & not enough room for all the sunbeds which are squeezed in, the beach area needs to be cleaner as well, not nice to see cigarette butts laying in the sand. Prehaps I'm being far too picky, but pay a small fortune to stay at the MO, i expect over and above the norm. If you want to see how/stay at a 5* hotel should be, then go for drinks at the Setai on south beach. Wow is an understatment !

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: CE1927
Reviews.Content: Returned from honeymoon tour of the USA and this was clearly the best hotel we stayed. Such a great spot for downtown and biscayne bay views and our room was immaculate. As being such a high profile hotel, we were dreading ignorant staff and expensive prices but we found the opposite in both cases. Every member of staff we dealt with were very friendly and professional. The room bar, room service and pool bar were more than average as you would expect in a 5star but well within budget for the surroundings where we were and not a complete rip off as some other places are. Definately worth a look and the private beach just outside with the four poster beds brought a whole new sensation to sunbathing at the beach. Could have a bigger swimming pool maybe but everything else was truly excellant.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite MO”
Reviews.Author: Taskmaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the third time at this hotel in early October. First time, back in Feb. 2004 we thought it was wonderful - great contrast to just about anything else in Miami. Next time on business thought it was OK but not as sharp as MO ought to be. This latest visit confirmed it. Compared with MO's in Hong Kong, Bangkok and even Singapore this just doesn't get anywhere near. Obviously American service can't touch that of Asia but the rooms can and should be a lot lot sharper for the money. Front desk service just the same as any American chain. No real personality or any attempt to make you feel welcome or special. We do stay quite a lot in MO properties and normally our welcome is effusive. Here we even had to suggest that our AmEx Centurion booking came along with some benefits. Couldn't really see what they were - even to the point of being chased out of the hotel with an attempt to get a 'late charge' for our complimentary continental breakfast! Our upgraded room was remarkably small and ordinary with the view only so so. Water pressure in the shower wasn't very forceful, so quite a big effeort to clean off the soap and shampoo with the very very softened water. Minibar had plenty of gin but no tonic, forcing an order from room service and a truly incredible bill of $ 16.00 (plus tip) for two small bottles. On the plus side the AZUL restauarnt preented us with the best meal we enjoyed on our arduous 10 day (different hotel every night) trip. Super food, very well presented and delightfully served. None too pricey either for the quality. All in all a good hotel but one that does not reach the heights of a hotel group that I have long thought is about the best in the world.

Reviews.Title: “A Business Trip ath the Mandarin Oriental Miami”
Reviews.Author: PlaneWatcher
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Washington, D.C., so I pretty much knew what to expect (even though Miami and Washington are polar opposites....) I arrived about 11 p.m. on a Tuesday night after a delayed arrival at MIA. Even at this late hour, there was a prompt and courteous greeting from two bellmen. The check in was about 3 minutes longer than I wish it would've been, but I think that may have had something to do with the late hour and my desire to get immediately to bed. I had requested a high floor away from the elevator, and I was assigned Room 1508. The front desk clerk went to far as to repeat my request to me when I checked in. I beat the bellman to to the room by a couple minutes and was dismayed to find that 1508 was almost in the elevator vestibule. I went back downstairs and was told that due to the late hour of my check in and the fact that the hotel was almost completely occupied, this room had the best view available and it was very unlikely I'd hear any noise from the elevator. The city view room was nice, and I did not hear any elevator noise for the two nights I was there. The room was as you'd expect from a Mandarin. I knew about the open bathroom, which I thought was going to be a lot stranger than it was. To me, the opposite proved true; I thought it made the entire space seem quite a big larger. I had room service breakfast both mornings, and was pleased with the presentation, quantity, taste and variety. It wasn't cheap. I spent some time at the pool, but did not eat in either of the restaurants. Even though I knew it might be an issue, I was still a little dismayed that there was no gift shop/newsstand. The sign said it was closed for remodeling.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: mrpridefest
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is Georgous!!!! The decor and ambiance was second to none. What an outstanding experience. The whole building is specatacular. The rooms are exquisite, and the service was impecable. I highly reccomend anyone to take the extra step and treat themselves to a world class establishment. I don't think one detail is overlooked. The view was so beautiful, I couldn't contain myself.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: hgtybn
Reviews.Content: Am a frequent business traveler (4 stars plus hotels) and spent an unexpected long weekend in Miami in August 2006. Have become very selective about rooms, service, etc. so decided to stay at the Mandarin Oriental - have never stayed before. (First - there are no real unobstructed views of the Bay - all rooms have skyline views although some have more Bay views than others.) Problems started upon check-in - I explained that I wanted high floor, quiet and great views of sunrise - as was off-season was offered upgrade to junior suite for slightly higher rate, accepted, went to room and realized it was handicapped accessible and for some reason had a crib in it, and the only views were of the skyline! They found me another room - not a jr suite - but said could see sunrise and had good views. Next morning, I realized the sun was rising on the other side of the hotel! Called manager and left message to complain, said they would switch my room - they did not call until 8 pm that evening. I said really too late and I may be leaving next am. Trip was delayed 2 days so was working at desk next day when noticed stream of ants around the wastebasket! Called manager again, heard voicemail, went downstairs to speak with manager directly - alerted whoever answered phone I was doing so. When got to desk, manager apologized about all issues and said she had upgraded me to best suite in hotel and could stay for my remaining two nights at current rate. The suite was amazing. They did not have to upgrade to this extent - I just wanted a room with no ants. Found out upon leaving that they discovered there was an ant problem along the same vertical of my initial room - and they were able to take care of the issue. GOOD: Rooms - large, renovated, nice amenities. Manager - really trying with service, manager I spoke with seems very competent - hopefully she can get things turned around in service area - she was excellent. Food - good, quality as expected. Beach area - nice, good service, did not notice any bugs. Location. EXCELLENT: Spa - took full advantage, had two of the best massages ever - ask for Beth - pricey but main reason why I would return to this hotel. Also had pedicure - always feel these are overpriced but this was worth it. Staff at spa were wonderful. POOR: Pool area - small and gets noisy. Service - getting through issues. However, am planning on returning - for the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience but...”
Reviews.Author: Greenie2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Miami on 2 separate occasions. The first time (about 2 years ago) was just amazing. We had a beautiful room and were just in awe of the pool, restaurant, service, etc. The second time we stayed at the Mandarin, last year, it was still very nice, but there were a few notable problems and one in particular that still really bothers me. First, the island was riddled with mosquitos at the time. When we ate breakfast at Cafe Sambal, I was eaten alive. But the worst area was the man made beach. When we went down there, mosquitos swarmed around us to a horrific level (picture 6-8 on your body at once), and we turned around and ran back to the pool and jumped into the water for relief. I guess I would have thought they'd post a sign or something at least to warn patrons they were having this problem! The other issue is that instead of locking my purse up in my room while I went to the pool, I buried it in the bottom of my garment bag. The day before we checked out, coming home from the pool, I noticed my bag had been tampered with, but I didn't think anything of it. We ate at Azul that night and we charged everything to the room, so I didn't end up taking out my purse. However, the next day, upon checkout, I took out my purse and noticed that $40 cash was missing! We complained to the hotel and they apologized, but that was it. Sure, part of it was my own stupidity for not locking my bag, but we just felt so comfortable at the hotel. I'm not saying I expected a free night out of the situation or anything, but maybe a gift cert for a lunch at Cafe Sambal or some other token of apology would have been nice. This year, every time we went down to Miami, we just stayed at the Shore Club. There are so many great hotels in Miami, its hard for me to stomach going back to the MO after what happened. I guess I expected a little better customer service there.

Reviews.Title: “When Expectation is Not equal Perception!”
Reviews.Author: myWeltanschauung
