Reviews.Content: Well, I must admit, this particular brand (Mandarin Oriental, MO) demands high expectations! I guess, one can not simply clone a "service culture", a culture that has its roots in the Orient. If I may state, compare to the Oriental, Bangkok, this particular property here in Miami really does not seem to have a soul (i.e. Leadership)...though, I must add, the property itself is charming, even some employees, but again, a brand of that caliber ought to be more than just a "beautiful building". The way I perceived the property in Miami, I do dare to say, is far from being a "soul mate" to its flagship in Bangkok. Such traditional brand must not be compared to "SoBe standards". If being compared to South Beach Hotels than simply because Mandarin Oriental as a brand failed to deliver its promise: "Home away from Home". By reading past comments/comparisons of MO vs. SoBE, I urge every Floridian to visit a MO property in Asia. I do hope that in the not so distant future other "oriental" brands such as The Peninsula and/or Shangri-La finally bring a property to Miami, so that my fellow Floridian have a chance to truly experience a "service culture" beyond traditional ratings. Suggestion:Â  Great seeting, building, etc. but again, if you are used to MO service, AVOID this particular property in Miami !!!

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Report”
Reviews.Author: defore4735
Reviews.Content: My wife and I flew down to the Mandarin based upon many of the reviews from this board. Here's my review: Arrival: We arrived at 11 am on a Friday via cab from the airport (about $35 including tip). When we arrived, the attendants were there to greet us and immediately took advantage to look at our luggage tags to identify our name and call us by name as they asked how our trip was (pretty classy). I don't know if the staff has a listing of the expected guests, but it's a nice touch. As we checked in, we were OK if the room wasn't ready. We could simply wait, hang out at the pool. Reception offered us a choice of rooms, so we decided to take a room we could get in immediately. An attendant was immediately available to take our luggage and take us to our room. Room: We had a city view with balcony on the 11th floor. The bed was very comfortable. The attendant introduced us to all the amenties of the room as well as telling us to use the direct connection to the internet. He retrieved ice for us and insisted we call them if we needed anything. The room overlooked Brickell Key Bridge. It was nice enough view of the city and partial bay. We weren't concerned about the view as much as the relaxation aspect of the hotel. We put on our suits and headed down to the pool Pool: The pool area is small. I was surprised by how small the area was. They had nice 70's 80's music playing around the pool. It wasn't obnoxious, but occassionally the blender would override the music. They offer complimentary ipods, lotions, cd players, water, sorbet, so you really won't need to want for anything. We would have liked to ordered some drinks, but our attendant never asked if we needed anything for the 2 hours we were there. She simply continued to walk by us. (I'll get back to this later). The menu at the pool has some unique drinks. The primary food served is sushi and it was great. They also have sandwiches and some salads, but nothing like chips/salsa, nachos, or any mexican flair. It is primarily a sushi bar with nice salad presentations, which I believe is perfect for the setting. The "manmade" beach is nice, but there are several boats that patrol in and out of the bay area. May get a little annoying, but with an ipod, who cares. An attendant can help get you set up for your own private bed to catch the rays, but in the heat of August, it's nice to have the pool nearby. Recreation: The excersize room is mainly for cardio. They have some free weights and some other life fitness machines. It's true you can watch t.v. while you're doing cardio. They provide some fruit and water for your pleasure during your workout. I would have liked to have a few more "weight machines", but my workout was just fine. They also have a great little outside walk that runs around Brickell Island that is nice to run. It's a little over a mile, but a great running/walking track. Attendants in the work out area didn't smother or bother you. Depends on what you're looking for. There is a small playground for children, but other than that, there is nothing for them to do. This hotel DOES NOT cater to families. It is designed to be an oasis for the business or weekend travelers. Room: Room was nice. Comfortable bed with lots of pillows. The attendant was very good. They had pull down service at night. There was a little switch you could push if you wanted or didn't want them to make up the room each day or night. Issues: I was surprised to see that the television did not offer movies as an option. The television was your basic television. Someone mentioned the bathroom shower door being an issue, we found that as well. Water would fall off the door onto the floor causing a slippery service. Neither of these were of particuliar concern to us. Room was pretty much what you see on the website. Restaurants: We didn't do Azul's, but we did eat at Cafe Samba. Service was a bit slow but breakfast was good. We didn't do the buffet. We ordered ala cart. We decided to venture out for dinners. We chose Duo on South Miami, a small restaurant with a nice "brazillian" environment. They offered a variety of foods from seafood, to steak, to lamp, to pork, to duck. The salmon and steak were delicious. I would highly recommend this. We walked BACK from to the hotel after dinner, about 6 blocks. Tab for 2 including drinks $122. The following night we ate at Mortons, about 4 blocks from the hotel. Mortons, is Mortons. I believe I would prefer Duo's. It's nice to walk the streets of Downtown Miami back to the hotel. There's a nice breeze along the bridge back to the Oriental. Issues: We had some issues at the pool. The servers aren't very open to asking you for orders, similar to what you may have at a restaurant. They pretty much leave you alone until you tell them you need something. Some people may like this, but when you can't get one to stop by and offer anything, it's an issue that I raised with management which they addressed and made sure they met with me before leaving. On Sunday, it seemed like family day at the pool. It may have been a layover hotel for the day for these families, but kids were all over the place, the lobby, the pool, the restaurants. These families basically took over the pool and made things very loud. I have 4 kids of my own, but if they get too loud, and they are bothering other people trying to relax, I say something to them. These families didn't do that, so we eventually left and went back to the room. Would we stay there again? Maybe. I think we would try the 4 Seasons or another more "posh" South Beach hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cl;ose To Perfection !”
Reviews.Author: jwsmd3
Reviews.Content: Why is it so rare to leave a hotel feeling as satisfied as I was with MOMi? From arrival to departure the staff seems to want only to be sure you are having a perfect stay. Their apparantly liberal policy regarding upgrades and late check out won me over. Isolated (which is exactly what I wanted) on Brickell Key your dining options are limited to the Hotel but breakfasts and dinner at Cafe Sambal were excellent. The AM buffet with coffee and juice for $20 is well worth it. Dinner (did the tasting menu with paired wines) at Azul for a birthday was excellent: entertaining and delicious (am a fish lover but the veal roullade is out of this world) with flawless service and an engaging, informative sommelier who knew exactly when not to intrude! They do not have a "resort fee" , a policy I detest, and use of the gym and the lockers/ showers/ sauna and steam are free to guests as it should be. A Deep Tissue Massage was done right though the very comfortable high tech mechanised massage table was amusing. My only gripe would be the steepness of that valet parking fee but didn't bother with a rental car til the night before leaving. Note breakfasts/ lunch and poolside barservice incur a standard 18 % tip but I found service almost flawless and (be aware) many Miami establishments routinely do this as many foreigners are used to "service compris". Will return.......a worthwhile indulgence!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: tktm
Reviews.Content: My wife, myself and 2 1/2 year old daughter took a long 4th of July weekend down to Miami, we originally had booked a stay at the Ritz Carlton Key Biscayne. We left the Ritz early because of the poor service, small rooms and because the management was requiring guests to wear permanently attached orange vinyl type medical bracelets to access the pool and beach areas. We had American Express' Fine Resorts and Hotels program cancel the rest of the Ritz stay and move us to the Mandarin Oriental Miami. What a wonderful decision that ended up being!!!! The Mandarin Oriental Miami is just simply OUTSTANDING, they truly understand customer service, their 5 star rating is richly deserved. We were warmly greeted and treated as we entered the hotel. When we checked, in our room was upgraded to a Brickell Suite (via the AMEX Fine resorts program), they told us they had other rooms available if it was not to our liking. As the bellman took us to our room, he was careful to point out the fire exits on our floor, certainly a sign of a well managed hotel. One should note that on the higher floors that the fire escape path may actually lead across the exposed roof of the lower floors. The room was a joy to behold, bamboo flooring, a large living space with couches, chairs, TV, guest bathroom, desk and balcony. This was separated from the sleeping quarters by a very nice piece of cabinetry with sliding rice papered glass doors. The bedroom was equally huge with a wonderful feather bed, nice sound system, TV and balcony. The bedroom had direct access to the master bathroom with a free standing two person tub, dual sinks, and separate shower area. The entire bathroom was well finished with a nice Spanish marble. The bed was VERY nice with a soft feather top. The crib that was sent up to our room was just glorious, a wonderful chrome design lined with goose down, our daughter loved it. (certainly much nicer than the ratty wood thing the Ritz Carlton had) The lovely view from the room was of the bay and the Miami Skyline. My wife enjoyed the spa services. The Spa keeps an oriental motif, the lighting is low, the fragrances are earthy. The steam room and sauna are nice, the whirlpool is outside though, by the swimming pool. The showers in the spa come at you from all angles. The spa has a nice feeling to it, it certainly does not have an industrial feeling. The private island is nice too, there is a running path all the way around the island, a playground area for the kids, and a man made beach. Please note however that there is NO ocean access from the beach. If you want to swim in the ocean, go to the concierge and he/she can set you up with passes to one of the beach clubs in South Beach. The hotel pool is nice, but not huge, it does feature an infinity edge. Dining at hotel was also a treat, first we tried the Sanibel cafe, the food was interesting and the views were relaxing. I suggest trying the mildly hot banana ketchup, and the boneless beef ribs. The service was relaxed, but probably only rated 3.5 stars. The kid's menu was standard fare. The only negative thing I saw at the hotel occurred at the cafe, the sight of an anorexic european woman rubbing her pregnant belly before she lite up her cigarette was unpleasant enough to kill my appetite. We also had dinner the Hotel's 5 star restaurant, AZUL. It defiantly has earned its 5 stars. The food was interesting with a lean towards a seafood bent. The service was just truly gracious. The kids menu is shared with the cafe and again is standard fare and certainly not 5-star. In summary, almost every bit of service in this hotel is spot on perfect. They actually understand what service is, they don't just mimic it. Even as you check out of the hotel, the valet hands you a bag with assort fruits and 2 bottles of water; nothing less than a godsend if your next stop is the Miami International Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Four stars from this reviewer, 2nd business trip to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAN71395
Reviews.Content: I was here on business. This is my second business trip at the hotel. The service at the front desk, spa, gym, restaurants, concierge....all the service people were excellent. I drove over from the west coast of Florida where I reside. The only parking at the hotel is valet which is $30.00 per day which I thought was too high. I didn't care for the food at the hotel which was also too expensive. Keep in mind my tastes are not that sophisticated, so others may like eel, and other things that I have not eaten before. I liked the gym, the treadmills and stationary bikes each had individual television sets with headphones. There were different newspapers at the gym. There is an attendant in the gym who is very helpful. The sauna and steam room and shower facility is about the best I have experienced, as are the complimentary robes. By the way, there is no additional charge to use the gym, sauna or steam room. The rooms are really beautiful and relatively spacious with spectacular interior decorating, bathrooms, showers, etc. Overall, I would give four stars because of the beautiful rooms, excellent employees, and very luxurious steam room, sauna, and shower facilities.

Reviews.Title: “*** WOW ***”
Reviews.Author: mike in florida
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an amazing weekend in Miami with a very special friend of mine. I havn't seen her in a long time so I wanted it too be very special and based upon the great reviews on this site I chose the Mandarin Oriental for our stay. From the moment we entered the hotel we were both absolutely blown away by the attention to detail this hotel shows. I have stayed at many nice hotels but I have NEVER been treated to something this special. This hotel will make you feel like a true VIP and by the time you leave you will know that you have just experienced something very rare! Thanks to the Mandarin Oriental I was able to show my friend the special time I had hoped and I am sure that we will do it again soon!!

Reviews.Title: “most luxurious in miami!”
Reviews.Author: susieej
Reviews.Content: After investigating where my husband and I should stay in Miami for a long weekend, we decided on the Mandarin Oriental! Thank goodness! This was a fantastic, pampering hotel! The staff everywhere was curteous and helpful. The infinity edge pool was the best! Ice water with lemon brought to us every 1/2 hour, spoons of homemade sorbet brought to us as well. You can ask for just about anything, and they will bring it. A couple next to us asked for suntan lotion and magazines, and they were brought to them right away. The beach area was beautiful, right on the bay, however, there's no swimming. We walked on the 1.3 mile walking path every morning, which goes around the island of Brickell Key. We each had spa appointments, which were VERY expensive, but wonderful! We ventured out and checked out some of the other hotels we were thinking of staying at (The Ritz, key Biscayne and the new, Acqualina), but this was by far the best! The rooms were beautiful and the bathrooms were to die for. Wonderful surroundings throughout the room. We're looking forward to trying their new resort opening in Mexico next year!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BonesCentralCoastNSW
Reviews.Content: A great Hotel that lives up to it's star rating. Service was excellent, rooms great. It's a walk or taxi to get anywhere, but public transport is not too far away. Views are terrific. Would recommend it anytime.

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: thehotelconnoisseur
Reviews.Content: My husband, two kids and I stayed at the MO on a 1 night layover from the Four Seasons Exuma on to the Four Seasons Nevis the next day. Wow, what can I say. Without a doubt the poshest hotel in Miami. The lobby was stunningly beautiful with a commanding view of Biscayne Bay. I was hooked on it the instant I walked in. Wish I wouldâ€™ve had a chance to relax there. I loved the pool, recently in Travel and Leisure Magazine, they named it the best pool "with a view" in the world. Very Impressive. Private Beach was very nice as well. Though the real highlight of the MO was the view from our room. We booked a Deluxe Bay View ($330, great value, normally $500+) which had a spacious balcony overlooking Biscayne Bay with the city in the background. The city lights at night are spectacular! The room it self was unique and flawless. Loved the complementary truffles on arrival, very elegant. They also had complementary milk and cookies for my kids, nice touch. Bathroom was stunning, one of the best Iâ€™d ever seen. My one complaint was the hotel's shampoo, definitely a man's shampoo, did not like the fragrance. Though I guess it is a man's business hotel after all. Azul was also a wonderful experience. In my opinion not overrated at all. I forget what we had for appetizers and entrees but it was some of the best food I'd had in a while. Had a very extensive wine list, definitely right on par with The Inn at Little Washington. I loved the $15 Vanilla soufflÃ© with raspberry sauce, really hit the spot. The bill of our party of 4 (on child) was exactly $330. Honestly I expected it to be more, especially compared to our $421 meal at the dining room of the Four Seasons Nevis. Didnâ€™t get a chance to eat breakfast at CafÃ© Sambal, really wanted to eat breakfast outdoors facing the sunrise. Our flight left to early to eat out, we had room service for breakfast instead. Very nice and professionally presented. Service- Best of the Best! The concierge and Bellman were so friendly and professional in accommodating our needs. We accidentally walked in on housekeeping "refreshing our room" and they were literally on their hands and knees making sure every last detail was perfect. Incredible! And that is what the MO prides it self on. Didnâ€™t get a chance to even see the spa, sure its top class though. Overall- Great Place, so posh! Definitely the place to be in Miami whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Now, I am a fan.”
Reviews.Author: permaeagle
Reviews.Content: In a word, the Mandarin has ruined me. Why? Well, I just don't know how I can return to the mediocrity of Marriott-land and Sheraton-ville after staying in the most peaceful, welcoming, blissful and professional hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff is absolutely top-notch. The rooms are serene. The sushi is melt-in--your mouth fresh. The spa is literally to die for. This place takes pampering to a new level. Guests are cared for from the moment they check in to checkout time. Complimentary truffles and soothing tunes waiting for me in my room upon arrival? Check. Turndown service with a freshly-cut orchid and a note wishing me sweet dreams? Check. Sumptuous robes and comfy slippers waiting for me at the end of a long day of meetings? Check. Treat yourself right and book a room here. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thank God my Fiance & I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel. We were debating on whether we should stay in a hotel on Miami Beach or stay away from the beach & be on a private island. As soon as we pulled into the front of the building, the doormen were there to greet us & valet parking parking was a breeze. As we entered the double volume grand lobby, the 24x24 Spanish marble floor tile & wall finishes caught our attentions immediately. We entered our room & was amazed at the quality & space that was provided to us with an open balcony. I highly recommend this hotel for a wkend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business”
Reviews.Author: filmgeek
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental is beautiful - great rooms, great decor. If you are traveling on business and need to be downtown, this is the best option. And the fake beach (wish you were able to actually swim there) is great with it's beds - makes you feel like royalty. The down side is that everything there feels extremely overpriced. Massages at the spa were over $200 (!) and dinner in their restaurant was good, but definitely not worth the price tag (although being from NYC, I'm used to the best restaurants). And the service in the restaurant was extremely slow. Actually, I would rate much of the service there in regards to their waitstaff at all the restaurants and pool bar as poor - generally always very slow. Also, if you're planning on going out a lot, most of the restaurants and entertainment are in South Beach, so I would probably recommending staying there so you don't have to drive all the time and deal with parking.

Reviews.Title: “nice but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: qwikwitted1
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Mandarin at the end of April, and even though we got a discounted rate, we felt it was still overpriced. The hotel is nice, first class, staff is great, but for the price you pay, I was expecting a larger room. The view of downtown and the bathroom was very nice though. The fake beach and pool are nice to relax at but feels odd since you're looking over a view of downtown rather than an ocean. I have no qualms over my experience at the Mandarin - the staff really goes out of their way to make you feel special and get to know you. Be prepared to spend a lot though. I feel that if you're looking to be in South Beach more you could get more for your money over there and won't have to deal with driving or taking a cab to party at night or go to the real beach.

Reviews.Title: “Top class (but beware of valet park)”
Reviews.Author: Phil512
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Mandarin Oriental on Brickell Key in March 2006. Normally not my usual level of price but there was no possibility to remain at the Florida Beach for our last night in Miami. So,â€¦ certainly the most expensive hotel I paid for in my life. I wonâ€™t tell very much about it because of two reasons: we only stayed one night without using the restaurants and everything was so â€œtop classâ€� that I can only confirm the numerous very positive reviews already uploaded so far. High prices, high quality. Entering the room after sunset was magic: the atmosphere provided by the style of the furniture, the intimate lighting coming from numerous discrete sources, the relaxing music, the blue water images of underwater smoothly swirling dolphins (or something like that) on the TV screen: wow! Surprising no glass window between the room and the bathroom, but there is a oriental type roll up-roll down screen that you can let down if you want some privacy. Top level everything. Warm pool (actually too warm for real swimmers), nice jacuzzi, exclusive atmosphere in the spa as well. Full of style, very helpful, very friendly, contact at the reception desk. There, you are really important as a guest. Views are great. Private (artificial) beach. The only thing that really upset me was the mandatory valet park service. Not that it was bad (it was actually very good) but I like to use it if I want and not to be forced to it. Also the fact that it is ridiculously overpriced (30 USD per night) doesnâ€™t make you feel like giving any kind of additional tip to the young fellows who serve you. But again, very high standards, very high prices. Still a unique experience. Maybe be aware that you are close to down town Miami and not close to beaches (South Beach and so on). More a business men hotel in some regards.

Reviews.Title: “Surely not the best in Miami!!”
Reviews.Author: Letssee125
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed recently for one night and were glad it wasn't for more nights. We had previously stayed for a few nights in South Beach and wished he had returned there again. What we enjoyed the most were the views of the city, specially at night time but although there was nothing terribly wrong with the hotel, during our short stay we encountered a few problems which in our opinion, should not have happened in a 5 star hotel of this level. These are a few: *On arrival our booking had been cancelled. Luckily they had rooms free so we were accomodated. Unluckily, the room was overlooking the bridge/road. *The only bar at the hotel opened at 6pm, could not have a drink or a coffee before then (there was one bar inside the Oriental restaurant, but the smell of raw fish was terrible and it was raining outside). *The choice of restaurants/food was poor (They were there, but they had very non-flexible opening times and you have to hope for good weather). *We decided to order and expresso and a hot chocolate from room service. They literally took 30 minutes to bring it and then both items were cold and weak. Cost $26 (on saying this, on departure we mentioned it and they very kindly discounted it from our final bill). *On leaving our room we turned the "do not disturb" light on. After 10 min. we returned to our room to find a man cleaning our windows inside out. He smiled at us, took his time and left without saying a word. We watched him seating on the bed for about 5 min.! *On the pool, my husband moved his sunbed about 10 inches so he could face the sun better and was immediately told off for moving it. They are not to be touched, we were told. All these (and a few more) during a one night stay... It might be a Mandarin Oriental, but it lacks of the class, customer service and touch you find in hotels in the Far East. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent MO”
Reviews.Author: pleiade98
Reviews.Content: We keep coming back to MO. The rooms are wonderful, the service is very professional, the skyline is a dream. We always combine the Miami visit with a Spa session. We highly reccomend it! The restaurant is very good. It's worth a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Miami”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is by far the only luxury hotel in Miami I would recommend. The rooms are beautiful and the restaurant and spa should not be missed. The only drawback is that it's not on the beach... But, you'll only have to drive about ten minutes for that.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ft007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place beginning of feb. 2006, for 2 nights; everything is very professional at this hotel; room had a good view; large, high with nice bathroom, and had a very comfortable bed; breakfast offers a large choice; pleasant fitness and wellness centre as well

Reviews.Title: “Mostly great but a few disappointments”
Reviews.Author: Never2Full4Dessert
Reviews.Content: We recently spent one night at the Mandarin Oriental Miami. The room was immaculate and attractive. The bathroom is large and open to the room, however you can pull down a shade for privacy. (The toilet was behind a door, at least). The infinity edge pool is really nice and the service all around the hotel was very friendly. My disappointments were: (1) I had an extrememly mediocre massage at thh spa, which normally wouldn't have bothered me so much but because I paid $185, I was expecting a really good one. (2) We ate lunch at Cafe Sambul and the restaurant at the pool and the meals were just average. Again, normally I wouldn't be so nitpicky but because we paid between $70-$90 for the two of us, I was expecting much better food. Overall, a nice hotel but they have you where they want you...that is, if you want the convenience of eating at the hotel, you'll be overcharged. As for the spa, I suppose it is my fault for not complaining, however, I felt uncomfortable complaining because the massage therapist was so "nice". I usually rely on the reputation of a place and was never disappointed with a spa service from a top-rated spa until this one.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing honeymoon, Beautiful hotel, great atmosphere. Helpful and polite staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel after reading great reviews about it here. It's all we read and more! Very very helpful and kind staff. Definitely first class. The rooms are cleaned once in the morning and once in the evening and they leave an orchids in your bed) The bathroom is very spacious. The Decoration in the room is modern and it gives you a feeling of 'tranquility'. No, the hotel is not the cheapest, but we don't regret it since we had a great time. You pay for quality :) and since we were honeymooners we got an upgrade of room on arrival which was great. And the atmosphere!! they have different soothing instruments being played at the lobby every day (harp for instance). Very nice. It's not very close to south beach, which for people that loves to party might be inconvenient... NOT FOR US though. You can always grab a taxi (they ARE expensive around 25dlls to drive you there), the hotel will arrange one to pick you up within a couple of minutes. They have a couple of restaurants in the hotel, they are good. But if you are in Miami you might want to explore a variety of food there, many restaurants at better prices. If you don't want to get out of your room, ask for room service (but remember that again you will pay that) Romm service in good hotels is never cheap, just keep that in mind and ENJOY it. The hotel doesn't have a beach itself (they have an artificial one which is nice), but you do have oceanviews from the rooms. I would definately recommend this hotel. A+ for Mandarin Oriental in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Save Your Money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hotel was over priced and did not deliver value. They prices you pay are for the reputation of the OTHER mandarin's because this one was a disaster! At this property the level of service and attention you get is directly correlated with the amount of revenue you bring to the hotel! So yea, we all have price tags in there...

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Pretzellogix
Reviews.Content: Incredible. This is what MO is all about. Stunning, oriental-influenced decor, posh luxury, top notch furnishings and in-room electronics, great food, and attentive staff. The skyline view rooms are actually less expensive, but in my opinion are much nicer (Miami is quite a sight all lit up at night). The beds are among the most comfortable, and the bathrooms are huge and neatly designed, with window into the bedroom. Food at the pool-side sushi restaurant is fantastic, and the Martini bar is very chic. The only qualm is that we tried to make an appointment at the spa... but they never returned our call. In summary, an incredible hotel, the quintessential MO. If you don't need to be in South Beach proper, then definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really love the Mandarin Oriental in Miami. My wife and I have stayed there twice in the last six months. On our first stay, we were upgraded four categories to a very nice suite at no charge. The second stay, we were upgraded two categories to a very nice room at no charge. Seems to be a great central location. Quick access to American Airlines Arena, Bayside Shopping Center, South Beach, etc. The staff is very friendly. The hotel/rooms are very clean. The food at the restaurants is mediocre. Room service is definitely the way to go if you're looking to dine in. Would recommend this hotel.. Just be prepared to spend some money!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you can do without South Beach, stay here. The rooms are fabulous and the staff is terrific. The on site restaurants are stellar.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Sweets1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between Christmas and New Year wow! Fantastic rooms all overlooking the water and all with balcony (we were lucky enough to see a Manatee from ours), bathrooms were amazing clean and spacious. We ate in Cafe Sambel one of the hotel restaurants, food was really good and you should save room for the deserts out of this world. With it's own private beach and good size pool you won't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mikemanchester
Reviews.Content: Having spent two nights in a 7th floor suite I have to say this is one of the best (and most expensive) hotels I have stayed in. The $850 a night rack rate was reduced to $609 on expedia and was worth every penny. The newly built Mandarin Oriental overlooks downtown Miami with a killer view of the skyscrapers that make up the best part of the city. Attentive service and comfort were the hallmarks of our stay. Azul the restaurant was overpriced but the service and food were generally good. The Sambai bar was our choice for breakfast but we found this a little poorer in service but food was also fine. If you can afford it I'd stay hear above any other venue in Miami - ever South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizalev
Reviews.Content: This is the most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed in. The lobby is spectacular and the rooms are very luxurious. Only weird thing is the "window" from the bedroom to the bathroon. We went on a platinum Amex deal and got a free upgrade for an extra room. The service was very friendly, if sometimes slightly forgetful. But the views and the general ambience made up for any flaws. I would highly recommend for a luxury stay in downtown (business) Miami.

Reviews.Title: “A sad example of a great chain”
Reviews.Author: mpfund
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night end of November. Dinner at hotel restaurant Azul -- glacially slow service, double billed for one item, mediocre food. Had booked a rate including breakfast. Was billed a surcharge of $11 which they claimed was for ordering tea rather than coffee. Upon return home received a mini bar bill for $25.79 and we never opened the bar. Our other experiences at Mandarins have been great -- this one is a disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Classy place, but how well maintained?”
Reviews.Author: Gemakan
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in Downtown Miami, and decided to splash out on a room at the Mandarin. Certainly a classy place, situated on the Brickell Quay â€œislandâ€�, lots of expensive-looking fixtures and fittings, and all modern. The room was very spacious, including the bathroom, but not as state-of-the-art as I had expected for a hotel this new and supposedly top-of-the-range â€“ simple things like no centralised lighting control in the room; no flat-screen TV. For such a new hotel, I was also surprised to see how scuffed, smudged and scratched the wood fixtures were in the room â€“ the whole lot looked like it could do with a good polish. The carpet was stained, the balcony and its chairs were filthy (admittedly, this was just a week after Wilma had struck Florida), there was a dead bulb in one of the lamps which made it too dark to read (I managed to get that replaced smoothly enough). The pool is big enough and sun-beds comfortable, and staff very attentive â€“ the free-flow iced lemon water is a nice gesture and welcome. I used the spa to get changed before I checked-out and that is very plush. The gym is large with great views over the pool and harbour. Overall, high-class facilities generally (and of course you pay heavily for them) but quite some concern around the maintenance of what is there, especially in the guest room that I had.

Reviews.Title: “Great views - need a cab or car to get around”
Reviews.Author: Sc0user
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, good food and lovely martini bar. We stayed at this hotel for a long weekend and found the service and quality of hotel to be great. It is the usual Mandarin prices - so even if you get a great rate for the room - watch out for the extras (food, drink etc) The spa is great but I think over priced. Pool was great and has its own beach!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, some service issues”
Reviews.Author: razlon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Dynasty Suite. Great hotel, wonderful breakfast & lunch, but a few service issues (lost our reservation, took forever to retrieve valet car).

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel but some service problems”
Reviews.Author: rfc_traveler
Reviews.Content: Okay, there is no question that this is a five-star hotel, and I would highly recommend it. The rooms are great (comfortable beds and large bathrooms) and we had a great view of the water. All the facilities are first-class. Nevertheless, I was suprised by some service issues that we experienced at a hotel of this caliber. Despite our reservation, the hotel was not able to get us a room until at least one hour after the advertised check-in time. We did arrive early to the hotel but then had to wait several hours for a hotel room. Even worse though, once we checked into our room, we were unpleasantly suprised by two other guests who were apparently given keys to the same room! We then had to sit in the room with a strange couple while the hotel figured out what had happened. I certainly did not expect to receive a free night for the hotel's snafu but expected some sort of token gesture for the inconvenience. We also had an issue at least one night getting the turn-down service. On the whole, I agree with the rest of the reviews that this is a great hotel but was disappointed to some extent by the service issues.

Reviews.Title: “Refined, Luxurious treat w/ World class friendly service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Treated myself to a long weekend at the Mandarin for my birthday and it couldn't have been a better thing to do for myself. If you want refined elegance where service is with a welcoming smile, then this is it. Perfect for a meditative retreat - very restorative to the soul. The pool is not large, but it was never very crowded. It's an infinity pool so the views are nice, especially when you're in it. Water temp was always perfect. The constant refilling of ice water with lemon, gratis, was a most welcome touch for all the guests at the beach and pool. Pretty much did not need to leave the hotel as lazing by the pool and man-made beach w/ teak canopied beds was too perfect. Rooms were spacious and impeccably clean. Food at Cafe Azul was extemely good. High caliber fitness room (and of course their well-known spa which I did not try). There's also an easy jogging path around Key Brickell (about 1.3 miles) which the Mandarin gives a small map for. I've tried the Ritz Carlton in Miami as well with friends and I have to say I like them both equally but for different reasons. They are both high quality hotels well worth their 5 stars, but if you're looking for some privacy away from the crowds, then the Mandarin is a better bet. And yes, they brought me a lovely cake while I was away as well as received a lovely happy b-day message from their GM, Jorge Gonzales. Quite the nice surprise-- as I said their service seemed genuinely sincere and thoughtful. Would definitely stay again and plan to make this an annual trip. You really should try one of these wonderful hotels as it really does help to enhance the SOBE experience. Also try their web-site for some seasonal specials; you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in July for 5 nights and had a wonderful experience, for the most part. The room was beautiful with a view of the bay and had a large balcony. The bathroom was amazing; all marble with a stand-up shower, a bathtub for two and they provided the most wonderful bath products each day. We arrived quite late the first day, after midnight, and therefore ordered room service which was quite good and I didn't think badly priced ($15 for a huge chicken ceasar salad which we ended up sharing). We ate at Cafe Sambal every morning, the food and service was very good. Overall, the staff was wonderful, especially Carlos at the concierge desk, I cannot say enough good about him - he took care of all of our requests, some of which were a little extreme, with such ease and always with a smile. Everytime I picked up the phone for anything at all, I felt like someone was knocking on our door before I could hang up the receiver. Everywhere you go, the staff always stops to great you, from management all the way down the chain. The infinity pool was beautiful, get there early on the weekends before all of the chairs get taken though. The food / beverage service at the pool was a little spotty - we had to ask for a menu four times and wait 20 minutes for the waitress to finally come over. We ordered a cucumber - avocado roll and they forgot to roll the avocado in, when we brought that to their attention, they just put some chopped up avocado on top of the roll rather than roll a new one which was a little disappointing but in the scheme of things not a big deal at all. Our only complaint about our stay was when we had our final dinner at Azul, the only AAA 5 Diamond restaurant in all of Miami. We sat outside which I would not recommend unless it is a little cool because there is no air circulation at all. The food was wonderful, as a matter of fact it was the best meal we had down there and we consider ourseleves to have fairly sophisticated palates. The server who took care of us was, in the kindest word I can find, ATROCIOUS!!! We ate there on a Sunday evening and earlier in the day had brunch at the Biltmore where, anyone who has had the brunch there can tell you, you practically have to roll out of there you eat so much. Since we were not starving, we decided not to order an appetizer which our server clearly had a problem with, mind you this was right after we selected a $150 bottle of wine. Everytime we had a question about the menu, he had something obnoxious to say, for example when we were looking at the desert menu I asked what exactly the peach melba was, he responded with such attitude, "It's peach!" That was it for us and we made a complaint to the manager on duty and eventually followed up with the hotel General Manager the experience was so upsetting. Overall, we enjoyed the hotel very much but our experience at the restaurant always pops into my head when people ask about our mini vacation. We will definitely stay at the Mandarin Oriental again but we will NEVER eat at Azul again, there are so many wonderful resturants in Miami that will not treat you the way we were treated when you spend $300 on dinner so I suggest you spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic... ,ade our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cna not praise this hotel enough, the staff the quality of food, service, rooms, facilities. And although some say it is expensive; we paid less for a two course meal with drinks here that at The Wyndham Miami Beach which was horrible!!!! and although room service was pricy the bar drinks and Cafe Sambulwere no worse than other hotels we stayed in and at least here the service and place is great too. I would definately rccomend this hotel if, but be prepared for a bit of a journey to the Art Deco district and Lincoln drive where the restaurants and night life are (about $22 to $30 each way) Fantastic place i wish i could holiday with them all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice..... Very overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed a night at the Mandarin on our honeymoon. The hotel, lobby, and rooms were all very nice and I was very impressed. Hotel staff was very courteous and accommodating. The private beach, while it looked very nice and clean, was unusuable due to the number of mosquitos present. I felt that the price of the room was fair, $330 for an ocean view on the 17th floor, however food and drinks were WAYYYYY overpriced. I was unable to get reservations at the 5 star restaurant Azul, so instead my wife and I went to Cafe Sambal for dinner. The dinner was okay, we both got shrimp, which were very good, a salad each, 2 pina coladas, and 2 diet cokes. For a meal that I thought was decent but nothing spectacular by no means, I would have put it a step above Applebees for example, I expected to pay around $50, however when I got the bill it was over $95!! Turns out they charge $10 for mixed drinks, ridiculous. Room service was also overpriced, 2 dishes of ice cream later in the evening came to $35. My wife is a diet coke addict so we had to purchase a few while there, they were $3.50 for one of those small 8 oz bottles. Yeah the soda didn't break my wallet but just the thought still aggravated me.... and don't even think about using the mini fridge. I personally will never stay there again, after having saved money to have a great honeymoon I felt I wasted $200 by staying here. If money is not an issue for you then by all means its a great place, the high prices on some items just left a very sour taste in my mouth. If I could do it again I'd still get the room, but I'd buy a case of soda and order a pizza for delivery instead.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel 5 star plus!”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in January. The hotel was superb from check in to check out. The architecture is spectacular and the lobby truly elegant with lovely views and gorgeous materials. Even though we had an entry level room it was fantastic. Spacious with lovely soothing decor and very comfy bed. Bathroom worthy of a maharaja. The pool is nice and service great. The food at Azul to die for. Room service was excellent, and the staff ultra professional. The hotel was peaceful and relaxing as opposed to the frenetic pace of South Beach. The Mandarin Oriental Miami is as close to perfection as it gets. We actually extended a night it was so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews say it all!”
Reviews.Author: msyc
Reviews.Content: After staying 2 nights at The Tides on SOBE we decided to try 3 nights at the Mandarin. There was absolutely nothing wrong with The Tides however our move was due to the excessive weekend rates that are applied to Miami hotels. If you want the exclusivity the Mandarin Oriental is the place to stay. Like other Mandarin Orinental hotels that we have stayed in the Miami hotel exceeds in customer service. The staff are helpful, friendly and are taught to make the guests feel welcomed. The conceirge service seem to have the answer and connections for everything! We stayed here for my husbands 30 Birthday and he was pleasantly surpised when the hotel delivered a Birthday cake to our room. The timing was impecable - the cake seemed to coincide with our perfectly with a short afternoon visit to our room. We chose to stay in a ocean front room. The furninshing were solid and were in line with a 5 star rating. The bathroom was a decent size with a opening in the wall between the bathroom and room separated onlywith a blind. This did not bother us as a married couple, however just to highlight, the tolilet itself had it's own room with a door. If I was to ever visit Miami again, I would definately choose this location over South beach. The Mandarin seems to have everything, including a man made beach for bathing, plus more! A fantastic place to get away from it all!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Has everything you would expect from a good business hotel. Bathroom can also open up to the bedroom so you can watch TV from the tub. A bit tricky to find the turning to the hotel since it is not signposted off 8th. Check-in staff a bit teutonic. Concierge was more friendly, helpful. Nice gym, pool. Parking is USD24/night.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFULL!!11”
Reviews.Author: Neekeesha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to come to Miami two days prior to our Royal Caribbean cruise. We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental from 5/11-5/13/05. It was a hefty price to pay for the two nights but it was so worth it. As soon as we arrived our bags were taken away immediately. When you walk in to the Mandarin it smells like aromatherapy. The oriental music is very soothing to the ears. Right when we first walked in, we were on vacation. The Mandarin sits right on the bay so as your walking in all you see is water. Our room was not ready when we arrived b/c normal check in time is 3pm. So like kids in a candy store we looked around. The pool area was beautiful.. There is a pool side bar for all your beverages needed to relax. They also serve lunch poolside also. We decided to have lunch at Cafe Sambal. There were no outside tables available so we had to take a table indoors. The food was more like Japanese, Thai and Chinese I guess. I really didn't care, I was just hungry. The staff was very friendly. We did wait longer than normal for our food. When it finally came out it wasn't worth the $67.00 we paid for our tab. The tea was good though. We managed to finish lunch right b/f 3pm and our room was available. There was no wait on the elevators, very fast. The hallways are kept very dim. I guess that's a way to get you relaxed. Got in the room and awaited was complimentary chocolates and a welcome card. After being in the room less than 2 minutes the door bell rung. (Yes there is a door bell) It was our luggage. The linens were all in white. The furniture was white. The bathroom had an enormous soaking tub with a separate marble shower for two. The whole bathroom was marble. There are robes available and slippers. You can keep the slippers. The soaps and lotions given are not your average. All play a major part in smell. All aromatherapy! Yes! Finally a hotel that knows how to spoil you. We chose a Deluxe Skyline Bayview Room. Excellent choice. The view from the balcony was excellent. I couldn't submit all the pictures but you get the point. Let's see there's a turn down service with a lovely flower everynight. We did order room service and it was not that good. Don't order the Turkey BLT. The bread is as hard as a rock. It was $52.00. I wasn't impressed at all with the sandwich. Ladies.... The spa is out this world. I had a spa appointment at 5pm for a Luxury Facial and a 80 minute Swedish Massage. When you walk in to the spa the hallway is very dim. They ask you for your name and quickly seat you. As you wait they come and take your shoes and replace them with spa shoes. From there you are lead down a dim hallway with sounds of oriental music and water sounds. Very relaxing. Your given a keychain for a locker and you slip into a comfy robe. From there you go to a waiting room where you are greeted and asked if you would like tea or water. Again sounds of relaxing music and a water streaming down the wall. There are steam rooms also. I didn't wait that long b/f they called me. The massage was good. If you don't have deep muscle tension, I would not recommend the swedish massage. There is pain associated with this massage b/c it deals with pressure points. The facial was ok. I thought that there would be extractions. So if you get the luxury facial it does not come with extractions. You do get a neck, scalp and shoulder massage though. Oh did I mention that this hotel also has their own man made beach. It has many cabanas and hammocks to rest the day away. The breeze was amazing. On our final night we decided to eat at Azul. This resturant is also located inside the hotel. Very pricey but worth it. We noticed that a lot of people spoke spanish. The money was worth it . The attire is casual. You can not wear shorts in this restuarant. My husband made a mistake and wore shorts and the attendant privately asked him if he would change to pants. Check out was fast and easy. This hotel was so worth the money. I would stay here again. There were so many plus factors here. If we could have changed anything, we would have rented a car to see more of the city. Oh also there were not hardly any children at this hotel. So if your staying for a honeymoon great choice. I LOVE THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!! Somebody loan me some money so I can go back!! lol

Reviews.Title: “Very refined”
Reviews.Author: Flaherty99
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on the internet (40% off advertised rates) and used it as a one night stopover en route back to Heathrow. Building is impressive (although dwarfed by surrounding financial HQs and the like) and about a 15 minute cab ride from the airport. Staff are superb throughout the hotel. Our room was a bay view - all fittings were excellent and my wife revelled in the bath. And the ridiculously overpriced spa where she had a number of treatments, all preceded by the ringing of a small bell. Ahem. We ate in the Cafe/restaurant where the food was very good and again, the service top class. If you can get the rate this is a great stopover and the staff have a lot of nice touches like getting us some water for the cab ride back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Complete relaxation”
Reviews.Author: KateJones
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at this hotel after a hectic week in New York. We got a great deal via Lastminute and were a bit worried in case our room reflected this. We needn't have worried. A huge room with sofa, balcony, great big bathroom. The food was amazing as was the beach party on Friday nights (although lots of teenagers). We really really loved it. We stay in a lot of luxury hotels and this one truly is wonderful. Not much going on in the local area, but Â£15 in a cab to South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “The Shiznit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you can spend $300/night, you will not regret it. If you've never been to Miami before, note: It's a 20 minute drive to South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Awesome location + Great decor + Good service = Great Experience Stayed here recently and had a great time. Service is a little hit or miss- sometimes it's awesome and other times you have to wait 1.5 hours for the bellman to get your luggage. Overall they make up for it with excellent rooms, breath taking views and an amazing spa. DO NOT LEAVE WITHOUT GOING TO THE SPA!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service except at the Restaurants!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a business meeting and we were very pleased with the excellent service, the spa and our room overlooking the bay. They even have umbrellas to use in case of rain. The bell staff are so helpful, too. One thing spoiled our otherwise excellent stay- The lousy service at the Restaurants- very slow, not at all the caliber of service that the Mandarin Oriental boasts about. Moreover, we booked a reservation at Azul for lunch upon arrival. We were not advised of any dress codes at the frontdesk, during my phone reservation, or even at the Hotel Services section of the booklet at our room. After bringing us to our table outside on a balcony, they announced that they could not serve me as i was wearing my long shorts. The maitre d' even boasted to my business guest that he sent me back to my room to change- which added more to my embarrassment. I have recommended to the hotel to at least advise their guests about any dress codes, or even to have a discreet sign outside the entrance. Unfortunately, I never had a reply from the hotel, or the restaurant maitre d' about this matter. For restaurant service, try the four season's miami. My wife and I had such excellent service there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect....”
Reviews.Author: traveloverNj
Reviews.Content: We stayed pre-cruise in January 2005 and what a treat this hotel was to stay at! Very well run and service was excellent! I normally would never stay in a Mandarin Oriental because they are very EXPENSIVE, but we got a very good room rate through the cruise line. The nice sized rooms are very simple, decorated in Asian theme. Beds were "heavenly" and our bathroom was huge. Loved the chocolate truffles!! This is more of a business hotel than a resort hotel, but perfect for staying a couple of nights to see Miami. They have a great walking trail around the hotel. Wish I could afford to stay in Mandarin Orientals more often!!

Reviews.Title: “No wonder it's number 1”
Reviews.Author: NYCBeachBoy
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked in the door til the moment I reluctantly checked out a week later, I enjoyed the Mandarin Oriental enormously. The decor everywhere is simply breathtaking. I had a beautiful king sized bed, a nice sitting area and a glorious bathroom with wonderful Moulton Brown toiletries. The quiet of the rooms is remarkable. The terrace with its skyline views was a wonderful place to chill out as was the lovely pool and the artificial beach. I also appreciated the absolute calm of the place and the crowd that stays there. Since this was a business trip, I needed the services of the Business Center and everything was handled with great efficiency and, like everything else at the Mandarin, the service is first rate. Even the maid service is remarkable. It seemed done before I even came back from breakfast...which is particularly nice when you are using your room for work part of the day. The turndown service was equally well timed--although I must confess to having provided one maid with a fully Monte when she came into the room after a single bell ring. The food is good but pricey. I found dining outdoors on the terrace perferable to the somewhat noisy Cafe Sambal. The Martini Bar off the lobby is fun. The pool Sushi bar is a great place for lunch. And then there's the spa. A truly wonderful place where I had a treatment that was simply unbelievably good and incredibly expensive. But I would have to say worth it. Finally for the guy who groused about the lack of nightlife, there's the Friday night party at the Beach--now one of the hottest tickets in Miami. The night we were there the crowd was gorgeous, swaying to latin music and just a lot of fun to watch. As a hotel guest, you have instant entree to what is a undoubtedly one of THE weekly events in Miami. Now one other thing....South Beach has had it. I have seldom seen such a really dreadful looking crowd anywhere--a lot of Europeans enjoying their inflated Euros and dressed so badly....it was very sad to see. We were initially supposed to be there but I am so glad we had the luxe and the splendour of the Mandarin to look forward to. I'd go back in a shot...even if I were paying for it myself.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly excellent, just a few negatives”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay--very pleased overall with the service, room (cheapest room still had a nice view of the Bay), breakfast was outstanding (full American breakfast was included in our rate booked on the hotel's web site). Loved the pool, "beach", and walking/jogging path along the bay. Drove into South Beach one day and was happy to return to the relative quiet of the MO. There were several conferences going on at the hotel but it didn't seem to affect the service. Particularly impressed with the wait staff at the Cafe Sambal and the concierges. Now just a few small things I noticed: the furniture in the room looked a bit worn and cheap for a luxury hotel, although the bed was extremely comfortable with topnotch linens. The desk clerk at check out was very nice but there were a lot of mistakes on the bill--ie charges for breakfast that was included in the rate still appeared on the bill; minibar charges appeared and we did not even open the bar. The clerk did take the charges off the bill without a problem but it still was rather inefficient. Would definitely return though...

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a 2 night stay at the Mandarin on February 20th thru the 22nd. It felt luxurious walking into the lobby and seeing the great views of the bay and the skyline. My room was what I expected but I have to admit that the room size was not worth the price tag of $495 plus a night. Prices are high during this time due to peak season. I was welcomed with a greeting card and Joy of Life chocolates which were superb. The marble bathroom is fantastic and huge compared to most hotel bathrooms. I received the best service from the valet attendants, room service staff and maids. For example, I returned to my room while the maid was still there and I was going to go get some ice. The maid insisted on getting the ice for me and she did which was very nice. The valet attendants were very nice as well. The Front desk clerks were less attentive in their service. When I checked out, the front desk person didn't even ask how my stay was or if everything was met to my expectations. I also tried the Ayurvedic Holistic Body Treatment at the Spa in the Hotel and it was definately different than a regular swedish massage. I really enjoyed the spa lounge rooms with its sauna and steam room. The treatment room that I was in had it's own shower inside! I also ordered room service and the food was fine but nothing special. I would recommend getting the sorbet medley as a dessert since it was delicious with coconut, rasberry and mango. My stay was relaxing and very quiet. I never heard any noise from any of the rooms next to mine. The hotel is very close to all the freeways that lead to Miami Beach and you will get to Miami Beach in 15 minutes with no traffic. I noticed that traffic started between noon and up going to Miami Beach. Don't get scared away that you have to pay 20 or more for parking at Miami Beach. I parked at South Point Park for only $5.00 for all day and walked my way all along Ocean Drive and up South Beach. The real down side is that you have to pay $24 plus tax on valet parking at the hotel. The hotel is also located very close to Little Havana so you can grab lunch or dinner there too. I would stay at this hotel again since I did not experience any rude service or noisy atmosphere and the rooms were a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet and Sour”
Reviews.Author: matthew.cronin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights in January, each separated by a week as we traveled abroad. The first night was fantastic, among the very best of our 2 week/4 country vacation. The room was huge and beautiful - filled with delicious incense as we entered for the first time. Room service was great and, I thought, very reasonably priced. The staff was very friendly and gracious (void of the South Beach attitude). We left the next morning very much looking forward to returning for another night a week later. Unfortunately when we returned we had a completely different experience. The staff seemed completely inundated with a conference that was being held there and we were obviously not the priority - we didn't even get assistance with our luggage. Our room was right next to the elevator despite the fact that I had specifically requested one away from the elevator (and it's in my 'profile' with MO). When I asked the manager if another room was available he said he could give me a suite "for a good rate"!!! They tried to up-sell me after giving me exactly what I had asked not to have - I felt like I had been scammed. An experience I would never have expected to have at a service oriented 5-star hotel. That experience burned me so bad I'm not sure I'd go back, despite having had a wonderful stay on the first night. My advice - ask if there will be a conference while you're there. If so, check out the new Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: pal56
Reviews.Content: My wife, 8 year old son and I had a wonderful stay at the Mandarin Oriental on January 4, 2005. Stunning architecture. We had a deluxe (five star) room with a great view of Biscayne Bay. The room was well appointed, stylish, clean with a comfortable bed, and large bathroom with a picture window into the bedroom. Bellman/valet service was excellent (we checked out at 4 am to catch an early flight and the car was waiting). The waiters at the resturant and at the pool provided prompt and pleasant service. The infinity pool and sand beach area are marvelous. The front desk service was friendly but below average for a hotel of this quality (computer was down at check-out and room needed a 30 minute "inspection" before we could complete somewhat early 1 pm check-in). The hotel is ideally located (on a small key) for access to the downtown Miami business district, but it's several miles from South Beach and Miami Beach. One negative is that during rush hour (4pm to 6:30 pm) traffic out of the downtown area is very heavy...it took us nearly 35 minutes just to get to I-95 at 5:45 pm on a Tuesday evening and almost 2 hours to get to Pro Players football stadium for the Orange Bowl.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the Mandarin during New Year and were really looking forward to our stay. On entering the Lobby we foung there to be no atmosphere and the hotel had a very corporate feel about it. When checking in we asked waht was happening and were told "Nothing". We were also informed that we would not be able to eat in any of the restaurants on New Year and would have to eat in our room, not exactly the New Year we had in mind! We went on to buy tickets for elsewhere only to later be told that there was a going to be a New Years Eve cocktail reception, but when returning from our party at the gorgeous Delano Hotel we knew we had made the right decision! We waited two hours for a pizza and salad at lunch time and consistently waited over an hour for room service, even for a pot of hot water. We were charged to use the internet which we were able to use for free in the Shore CLub and Delano, which we had previously stayed in and a short phone call home cost us $90! On the plus side, the staff were very polite, the rooms were big and comfortable and after complaining to the hotel they did refund us the cost of one night, but in general the hotel just did not live up to expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: bradowpc
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in North America. Amazing rooms, amazing workout facility, breathtaking views of downtown Miami. Staff was friendly, fast, and responsive. Azul restuarant is outstanding. Even saw a few models and celebs down by the pool! This place is totally over the top. Well worth the expense. You're better off to ignore the negative reviewers on this -- most were probably just upset about spending more money than they could afford in the first place to stay here and had unrealistic expectations -- I could find no fault with this property whatsoever (and that's very rare in my case).

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and full of attitude...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during New Years, paid thru the nose and was treated to the following: (1) Valet lost keys to our car on a Saturday night and told me Hertz was closed until Monday unless I went to the airport - myself by cab. Then we (myself, girlfriend and 2 other colleagues) were suggested to take a cab until Monday morning and I was to pick up the costs of both cab and the car rental because they "were too busy". (2) The spa messed up our his/her in room massage scheduled 3 weeks in advance and we were told to book the next day "but in our spa since we don't have availability for in room massages anymore". (3) Housekeeping was sorry it was 8PM and the maid hasn't cleaned the room - they have other guests and events (not rooms) to attend to... towels did show up 2 hours later after a 3rd call but the room was never cleaned. (4) Concierge screwed up our New Years Eve reservations so badly we were in a cab (thanks to #1 above), going to a club they never followed thru on putting us on the guest list for (even though we were told it was taken care of 3 weeks in advance) so we showed up and had to wait an hour to get in after midnight. This year the same blunders seemed apparant when they couldn't confirm having any reservation for a suite and they were now sold out. As a result I am going to a boutique hotel in South Beach that has already confirmed in writing all the clubs, hotels and restaurants I wanted. I just don't understand why the Miami MO can't figure out how to act like an MO. Having stayed at 18 of the top Conde Nast hotels around the world and 4 other MO's, I found the staff rude and lacking in customer service. Overall, the location is good for business travelers but lacking for visitors/explorers. I will admit the rooms are nice with all the amenities and deserving of a 4, not 5, star rating given their narrow orientation but people, an overall 5 out of 5 is absurd for the money they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Great, Staff service quite cold and unprepared”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, I agree with most of the reviews on trip advisor that the hotel grounds and facilities are excellent. The staff however, could use a lesson or two on customer service and manners. In my opinion it's the service you receive that seperates the high end hotels from all the rest. The front desk clerks and concierge were of no help and were quite snobbish. We were in town for business, unfortunately during the time Hurricane Jeanne was due to hit north of Miami about 60 miles. Definitely not the time of year you want to be in Miami, and I realize we were lucky we didn't have a home in danger down there. I realize that it's not their choice to evacuate but when we were told at 10 am that we had to evacuate by noon and that they were not able to help in arranging an alternate hotel you realize you're not getting 5 star customer service. They gave us the names of hotels that they knew damn well didn't have any rooms available. Basically wasted our time on the phone when we should have been packing up to leave. I called down to the concierge and told him it would be well worth his time to help find us another hotel on the mainland and he basically blew me off with "nothing I can do." No apologies or an attempt at being courteous. We later found out that other hotels on the water had reciprical arrangements with mainland hotels throughout the Miami area. You would think that a hotel that touts itself as Miami's finest, would be a bit more prepared for events such as this. You would expect this low level service from a cheaper hotel, not a highly touted 5 star establishment. Bottom line is, if you want to spend a lot of money and don't care about the poor service you receive this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry this review is so late but just found this site. Stayed here for two nights on our anniversary in November 2003. This Hotel is amazing from the moment you enter the lobby and the room was spectacular. We had an amazing view of the bay and city. The Spa, according to my wife was next to none. She did a full day treatment and was rejuvinated. The restaurant in the Hotel called O is mouthwatering. The concierge was a great help in assisting me to get a bouquet of flowers for my wife and they were stunning. Oh, and if you want to bask in the sun there is a private beach and the pool is great. Or, you can do like I did and find your hammock in the shade and just relax. This hotel is a must if your coming to Miami and it's about 5 minutes to the Port (cruise ships)and approximately 20 minutes from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “UNMATCHED IN MIAMI....AND FEW MATCH IT ELSEWHERE”
Reviews.Author: klazzy
Reviews.Content: As someone who has spent between 100-125 nights a year in hotels around the world for the past 30 years, it's a pleasure to recommend a U.S. property that reaches beyond the expectations of both business and high-end leisure travelers. If there are faults to be found with anything at this hotel, they are so minor as to go unnoticed in the fully enveloping friendliness that is projected by a well-trained staff. The rooms, the food and beverage service, and most of all the employees are top-notch. And having stayed in Miami many times, that is more than a compliment, as it is a market fairly devoid of properly trained hospitality crews. Bravo Mandarin. You've earned the accolades.
